name: University Group
review_text:
Renters and parents PLEASE do not make your worst choice ever to start your campus life with this shameful leasing company.

1) They accepted a new resident at the VERY SAME day when I moved out. Do you think that they will carefully examine the condition of the room? For me, I left the room as the condition I got in. But I bet not every person will clean as much as I did. Then, the defects or messes left by the previous one will be your responsible now.

2) Your deposit will be ROBBED. Once again, they let the new resident to move in the VERY SAME DAY. They still charged me $230 for cleaning and $160 for painting. I have never heard in my life to let people to live where the painting is just finished within a few hours. They are trying to charge you as much as they can with non-sense reasons.

These guys are just ready to steal inexperienced renters. Please, please be carful with this company.

P.S They are deleting my review. What a kind people!!

Updates.
The next tenant turned out to be one of my friends, and she said she could not see or smell any evidence of new painting.
And I upload the photos of the room condition when I left. Please note that they charged me $230 for cleaning fee.

name: University Group
review_text:
Maintenance has always been very prompt and helpful at my current building! George has done most of the repairs in my apartment, and he was very attentive to my concerns and repaired everything well. Overall, a very positive experience with maintenance.

1 star off is for the experience I've had trying to get my security deposit back and missing furniture for a month in a past apartment unit (no chairs).
owner_answer:
Hi Sylvia, we appreciate you taking the time to give us a review.
We're happy that our maintenance staff George was of great assistance to you, and that he was very prompt.
Thank you for your complimentary remarks about our maintenance performance.
Your feedback inspires us to keep going and rest assured that we will continue to surpass expectations.

Regarding your concern with your security deposit, we are sorry that you had unexpected charges. 
As for the missing furniture in your unit, we were not aware of this issue. We apologize for the inconvenience caused by this. 
Was this reported to our staff?
However, we can assure you that the issue has been resolved and chairs are in the unit now. 

Once again thank you, Sylvia!
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text:
Dear University Group:

I hope this email finds you well. I am writing to discuss the deductions made from my security deposit for my tenancy at 1107 S Fourth, Unit 3 during the last academic year.

Upon reviewing the itemized list of deductions, I noted the following charges:

Paint and repair: $400
Cleaning: $880
Item Removal: $350
Carpet cleaning: $205

The total deductions amount (1835 dollars) is a substantial portion of my security deposit. My roommate and I have not caused any damage to the property nor have we left a mess for you to clean. As a tenant, I am entitled to transparency regarding these charges. I request the provision of receipts for each service that was allegedly carried out. This is not only to verify the costs but also to ensure that these services were conducted by legitimate and operational businesses.

Having consulted with my school's legal services, I've been informed that I have the right to request and review these receipts. To expedite the resolution of this matter, I propose two options:

1, Kindly provide me with the respective receipts for the aforementioned services. (I'll send it to my attorney to validate the legitimacy of the company and its service)
2, Alternatively, I am willing to accept a refund of 80% of my original security deposit, and we can consider the matter resolved.

Should I not receive the requested receipts or the proposed refund within a reasonable timeframe, I want to inform you that I am prepared to escalate the matter. While I genuinely hope to resolve this amicably, I will not hesitate to seek legal recourse through my school's attorney to ensure my rights as a tenant are upheld.

I trust that we can come to a satisfactory resolution promptly. Thank you for your understanding and cooperation.

Warm regards,
Peter Chen
owner_answer:
Peter, thank you for your detailed and thoughtful review. 
Your thorough approach is appreciated. 
We are really sorry that you had unexpected charges on your security deposit. 

However, as you’ll see in the move-out video below, significant professional cleaning and prep was necessary to make the unit ready for the next tenant:  
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1rtBREwYHQJm4kq9mE4ehLJOJ046YIrTo/view?usp=share_link

Again, we’re really sorry that these charges were unexpected. 
At the same time, we have a high standard for cleanliness and we do provide all of our tenants with cleaning guidelines before turning in the keys that were not followed in this case. Therefore, the charges were necessary. 

Should you have any other questions, we would be happy to discuss this with you further, Peter. 
Please email us at leasing@ugroupcu.com. We look forward to hearing from you. 

We wish you all the best. 

-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text:
They will steal your security deposit. I left the apartment very clean and yet they cut  715 out of 830. They try to charge you as much as possible that is the way they are running their business.

Edit: what exactly are you referring to in the video, a clean apartment with rush and holes in the ceiling that you have done. your maintenance guys dig all this holes to fix the water leakage of your old expiring building, and you charge me to fix it for the next tenant?  715 dollars from my own money to fix your celling?
owner_answer:
Samar, thanks for taking time to leave a review. 
We’re really sorry you had unexpected charges against your security deposit.

However, once we surveyed the apartment after move-out we were made aware that significant cleaning would be necessary to make the unit ready for the next tenant. 
Please see the move-out video below. 

Move-out video: 
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1yttiQIiMFQNHdFtrHFAmH3nDZmDvP9U4/view?usp=sharing

If you have any questions, please reach out to us at leasing@ugroupcu.com. 

We wish you all the best. 
-The University Group

name: University Group
review_text:
Interesting how they aren’t replying to the comments here about security deposit. UGroup, please explain how so many of your renters got their deposit stolen from you.

I only received 10% of my deposit refunded back. I left the apartment in the same condition I left every apartment I have lived in, where I usually get my full deposit back.

The washers in my building are broken since last year. Whenever asked, they always ignore this question and refuse to give any timeline. We still don’t know when the washers will be functioning again.

I can’t recommend this place to anyone. RUN.
owner_answer:
Hi Fiona, thank you for taking the time to give us a review.

We apologize that you only got 10% back on your security deposit. However, we do have high standards for cleanliness, and we give cleaning guidelines to our tenants before handing over the keys. Our move-out guidelines can be found here: https://ugroupcu.com/move-in-move-out/ 
In this case, the guidance was not followed.
Therefore, the charges were necessary to get the unit ready for the next tenant. 

As for your concern regarding the washer, we had an unfortunate situation with our washer provider in which our purchase of brand new machines went unresponded to for 3 months despite our follow-ups with them. As such, we share your frustration. However, we sincerely apologize for the inconvenience caused by this. Our maintenance has now installed new washers and switched providers. 

Once again, we are very sorry, Fiona, for the inconvenience that you encountered during your time with us.

If you have any questions, please email us at Leasing@UGroupCU.com. 

- The University Group

name: University Group
review_text: New students - please do some research before signing a lease with University Group. More specifically, search in the UIUC subreddit. The maintenance people hung up on me twice on two different occasions when I tried to urge them to give me a timeline for crucial repairs (peeling dry wall in my bathroom and no functional on site washers). Very rude and unprofessional. I also heard countless stories about them charging tenants exorbitant amounts of money (most of the security deposit and sometimes more) after move out. Trash often piles up around the trash receptacles outside the building.

name: University Group
review_text: Experience was just average for an expensive luxury apartment. Expected the cleaning charges but not the painting charges. Feel like I got taken for a ride just bc they had the security deposit and could do what they wanted. The best words to describe my experience with university group is disappointing and definitely underwhelming.
owner_answer:
Patrick, thanks for taking the time to let us know about your experience.

In the case of the security deposit, unfortunately, painting and cleaning were necessary to get the unit ready for the next tenant. You can see this evidenced in the move-out video here: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1QeQWbComX_68mZ5P1aJhsYEArwBaYGZp/view?usp=share_link

We're sorry to hear that your experience with us didn't live up to your expectations. Aside from the security deposit, what do you think could be improved? We'd love to hear any specific feedback you might have.
Please email us at Leasing@UGroupCU.com with the subject "Honest Feedback" and we look forward to hearing from you. 

Thank you for choosing the University Group, Patrick, and we wish you all the best.

-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text: I lived in a University Group apartment for three years. The maintenance was fast. Good location. Close to campus and grocery store. However, I can't really understand why I lost more than 200 dollars security deposit even though I did a complete cleaning before moving out (even with the help of a professional custodian). I believe I deeply cleaned my carpet and I'm not sure why they charged me with wall painting, either.

name: University Group
review_text:
tl;dr: be prepared to lose all (or even more) of your security deposit after you have put a lot of effort in cleaning the entire unit. I recommend MHM Properties; I personally had good experience with them.

UPDATE: We eventually got back $185 painting and $135 for cleaning, but that is only because we have fought with them over a month. They charged us for food debris left in kitchen cabinets, but we have cleaned every single cabinet even those ones above the microwave/fridge that we had never used during the whole lease term. In their videos, there is no proof of food stains/debris, etc. We have to show them our video where I literally opened every cabinet and show each one is thoroughly cleaned (INSANE, RIGHT?). They also charged us for floor cleaning fees in the bedrooms, but the bedrooms are ALL carpets, and they have already charged $175 for carpet cleaning. They claimed that carpet cleaning is only for steaming carpet, and floor cleaning means vacuuming. I dont why they can double charged you for the same service. We did vacuum the carpets (even though we knew we are charged with carpet cleaning fees), and there are even vacuum traces left on the carpet in the photos shown <- This is the only reason we got money back on this. I guess they are somewhat reasonable, but it is still very painful to put so much effort in cleaning, take photos and videos of literally everything (including base board), argue with them (they respond once a week...), and only get back a fraction of your well-deserved money.

We also got charged for $175 carpeting, $220 cleaning and $185 painting out of security deposit when we moved out. I have attached some photos of the move-out condition; we also took some videos including but not limited to the interior of fridge, microwave, oven, cabinet, closet, windows, mirrors, sinks, etc. It is actually even cleaner than move-in condition since we moved in early and this was the new construction.
We have no issue with carpet cleaning fees as we were aware of it prior to signing the lease. It’s just interesting to point out that the estimate costs of carpet cleaning on the lease varies from the size of rooms, but most of my friends got charged $175 regardless of the unit.
There is no detail of what is cleaned, which wall needs to be re-painted on the invoice. I heard that some people got charged with carpet cleaning fees but they didn’t even have carpet inside their units, so I wildly guess they just sent the same invoice to a certain group of people regardless of each tenant’s unit condition. I requested a move-out video taken from their inspectors, so far no replies.

We also experienced many other issues people mentioned in their reviews: we signed an unit which was planned to finish remodeling before the early move-in date (and was confirmed by the leasing agent), but it didn’t due to COVID. We eventually got rearranged to this nicer apartment. When we moved in, there was no furniture and not cleaned at all. A bunch of glue-like stuff and paint stains were on the floor/island/bathtub and splinters/dusts from construction were everywhere. Our doors are not properly installed and cannot be fixed by the maintenance team, so we cannot close the door without making noise. We got our bar stools one and half month after move-in date and we never get the TV stand as promised on the lease and in the email conversations.

We have wall painting damage under the electricity box only because the unit above us decided to flood their restroom with water, and somehow we (and one of the maintenance staff, I thank him for dealing with this issue very promptly) are affected by that and had to lose over a half night of sleep on Sunday midnight, due to some flaws of the building structure. We lost electricity the whole night including the fridge and other major appliances. Water keeps dripping down into the electric box; it was scary (see attached photo).
owner_answer:
Linz, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We are so sorry that these charges were unexpected. We can certainly understand how these issues must have been frustrating.

We are known for our quick maintenance service. I'm glad that we had someone on-site quickly for the flooding issue. I am very sorry that you experienced challenges with your unit. Our maintenance team does the very best they can to resolve issues in a timely manner.

As for the security deposit, we have a high standard for the cleanliness of our apartment units. The units must be cleaned according to the move-out procedures on our website. ( https://ugroupcu.com/move-in-move-out/ ) These procedures are the same steps that we go through to make sure the apartment is clean enough for a new renter or it must be cleaned.

In regards to the carpet cleaning fee in apartments that do not have carpet, on rare occasions, our system incorrectly charges tenants. In those cases, the tenants are refunded the carpet cleaning fee.

We take making our units ready for the next tenant very seriously.
Once again, we are sorry that the charges were unexpected.
Our team aims to serve our tenants with a high standard of excellence.

We would love to speak with you about this to see how we might improve.
Please email us at Account.Inquiries@UGroupCU.com.
We look forward to hearing from you.
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text: My 500 security deposit wasn’t enough? They charged us 1100 for “cleaning”service and threatened to send us to collections if we didn’t pay an additional 250 on top of security deposit. Don’t make the same mistake, sign to a legit place

name: University Group
review_text: Not recommended. Their building is bad at soundproofing. They only leave the noise issue to the tenants to solve. Providing a quiet living environment for every tenant is their basic responsibility. However, they tried to make the issue with their building the conflicts between tenants and do nothing about the issues, expecting tenants to simply get used to the noisy surroundings. If you really want to live in their apartments, only top-floor units would be a good choice.
owner_answer:
Hello, we appreciate you taking the time to leave us a review here. 
We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience caused by noise disruption during your time with us. We do everything we can to provide tenants with a quiet environment. 

However, it can be extremely challenging. We do enforce quiet hours and take action against those who do not follow quiet hours. We do our very best. Unfortunately, we cannot stop all noise disturbances. 

Thank you for your comment on soundproofing, we have taken note of that feedback.
Again, we are very sorry for the inconvenience this may have caused you.  
Your feedback helps us to improve and be the best that we can for our tenants.

- The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text: Make sure to take lots of pictures and a very detailed video of every thing in the apartment before you move in, or else they will rob you of you deposit. When I say take a video, I highly suggest it to be at least an hour long video. For the tiniest thing that seems odd make sure to record it, or else they will fault you on something you didn’t even do.
owner_answer:
Hello, Luciano. Thank you for taking the time to write a review for us.
We're sorry that you had unexpected charges to your security deposit. 

Because we have high standards for cleanliness, all tenants are provided guidelines before giving them  the keys. You may find our move-out guidelines here: https://ugroupcu.com/move-in-move-out/.
And in this case, the guidance was not followed.
You can see the move-out video here: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1wqmzYN24eBc-rNCAM4olipmxox-AObSD/view?usp=sharing
Therefore, the charges were necessary to prepare the unit for the next tenant. 
  
Should you have any questions please email us at Leasing@UGroupCU.com. 
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text: They will take your whole security deposit and charge more for "damages". On top they didn't finish the apartment on time and forced us to move to temporary housing that wasn't clean and smelled horrible. After this, when we moved in to this new apartment, it was dirty with dirt and screws in drawers, unfinished and had no internet. Sign elsewhere.

name: University Group
review_text: A few weeks ago, maintenance came in to eradicate bug issues. If that wasn’t bad enough, they stole $50 out of my friends wallet. Didn’t know they hired thieves. Been trying to resolve this issue and have yet to hear back from them. What a train wreck.
owner_answer:
Hi Leyla, we appreciate you for leaving us a review here. We are very sorry in regards to the inconvenience of the bug issues in your friend's apartment. 

As for your concern regarding your friend's lost money, we can assure you that no one on our team took it. However, we're very sorry for the inconvenience of its loss somehow. 

If have any further concerns, please email us at Leasing@UGroupCU.com and we look forward to hearing from you on this, Leyla. 

-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text: I have had many issues with this company, they failed to recognize my concerns on multiple occasions. This leasing company always has issues with maintenance, it’s the middle of winter and my apartment is 63 degrees Fahrenheit and will not go up, I also have witnessed the maintenance men yell at residents and be aggressive towards people living here, my car was also on the verge of being towed in the spot that was given to me in the parking garage. Someone’s bright idea was to tell me they’d cancel my parking lease as a solution which is something I never said I wanted to happen? All i wanted was for their mistakes to be corrected and acknowledged by them and also apologized to but that was too much to ask for. There were ladders and wrenches and other tools scattered around the parking garage where people are trying to enter and exit that made it impossible to leave. I had to physically move a ladder that was behind my car in order for me to leave? Totally unacceptable in my eyes which has ruined my experience of living here, and if you are questioning whether or not you should sign a lease with UGroup, I advise you otherwise and do not sign a lease here. These people can’t even tell you they’re sorry when they make a mistake or recognize any of their own mistakes, only one person who to my knowledge is named Josh has been helpful to me out of the entire leasing office. So thank you Josh. Anyway, nonetheless I am a very patient and understanding person, but this company and its employees have pushed me beyond my limits and my capacity to be able to put up with these shenanigans that have been progressively gotten worse over a the span of a couple of months.
owner_answer:
Hello, thank you for taking the time to leave a review. We sincerely apologize for the poor experience you had. We understand that maintenance, temperature control, and parking issues can be incredibly frustrating and we regret that we were unable to address your concerns in a timely and satisfactory manner. It is never our intention to make things more difficult for our residents and we are disappointed that we fell short of your expectations.

We take all complaints and concerns seriously and we assure you that steps have been taken to address the issues that you have raised. We are committed to providing a safe, comfortable and enjoyable living experience for all of our residents, and it is clear that we have failed to do so in your case.

We understand that you have had issues with our maintenance staff and we apologize for any aggressive or unprofessional behavior that you may have witnessed. We have taken steps to address this issue, and we will continue to monitor our maintenance staff to ensure that they are providing the highest level of service to our residents.

We also understand that you had issue with parking and that your car was on the verge of being towed. We apologize for this inconvenience and we will ensure that such mistake will not happen again. Parking space 26 has been made available for your current parking needs. 

We understand that you were not satisfied with the solution offered to you regarding parking and we apologize for any confusion or frustration that this may have caused. We want to assure you that we take all feedback seriously and we are committed to making improvements to better serve our residents.

We would like to extend our apologies to you and we assure you that we will work hard to regain your trust and make things right. We are here to listen and to help, and we invite you to reach out to us so that we can discuss your concerns further and find a resolution that works for you.

We’re happy that you had a good experience with Josh. Please know that we would be happy to help you with any concerns that you may have.
Again, we apologize for the poor experience you had and we hope that you will give us the opportunity to make it right.
Feel free to reach out to us at Leasing@UGroupCU.com.

Respectfully, 
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text: Today is November 7, 2023, and my roommates and I moved out on August 3, 2023, but we have not yet received our security deposit back. Please lease with University Group if you have too much money and don't know where to spend, I'm pretty sure they can help you handle your money:))
owner_answer:
Stef, thanks for leaving a review. We're very sorry that you had unexpected charges. 

However, in cases such as this, preparation was necessary to make the unit ready for the next tenant. We provide move-out instructions for tenants to follow on our website: https://ugroupcu.com/move-in-move-out/. In this case, the move-out instructions were not followed and the charges were incurred. 
Again, we're very sorry for the inconvenience caused by these charges.

In this case, please reach out to us as we'd like a chance to make this right by better understanding your situation and finding the best solution for you. Please email us at Leasing@UGroupCU.com. 

We look forward to hearing from you, Stef. 
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text: Renters and parents beware (parent's perspective) Very shady, rude and unprofessional office management and run down building. 1) Students couldn't move in until mid-month, but were required to pay the full month and when I inquired, all the person kept saying was "we bill in 12 equal payments", she wouldn't even acknowledge that they weren't allowed to move in for the first full month, 2) elevator was broken on move-in date and they wouldn't give a date it would be fixed. Imagine carrying everything up 5 flights in a gross stairwell in August, 3) while it's listed as fully furnished, someone didn't get a desk chair and they said "not everyone gets a desk chair, you'll have to bring one." They seem to be taking advantage of inexperienced renters and if you as a parent are not on the lease they will not discuss anything with you...but will take your $$. Look elsewhere. The website makes it seem nicer than it is. P.S. I moved my daughter in on the 16th so no, the elevator was not working and still no answer as to why they had to pay a full month for Aug. if the move-in date was the 19th.
owner_answer:
Sara, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. First off, we're very sorry that you had these negative experiences. 

Our records indicate that the elevator was working on move-in day on August 15 and that the lease started on August 19. If you moved in before move-in day, we apologize for the inconvenience as the elevator did require routine maintenance. 

If possible, we'd like a chance to make this right. We can get a desk chair to you ASAP if you can please email us at Maintenance@UGroupCU.com. Again, we're very sorry for the inconvenience. 

We look forward to speaking with you, Sara. 
Have a great day! 

-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text:
DO NOT RENT FROM THIS GROUP!!!  THEY WILL ROB YOUR CHILDREN BLIND!!!  WATER LEAKING FROM THE ROOF. NO HOT WATER- NO HEAT.
This was a first time renting experience for our children.  They were taken advantage of.  As parents were unable to help. We were not on the lease.
Did walk thru after move out.There were no issues.  My daughter received an email today, that they were going to keep half of the security deposit, 600+ dollars for normal wear and tear, and the cost to repaint for the next set of tenants. The staff are U of I students.  And they are taught to rob their fellow class mates.  To be rude, and hung up on .   They should be ashamed of themselves.  People treated people this way.  This is not how professional people work.  They are learning skills that will get them nowhere. Maintenance went into their   apt over the break when no one is there- changed the heat settings/fan settings- without tenants' knowledge. Once the bill comes it's triple the amount of money.  And no one is even there. They were home on break.  Again, no response from leasing group.  Bill had to be paid.
Plenty of other rental buildings to go rent from.  Spare your child the trauma.  THIS GROUP WILL ROB YOU OF AS MUCH MONEY AS THEY CAN. !!!  They are unreachable.  Made several trips from Chicago to see someone face to face.  Impossible!.  They intimidated our children.  INFURIATING!! And they wouldn't dare speak to us as parents, because they know we won't be intimidated.  Their favorite saying.. "you are not on the lease". I can only imagine how many times they have been sued. !! Most of us walk away.. Lesson learned.. Our kids - who pay this rent with their own money, are traumatized.  I live in a big city. And have never come across such low life people, preying on young college kids.
You can never speak to management, just students.  Emails never answered.  Just pay them their money, or they will continue to add on charges. Maybe if enough people write reviews, which I see there are quite a lot .  People will keep away. I only wished that we had read them, prior to our kids signing a lease. This building is under code.  So many issues.. Check the city records... People get found out eventually. BEWARE...

name: University Group
review_text:
The WORST rental company I have ever seen!
$850 deposit and I only got about $50 back!

They said it was paid for cleaning fee.
It was pretty clean when I moved out. I had another cleaning company clean it. How did you charge me ~$800 for cleaning?!
owner_answer:
Hello Haik, thank you for taking the time to leave us a review.
We are very sorry for the inconvenience you experienced regarding your security deposit. 

We apologize for any unexpected charges to your security deposit. We have rigorous cleanliness requirements, and tenants are provided with the rules before being given keys. Our move-out criteria may be found at https://ugroupcu.com/move-in-move-out/.

And in this case, the instructions were not followed.
As a result, the fees were required to prepare the unit for the next tenant.
We apologize once more, Haik

Please reach out to us as we'd like a chance to discuss this with you, please contact us via email at leasing@UGroupCU.com. 

-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text: !!ATT!! This is an evil organization who charge their tenants with fraudulent, bogus, fictitious expenses when terminating your lease with them. They are a monopoly throughout the university and therefore they believe they can charge whatever they want to students as they wont have time for dispute. I was a foolish to be a tenant under them for 3 yrs. During my last year, I was naive moving into a more expensive place under their management thinking the service would be better. Boy was I wrong. People need to be warned about their abuse over tenants looking for a decent place to stay. #painting #cleaning #security deposit

name: University Group
review_text: I didnt get my security deposit yet, and they charge me over 200 dollars for carpet for my apartment that doesnt even have carpet. I lost 130 dollar for cleaning fee but I did a full cleaning before I move out. I will contact them and pursuit legal action if necessary.

name: University Group
review_text: These people are crooks. I got a collection for 7k+ in fraudulent charges. I was a co-signer and wasn’t held responsible after the lease was up. This was during the pandemic. The person that was living there had several allies on help with rent being paid
owner_answer:
Meleka, thank you for leaving us feedback here. 
We're sure these charges were stressful and unexpected. 

However, the charges were due to three major breaches of our policies: 
1) You continued to live in the apartment past the lease end date
2) Belongings were left in the apartment seven months after the lease end date.
3) Your vehicle was left on the premises seven months after the lease end date. 

Due to these issues:
1) No one else could move into the apartment and we had to charge for rent for those seven months
2) The vehicle had to be towed 

Furthermore, we have it on record that you did sign the lease, and our policies were made known to you. 
Again, we're sure that these events were stressful and challenging but because there were no payments made and the belongings were not moved out to remedy these breaches of policy, we had no other choice. 
As such, the total balance of $5,704.25 was sent to collections.

If you have any questions please email us at leasing@ugroupcu.com. 

We wish you all the best, Meleka. 

-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text: I lived at their Stoughton st. apartments in Urbana between 2020-2021. I have nothing but good things to say about this place and company. Best in every way - amenities, price, location, response time, leasing, maintenance, sublease assistance. I wish I remember the maintenance man’s name, he went out of his way to fix unusual problems in my apartment that sometimes I created,, like losing a SIM card in the couch. Finding furnished apartments in the US is rare so I was lucky that Urbana has it and Ugroup did a good job.
owner_answer:
Hi Pooja, thank you for giving us a review here. We're so glad that you enjoyed our amenities. We're glad that we were able to promptly assist you with finding your SIM card in the couch!
We are thrilled that you have had a great experience with our maintenance staff, our team is working hard to exceed your expectations.

Once again we are thankful for your kind words to us and thank you for staying with us.

-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text:
This is one of the nicest looking remodeled campus properties for the price-point with modern appliances and modern room finishes; however, modern split system A/C units require proper maintenance which is beyond a student's daily activities or capacity.

This rental unit was delivered with the A/C unit in inoperable condition-- with a blinking error code, dripping condensate, and black gunk in the blowers (Before and after cleaning by renter).

Hopefully this unit can be easily repaired-- or replaced (Panasonic CS-E9RKUAW Wall Mounted Heat Pump, Item #: 15004224MFR SKU: CS-E9RKUAW $857.11)

name: University Group
review_text: Dear Parents and Students, Please don't try to rent any of the apartments in UNIVERSITY GROUP, they act like thieves and take your entire deposit when you check out, no matter how clean your room is! Please do not rent any of their apartments! !!!!!!!!!!!

name: University Group
review_text: Just moved into this apartment and they have been phenomenal with my maintenance requests.  My hot water was not running to my shower/tub as well as my sinks.  In addition, my oven was not heating up and my stove tops were off as well.  I submitted a request in the morning and it was completed by the time I came home from work that evening.  Quick and efficient by the maintenance team.

name: University Group
review_text:
Their maintenance service is pretty good. Javier in particular is excellent!
Overall, just about satisfied with the renting experience.
owner_answer:
Prajna, we're glad that our maintenance services were to your satisfaction. What kept your review from being 5 stars? We'd like a chance to make this right. Please contact us at leasing@ugroupcu.com.
We look forward to hearing from you! 
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text: I forgot very crucial documents while moving out from an apartment of Ugroup. They graciously cooperated with me via email, checked move out videos, sent their stuff multiple times to the apartment to find the documents. Thanks a lot Meg and John!

name: University Group
review_text:
I would avoid this company at all costs. If you want to know exactly how horrible they are, look at UIUC's Reddit page and search up this rental company, and you will see all the ways they try to scam you. They don’t give you your security deposit back at the end, and if they do, it’s mainly bogus charges with lists of companies that don’t actually exist.

They tell you different prices for different apartments, and never have I heard of any company on campus charging the TENANTS a monthly fee to access their online portal. In Rick H’s words, “to make rent payments, request maintenance, and receive important dialog from the leasing office in regards to scheduled maintenance, showings, emergencies, etc” a fee you can’t even waive if you decided to do these things in person or via email.

Also take into account that these companies give students an incentive just to leave a “good review” or “5 stars” so I would be cautious when looking at those.

name: University Group
review_text: The WORST agency EVER, Never return the deposit, i have cleaned my apartment a week before I leave, they still charge me 500 dollar, 440 repaint fee( I don’t know what to repaint)
owner_answer:
Hello Jianhua, thanks for leaving us feedback here. 

We're sorry that you had unexpected painting charges. As you can see from the move-out video, painting was necessary to make the unit ready for the next tenant. 
Move-out video: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ZmMG7-NtxqK5NLBk8c_OO4oMKYnBFGfR/view?usp=sharing

Again, we're sorry about the unexpected painting charges but they were unfortunately necessary. 
If you have any questions, please email us at Leasing@UGroupCU.com and we'd be happy to answer your questions. 

Thank you, Jianhua.
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text:
Absolute thieves! Do not lease with them!

Apartment had black mold on windows, and maintenance told me there was nothing to be done.

The previous tenant left furniture and personal belongings behind and it was made my responsibility to clean. In addition, the sinks were filthy upon move in and so badly clogged with hair that not more than a couple drops of water could drain.

In addition, the carpet smelled musty and had clumps of hair in some spots. As someone who has worked cleaning carpets professionally in the past, this was most definitely not cleaned correctly. It was very clear that their “professional” cleaning services weren’t thorough in any regard.

Drywall was damaged and had signs of leaking when I moved in and after noting it, it was promised to be repaired. Not once was it addressed in the entire 12 months of the lease.

Multiple water leaks that destroyed personal belongings and they left open holes in ceiling for the remaining duration of the lease.

And I wouldn’t recommend parking your car near their structures. A piece of the ceiling came off and fell on my car and they acknowledged that it was a problem that they were aware of, but didn’t fix.

In the winter they took an absurd amount of time to ever clear the snow, even when all other apartments were cleared, University Group simply kept saying they had so many properties and that they were going to get to us eventually.

And of course to top it all off, they are withholding almost $500 of the security deposit for damages that do not exist, and in fact they caused themselves. While trying to contact them they are extremely hard to get any response from and very rude over the phone.

If you want a nice place to live, without mold and constant maintenance nightmares, look elsewhere!!!!

And if you’ve already made the mistake of leasing with them and lost a big chunk of your security deposit, I suggest contacting the university student legal services!

UPDATE: If you get your security deposit check, look at the invoices. They are using these companies to make fake invoices, it is clear as day!

EDIT: Notice in their reply they avoided addressing all of the other things besides their cleaning fees. They are a dishonest company, it’s very clear. They hit me with every charge and walked back on some once I pressed them.
owner_answer:
Adrian, thank you for taking time to give us feedback. 
We are so sorry that you experienced unexpected charges. 
We can understand your frustration and the feedback you've provided is helpful. However, charges were necessary in this case. Please see below. 

We have a high standard for the cleanliness of our apartment units. The units must be fully cleaned according to the move-out procedures on our website: https://ugroupcu.com/move-in-move-out/
These procedures are the same steps that we go through to make sure the apartment is clean enough for a new renter or the unit must be professionally cleaned. In this case, cleaning was still necessary to make the unit move-in ready for the next tenant. You can see the move-out condition video here: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1uzkUHECi9pOCcs6m37ObSxPNy9U09D2l/view?usp=sharing

Feel free to reach out to us with any questions. 
Please email us at Account.Inquiries@UGroupCU.com.
We look forward to hearing from you, Adrian.
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text: This company is so unprofessional. They hang up on me when I try to call and ask a question about my lease. This company uses college students to make a quick buck. They do not care for any of their tenants or their safety. The only helpful department has been maintenance.
owner_answer:
Abby, thank you for taking the time to leave a review. We're really sorry that you've had a negative experience with us. We'd love a chance to make this right. Could you reach out to us please? Please email us at leasing@ugroupcu.com. We look forward to hearing from you regarding this issue. 
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text:
Multiple of my packages have been stolen over the months. They refuse to put cameras and their communications about this have been horrible. It’s basically “not our problem, call the police” type response.

I received a package vie fedex this Monday and asked if they could pick it up for me since it’s valuable and I will not be in town to do so myself. I even offered to send an email releasing them of all and any liability. They refused to do so. Surely enough, by the time I came back to my apartment on Wednesday, someone already tore open the package, stole the content and left the opened bag in the lobby.

Thanks UGroup. Don’t even respond to this email with the fake “we take reviews seriously” because your actions have proven otherwise.
owner_answer:
Hello Haris, it's a real bummer that your package got taken. That is the worst. We're really sorry this happened. 

As a policy, we don't put packages into apartments due to security and liability reasons. 
We also do not have enough staff members to manage package delivery effectively. The building that you are living in is a secure building so someone must have stolen it from inside of the secure building. 

The fact is that cameras are often not feasible which is why not all buildings have them. Furthermore, in order for the cameras to be effective, you have to be able to see the face of the person (most people stealing packages wear masks). 

Nonetheless, package theft is an issue for every apartment building (we've talked with several others) and it is very hard to prevent and prosecute. 
This is why Amazon, FedEx, etc, have lockers and pick-up points.
 Again, it's extremely unfortunate that this happened. 
We really wish there was more we could do to help you, Haris. 
Respectfully, 
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text: Nick was very nice and approachable when I reached out about multiple properties. The information that he sent was extremely detailed. Nick responded to EVERY single question very kindly. I am excited to be renting with University Group this coming fall. A huge improvement from the current leasing company I've been renting from.
owner_answer:
Amanda, we're so glad that you enjoyed working with our leasing staff member, Nick. We work hard to provide stellar customer service. Welcome aboard and thank you for choosing University Group. We appreciate you leaving a review to tell us about your experience! Please follow us on social media! @UniversityGroupCU Have a great day! 
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text:
This is the best company I have ever leased with. The staff was very attentive about any concerns I had and went above and beyond to help me understand anything and everything I had questions about since this was my first renting experience. The maintenance worked quickly with my maintenance requests and had the issue resolved within 48 hours of the request. I will always recommend The University Group to anyone looking for apartments in the future.

A lot of the reviews were mentioning the security deposit. As stated in the lease I signed, if you have carpet, a carpet cleaning charge will be taken out and it gives you the minimum amount in the lease. If you clean (actually deep clean) and have any damages fixed with a maintenance request before you leave the apartment (as you're supposed to do) you can get almost all of your security deposit back (minus the carpet cleaning).
owner_answer:
Katelyn, thank you for taking time to leave us feedback.

We are so glad that you had a positive experience as a renter. We work hard to make our maintenance service speedy. Please let us know if there is anything else that we can do to help.
Feel free to follow us on social media: @UniversityGroupCU

-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text:
They will take your whole security deposit and then charge you extra with no itemized list detailing why they charged you those amounts. They also send invoices from companies that have absolutely zero contact information and no website at all. They could be fake companies for all you know. They don’t appear on the Illinois Secretary General’s Certificate of Compliance website. By the Illinois Security Deposit Act they have to provide itemized damages for anything that isn’t normal wear and tear. If they don’t provide an itemized list within 30 days of you moving out then you are due your whole deposit back. They need to return it within 45 days of you moving out.

I have pointed this out to them via email. I have contacted Drew from accounting and he does not respond at all even though they direct you to him. I have followed up after a week and yet still no response.

Many of these positive reviews also come from U Group employees. A quick search of their name shows that.

Protect yourself as a tenant and protect your security deposit.
owner_answer:
Emmanuel, thank you for letting us know about your experience. We are really sorry that you've experienced these frustrations.

That being said, we have a high standard for the cleanliness of our apartment units. The units must be cleaned according to the move-out procedures on our website: https://ugroupcu.com/move-in-move-out/
These procedures are the same steps that we go through to make sure the apartment is clean enough for a new renter or it must be professionally cleaned before the next tenant moves in.
We would be happy to speak with you about this. You can see from the video at the link below that cleaning was still necessary in this case: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1sjhCddLZlf1UrLsAvwO9iOQcHsecNZuq/view?usp=sharing

If you have already emailed us at Account.Inquiries@UGroupCU.com then we appreciate your patience as we respond to each inquiry. We apologize for the delays you've experienced.
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text: The University Group offers prompt quality maintenance whenever a request is submitted on their portal! My most recent request was resolved within 24 hours of submitting the request. Really appreciate their commitment!

name: University Group
review_text: They turn on the heating during winter when the tenant is absent, which is fine. However, the guy entered my apartment accidentally turned it on to maximum (85F) while I have been out of town, and I was billed an absurd amount of electricity for the empty home. They never accept their fault and refuse to take any responsibility.

name: University Group
review_text: I am a current resident living with The University Group and I just wanted to say I love my apartment. I'll definitely be renewing the lease for next year ASAP! The leasing staff is always professional, helpful, and very friendly whenever we speak. Everything in my unit works great, so I haven't had to submit a maintenance request. However, I will say the way you can request maintenance services online through The University Group Resident Portal is very convenient. If you are looking for housing in the Champaign/Urbana area, I'd recommend The University Group.

name: University Group
review_text: The maintenance team was friendly and my previous apartment was nice and spacious. These were the reasons why I renewed my lease with them. However, I could not understand why I would lose over half of my security deposit after I did all the cleaning I could (with the help of the move-out checklist), nor could I understand why I was charged carpet cleaning and wall painting fees. Also, I NEVER got a reply for my email regarding my security deposit. Will recommend other rental agencies to others in the future.
owner_answer:
Zhewen, thank you for taking time to leave a review.
We are sorry that you experienced the security deposit issue.
Drew sent you an email today regarding this.
Carpet cleaning was required as stated on your lease.
However, we are refunding the painting fee charged to your security deposit.
We are glad to hear that you enjoyed your experience living with University Group besides this issue.
We wish you all the best!
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text: Notifications on entrance of apartment by maintenance in non-emergency situations should be sent out at least 24 hours ahead of time to tenants. The u group gives tenants very short notices like less than 5 hours, and I have interviews going on. So they assume they can just walk in and interrupt my interviews, and ruin my future just like that?
owner_answer:
Yi, we are very sorry that you feel as though you've been given inadequate notice for the recent maintenance visit to your apartment. It is our policy to give as much notice as possible for non-emergency maintenance, and we apologize if this has not been the case in your situation. We understand that sudden disruptions can be inconvenient, and we will make sure to do our best to provide at least 24 hours notice for future maintenance visits.

It is important to us that our tenants feel respected and valued, and we apologize if this has not been the case. We take all tenant feedback seriously and will use your input to improve our policies and procedures going forward.

In the meantime, if you have any upcoming interviews or other important events that you would like us to be aware of, please don't hesitate to let us know. We will do our best to accommodate your schedule and avoid any unnecessary disruptions. Again, we apologize for any inconvenience you have experienced and appreciate your understanding.

Feel free to reach out to us!
Please email us at Maintenance@UGroupCU.com.
We look forward to hearing from you, Yi.
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text:
The reason why I gave them 2 stars instead of 1 was because once you did a maintenance request they were pretty fast about it, thowever as how other people mentioned, you’re lucky to even get 30% of your security deposit back.

Some of the companies that they contracted to “Clean” your apartment after move out as well as “Paint” your apartment  have little to no contact information to follow up on the exaggerated amount they charged as those fees. The company they used to Clean doesn’t show up on Illinois state Secretary as a registered business at all which is super sus.

I would recommend taking before and after pictures of your apartment IF you decide to move in. So you have proper documentation to Dispute the charges hope this review helps someone!

name: University Group
review_text: I rented from UGroup for two years. The apartment was nice enough, but there were markings on the wall from the previous tenant that they obviously did not paint over. They then charged me for painting fees upon move out. The receipt for the painting was dated from two weeks BEFORE I lived there, even though I know they did not paint the wall before I moved in based on the poster putty marks. They have not responded to my emails asking for the remainder of my security deposit back, even though the receipts they provided for cleaning and painting are from before I even lived in the apartment. I left the apartment in very clean condition, and they failed to provide me my deposit within 30 days anyway.

name: University Group
review_text: Absolutely horrible and disingenuous leasing company. I was told multiple different prices for rent. Additionally, the leasing agents do not respond to emails. I am happily renting an apartment through another leasing company.

name: University Group
review_text:
The maintenance request was taken care of quickly! The maintenance man was
very nice and professional. He noticed he did not have the correct part to
fix my tub and went straight to the hardware store and was back shortly
after and fixed the issue.

Thank you

name: University Group
review_text: I have had a wonderful experience with University Group.  As with all apartments, there were occasional maintenance needs but the team handled it professionally and as quickly as possible.  Huge shout out to Meg who always gets back to my emails super fast!

name: University Group
review_text:
Don’t live here unless you want constant issues that go unresolved and charges from your security deposit for issues that were in the apartment when you moved in. I didn’t have a working stove living here for over 30 days after I moved in. We didn’t have all the furniture we were supposed to have for months after moving in. I was charged from my security deposit $600 in “cleaning charges” when I cleaned for hours before I moved out and $300 “painting charges” for normal wear and tear. Looking at the reviews, it seems like they did this to every tenant they had. Awful company to rent with who doesn’t care about anything except stealing from students and taking advantage of renters because they don’t think they’ll fight back.

Edit: Very VERY strange for a leasing company to post publicly a woman’s former address and a video of her former apartment online for anyone to see. Clearly this company doesn’t care about their tenants privacy or safety either. Also, I don’t think the video shows $600 worth of cleaning and $300 worth of damage, but I digress.
owner_answer:
Madeline, thank you for taking the time to give us feedback.
We are so sorry that you experienced unexpected charges.
We can certainly understand your frustration.

We have a high standard for the cleanliness of our apartment units. The units must be fully cleaned according to the move-out procedures on our website: https://ugroupcu.com/move-in-move-out/
These procedures are the same steps that we go through to make sure the apartment is clean enough for a new renter or the unit must be professionally cleaned.
As you'll see in the move-out video below, work was necessary to make the unit move-in ready for the next tenant.
Move-out video:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1qYAh0U71ewQw95x9Yu70bvsCyGm8qYER/view?usp=sharing

Feel free to reach out to us with any questions!
Please email us at Account.Inquiries@UGroupCU.com.
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text: My friend went and attempted to move in to their new apartment today, and not only was it in such poor condition that the lease had to be broken, but U Group did not offer a hotel, nor a new apartment unit, and offered absolutely nothing aside from a refund. It is absolutely unacceptable that this company leaves holes in their ceiling and fails to provide their tenants with adequate housing, and on top of that, leaves their would-be tenants homeless due to their incompetence and negligence. Do not rent with this company!!!

name: University Group
review_text:
Don't be lured by their cheap prices, you'll pay a significant proportion of your "rent" in another format: "cleaning fees" after move out. They NEVER return security deposits, yes, NEVER. Even if you have cleaned to the extent that the next tenant can move in immediately, even if you spend hundreds on professional cleaners, they still charge a cleaning fee almost the same as what you deposited. Don't forget the autopay, if it happens that you forgot to cancel the autopay for the last month, BANG! Another month worth of rent is gone as "cleaning fee". That's my sad experience with them, we were charged ~1150 for cleaning, while the monthly rent is ~450 per person. That was several years ago, and I was kind enough to think it was my own problem at that time, until I heard stories from others in these years.
I've been in Champaign for more than 5 years now, and have experienced multiple companies, cpm, jsm, green st, etc, only University Group charge this amount of cleaning (Not to mention that when I moved in, there are rotten food in the fridge that smells like ****, despite the expensive "cleaning" they did).
Aside from myself, I've never heard about someone who can get their security deposit back from them, from my sample at least 10 people (some people even got additional charges). There are a lot of cheap and honest landlords out there in town, please don't consider this one.
给新来的同学们一点建议：他们从来不会退押金的，有时候甚至还要扣钱，尤其喜欢坑新来的中国人（身边好几例），请尽量远离。。考虑押金，这房子并不便宜。。

name: University Group
review_text: The apartments and locations are not a problem at all. However, they will try to major scam you in your deposit with made up charges and try to take more money from you for not doing any work at all. Completely unprofessional in terms of security deposit return.
owner_answer:
Miraj, thank you for taking the time to give us feedback. 
We are so sorry that you experienced unexpected charges.

However, we do have a high standard for the cleanliness of our apartment units. The units must be fully cleaned according to the move-out procedures on our website: https://ugroupcu.com/move-in-move-out/
These procedures are the same steps that we go through to make sure the apartment is clean enough for a new renter or the unit must be professionally cleaned. In this case, cleaning was still necessary to make the unit move-in ready for the next tenant. You can see the move-out condition video here: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1DUnjrU50ilmvr7Xge0AAPWOBorCQQDN-/view?usp=drive_web

Feel free to reach out to us with any questions.

name: University Group
review_text:
If I could give a 0 stars I would. Not only did I confirm three times that I was driving from Chicago to tour an apartment, I also had to call the office to get Ron to show up for our apartment tour. When he arrived 45 minutes late, he told me, "sorry, I was not checking email today and I thought you cancelled." Then, the apartment I toured was a completely different unit than the one I was told we would be seeing - not to mention the fact that it was clearly uncleaned.

I wasted time and effort looking through their properties and suggest others to not waste their time with this company's horrible client service and apartments.
owner_answer:
Hello Jimmy, we are so sorry that you have experienced these issues with your apartment tour.

Could you contact us about this?

name: University Group
review_text:
Ridiculous! I moved out of my old apartment and cleaned everything, but they charged me $790 for cleaning and $290 for painting. I emailed them and asked for details and receipts for these costs and haven’t received any response. According to the state law, if I don’t get my deposit back within 45 days the date I moved out, I will see you in the small claims court or the court. I suggest Anyone who has the same problem considering small claims court and fight for our rights.

I attached some photos here, but have no idea why I can’t see them here!
owner_answer:
Huai, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback.
We are sorry that you experienced unexpected charges.
We can certainly understand your frustration.

We have a high standard for the cleanliness of our apartment units. The units must be fully cleaned according to the move-out procedures on our website: https://ugroupcu.com/move-in-move-out/
These procedures are the same steps that we go through to make sure the apartment is clean enough for a new renter or the unit must be professionally cleaned. In this case, cleaning was still necessary to make the unit move-in ready for the next tenant.
Here is the video showing the condition of the apartment after move-out: https://drive.google.com/file/d/11_3xYMPSJsJlDzhm74nz23Y3ot00lUvE/view?usp=sharing

Feel free to reach out to us!
You can email us at Account.Inquiries@UGroupCU.com.
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text:
Hi Ugroup - since you have so much time asking your customer representatives to leave fake 5-star reviews below and calling your former tenants crazy and unreasonable and accusing them of not deep cleaning their apt (it's not that hard to find out, really), can you also spend a bit extra time actually replying to people's emails disputing deposit charges?

Ugroup charged me $600+ by listing only "cleaning" and "painting" on their invoices billed by vendors - note, these are invoices, not receipts. They did not list the specific damages I incurred to warrant such a high cost. I emailed three weeks ago and got no reply (same thing happened to many).

In response to your comments below:
1 - Your lease lists the carpet cleaning charges as "estimates", not "minimum", and so far it seems you often, if not always, charge people an amount much higher than these estimates without any justification

2 - We do not know whether you actually paid the said amount on invoice, if ever

3 - Even if you do, what the tenants are responsible for are the damages THEY caused, not how much YOU paid for.

4 - You take detailed videos of the units in each turnover, why not release them to tenants?

5 - Why do you insist on charging carpet cleaning fees to former tenants even though the vendor actually skipped that unit by mistake? And why do you charge $1000 in painting fees when the old tenants dropped by and found no new painting at all?

Lastly, just some food for thought as inspiration for business practice:
人而无信，不知其可也   --- Confucius

name: University Group
review_text: I stayed with University Group for about 3 years. They are notorious about charging extremely high fees upon moveout ($90 painting, $145, "cleaning", even though I cleaned everything). I have disputed them asking for details for cleaning and painting locations, and they are not replying to my emails for a week! Only rent from them if you are okay with losing ~$250 for bogus charges.

name: University Group
review_text: One of the good things about Ugroup is their maintenance is super fast. I requested a maintenance service on Sunday and they came the day after and fixed it. They even left a note that they stopped by while I was away. The person who answers the phone is kind and helpful too.

name: University Group
review_text: This company is awful, they will try to pull the security deposit for the most falsified reasons! Never lease with them!
owner_answer:
Hi Seb, thank you for taking the time to leave us a review.

We’re very sorry that you had unexpected charges. However, these charges were necessary because we have high standards for cleanliness and we had to prepare the unit for the next tenant.

Furthermore, cleanliness guidelines were provided before you were handed the keys. You can find our move-out guidelines here: https://ugroupcu.com/move-in-move-out/ 
In this case, the guidelines were not followed and the charges were incurred. 

Again, we are very sorry for the unexpected charges. 
Should you have any questions, please email us at leasing@ugroupcu.com.

- The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text: There are so many negative reviews on business, and most of them don’t appropriately reflect a business- only poor personal character on the reviewee. I rented the same duplex for almost 4 years. Next Chapter Properties owned this location until my last year there when U-Group took over. Every maintenance request was completed within 24-48 hours with no issues. Meg was FANTASTIC to work with (and the rest of her team). Any issue or concern I had, she gave solutions. Upon move out, I did my part COMPLETELY (cleaned walls, minor repairs, oven, light bulbs... you know... what you’re supposed to do), and received my full security deposit back. I can’t say enough how thankful I am for this team. In such a bitter sweet move out, they made it that much easier for me. I recommend them highly now days!!!
owner_answer:
Lacey, thank you for this. We are so encouraged by your kind and thoughtful review of the work we do. It makes us happy to hear that we were able to resolve (or offer options to resolve) the issues that you had.
Feel free to follow us on social media! @UniversityGroupCU
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text:
I was happy with the response time of the maintenance team when I needed a light to be fixed. The technician wore a mask and was helpful by resolving the issue.

10/11/20 revision: our light had another problem, however maintenance came to our apartment within a few days after submitting a request. They replaced the light and I'm happy with the service.
owner_answer:
Thanks, Luke! We do our best. So glad to hear that our team has been able to resolve the issues. We're very proud of our maintenance team.
Follow us on social media! @UniversityGroupCU
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text: The maintenance crew is great. They had to move in some furniture after the move-in date and were very kind, professional, and quick. We recently had an issue with our cabinet, I put in a maintenance request, and within minutes a member was here to fix it!
owner_answer:
Kaylee, this is great to hear! Thank you for letting us know about your experience. We're very proud of our maintenance team. Follow us on social media! @UniversityGroupCU
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text:
Great maintenance department. They're fast and efficient. I asked for blinds for 2 bedrooms that didn't have them. They came in the next day and added them in less than 20 minutes.

Edit: Updated to 3 stars. Maintenance is great, but beware of charges on your deposit. I was charged a carpet cleaning fee even though my apartment had all wooden floor. I was also charged for wall painting even though I've already had maintenance come in to paint the walls and ceilings 2 times. The building was one of the oldest ones on campus.
TLDR; maintenance is great, but beware of charges on your deposit, be prepared to take lots of photos.

Edit 2: They correctly removed the carpet cleaning charge. Fast response. They're a pretty fast company, just make sure to document when you move-in and move-out, they have hundreds of units to inspect and they might make some mistakes on the way.

name: University Group
review_text: The maintenance team came, fixed my stuff, and dropped off two new chairs for me -- the day after I called!  Great guys who were very nice.  (Update)  I was in the hospital for two weeks and din't have access to my computer/debit card.  Not only did they work with me and not charge me penalties, they had the cleaning crew come in.  The cleaning crew took out my trash, swept and mopped, vacuumed, wipe down all surfaces, and even DID MY DISHES!  I feel very fortunate to have rented from the University Group and thank God that I did!  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!
owner_answer:
Thank you for leaving a review! We're very proud of our maintenance team. We appreciate it!
Follow us on social media! @UniversityGroupCU
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text: Terrible service. Me and my roommates still have not received the furniture we were promised when we moved in. Our heater has been broken for about a month, and the maintenance coming in never seems to really fix it. We asked for rent credits and that cannot be offered. We keep getting referred back and forth from the leasing management and maintenance, but nothing seems to get done. Absolutely astounding behavior from this company.
owner_answer:
Hayaa, we are so sorry that your experience hasn't gone as expected. Our maintenance contractors worked hard to resolve the issue as quickly as possible. Sometimes furnace issues can require multiple parts to be changed resulting in multiple visits before the issue is resolved. In this case, four parts had to be replaced. The issue was completely resolved and the furnace was returned to a fully functional status on December 6, 2021.
As for the furniture, our furniture supplier and their supply chain has been backed up due to COVID-19. We will deliver the furniture as soon as our supplier is able to break through the bottleneck.
Once again, we're so sorry for these inconveniences.
We would be happy to talk with you more about this.
Please email us at Leasing@UGroupCU.com.
We look forward to hearing from you, Hayaa.
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text:
Update: We are going to sue the University Group for deposit and punitive damages allowed by law. For those who havent signed with them, please reconsider-- as another review said, they are vampire. For those who got ripoff for deposit, please stand up and fight for your rights. There is UIUC legal service to help us and it is not really time consuming. Please do it and Don't let them take advantage of us.

Update: We went to the office and they said there is no one else to talk about this except this one guy in charge of that  email address. We can not call him either. We can either sue them or just wait. Can you believe that? Please guys do not trust them when considering leasing!!

This is most terrible experience during my years of stay in CU area! Definitely a ripoff! Our deposit is 1480 dollars and they took 1145 from it. When moving out, we cleaned the apartment like shining and recorded video as proof. However, they charged 1145 in total for cleaning. This is nonsense. Where is that wall painting 370 dollars come from since there is no dirt on the wall at all? How come you charge a unit way much cleaner than its move in condition for 600 dollars? How come you charge carpet cleaning for 175 dollars when we did carpet cleaning ourselves?  We have video proof and they do not respond to our email to the account inquires service address at all. Now We wonder if we shall seek for legal service help that the university offers.
owner_answer:
Qian, thank you for taking the time to give the feedback that you provided here. We are so sorry that you experienced unexpected charges. We can certainly understand your frustration.

We have a high standard for the cleanliness of our apartment units. The units must be cleaned according to the move-out procedures on our website: https://ugroupcu.com/move-in-move-out/
These procedures are the same steps that we go through to make sure the apartment is clean enough for a new renter or it must be cleaned. In this case, a significant amount of cleaning was still necessary for the unit to be move-in ready for the next tenant. Furthermore, carpet cleaning is stated on the lease as a standard charge for this apartment unit as it needs consistent cleaning to be move-in ready.

We would be happy to speak with you about this to see how we might improve.
Please try one more time to email us at Account.Inquiries@UGroupCU.com.
We look forward to hearing from you, Qian.
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text: Their maintenance team is the best! I cannot say enough good things about them. I was a little worried when I first heard that my apartment management had switched from Advantage Properties to University Group, but my experience so far has been great. We have submitted many maintenance requests (dryers, drawers, kitchen disposal, etc.) over the past year, and most of them were fixed within a day or two.

name: University Group
review_text: I've had a great experience with University Group. I've had 2 maintenance issues during my lease and both were resolved within 24 hours, and staff were very efficient in solving the issues. Management has always been quick to respond to issues and gave ample heads up when my apartment was being shown.

name: University Group
review_text:
Rude staff, very bad communication skills (e.g. they hang up the phone), and do not respond to e-mails.

Situation:
University Group has left me with no functional washer since the beginning of my lease. When I contacted them to tell them this is not right neither fair, and that I consider it part of the rent I pay, they said:
a) The washer is included, but the rent is for the apartment and not the washer itself.
b) I should be able to Google and find washers near campus myself while I am waiting for the issue to be fixed. They did not consider it as their responsibility.
Also, they were interrupting me and being rude towards me. When I told them this is not okay they hung up the phone on me. When I called them back to report the incident, they also hang up on me. When I sent them an e-mail about this, they never replied back.

P.S. 1. 10 days later, and only because of my persistent efforts, they managed to send someone to... connect the machine to the water supply.
P.S. 2. I send this review/feedback from my second e-mail. Since they do not respond to my e-mails/requests, I will use every e-mail I have to publicly report (and negatively review) all the bad stuff they do!
owner_answer:
Antonis, we are so sorry that you have experienced these issues. We can certainly understand how frustrating this must have been.
Our maintenance team stays very busy in August and as such, it can take time for them to attend to an issue. We are glad to hear that the washer is working now.
Our team aims to serve our tenants with a high standard of excellence.
Once again, we are so sorry for the many inconveniences you've had to experience with the washer being out of operation.
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text:
I was a resident in midtown plaza and there are a few problems with the University Group.

First, they are very soft on people who break the rules. I had a party person living in the unit right above me and she was having party every weekend. The noise was crazy loud in the midnight. Some policeman came and even that police officer know that party person and the officer told me that person in notorious in the area. They even had people yelling in the balcony and smoking weeds. I reported to the University Group office and they keep saying they've let that person know but they can't really do anything. I was expecting they to start an eviction process to that person but nothing really happened. She only got fined by the police once.

Second, they didn't tell me that other tenant has taken our unit in the new semester year and they never asked us if we wanted to extend our contract. I asked them why they did that and they just told me I was having a short term lease but in fact my lease was 10-month. And I had been living in midtown plaza for 3 years.

Last but not least, they will charge you a lot of money when you leave their property no matter how hard you clean the unit. My deposit was 600 and it was all taken. They told me to charge me extra 600 for painting and cleaning.

Just do everything you could to avoid the University Group and their properties.
owner_answer:
Yi, thank you for taking the time to provide feedback.
We are so sorry that you experienced these inconveniences with us.
We can certainly understand your frustration here.

We are aware of the loud tenant that lived near you at Midtown Plaza. We were pleased that the police were able to get involved and intervene with at least a ticket. We would have proceeded with the eviction process to evict the tenant, however, the current COVID-19 eviction moratorium issued by the state of Illinois did not allow us to evict that person despite their behavior. We certainly wish there was more that we could have done to stop the tenant from disturbing the peace for you and other tenants that followed the noise rules. We share your frustration that it was not possible to evict the tenant.

As for the security deposit, we have a high standard for the cleanliness of our apartment units. The units must be fully cleaned according to the move-out procedures on our website: https://ugroupcu.com/move-in-move-out/
These procedures are the same steps that we go through to make sure the apartment is clean enough for a new renter or the unit must be professionally cleaned. In this case, cleaning was still necessary to make the unit move-in ready for the next tenant.

Feel free to reach out to us!
Please email us at Account.Inquiries@UGroupCU.com.
We look forward to hearing from you, Yi.
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text:
Very bad service. If something is wrong with your house, they will use excuses. Not recommended.

Update/Answer to Univ. Group (Aug 25, 2021):

-- Regarding the furniture: You should have a Plan B, which you clearly do not. This is your problem, not your supplier's.
- The 1/2 month rent credit does not correspond to the damage you cause when all furniture (including the bed) are missing.
- You provided a washer that was not properly tested in advance, so when I tried to use it, it just did not work. You are aware of this issue, and cannot provide an estimated day on when it will be fixed.  The only thing you told me is that you will try your best and that the City of Champaign gives you up to 30 days to respond to my request.

Thanks for leaving me without a way to wash my clothes, and without furniture! At least you did a 1/2 month rent discount --while others would argue your company did not deserve to even get the other half.

So yes, there are things that you can do: start maybe by seeing your maintenance list and prioritizing the requests accordingly, hire more people, do a better job.
owner_answer:
Antonis, we are so sorry about the inconveniences you have experienced with the furniture delays. Although we ordered furniture one year ago, our supplier has experienced many unforeseen delays caused by COVID-19. We were happy to see that you received the 1/2 month rent credit that we sent on August 18 to say that we are so sorry for the inconveniences you've experienced. We will keep you informed as we have updates in regards to this.
Is there anything else we can do for you?
Please email us at Leasing@UGroupCU.com or call (217) 352-3182. We look forward to hearing from you.
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
University Group
review_text:
They will STEAL half your security deposit. I have sent multiple emails and went to the office to try to understand why they took $600 out of our security deposit over a 2 month period. They said they have no way of contacting the manager. I'm pretty sure they just don't respond. If you sign expect to be charged about $600 out of your security deposit that you will never get back.

Update: Ended up getting about $250 back of the stolen $600. It’s depressing how many times I had to go into the office to annoy them until they finally responded. AWFUL service and a leech on the college students trying to survive here.
owner_answer:
Matt, thank you leaving us feedback.

We have a very high standard for the cleanliness of our apartment units. The units must be cleaned according to the move-out procedures on our website. ( https://ugroupcu.com/move-in-move-out/ ) These procedures are the same steps that we go through to make sure the apartment is clean enough for a new renter. If it is not cleaned properly, the unit must be professionally cleaned.
In this case, a significant amount of cleaning was necessary as documented by the move-out video.

However, we want to understand your specific situation to see how we can improve in the future.
