Could you email us about this?
You can email us at: Account.Inquiries@UGroupCU.com
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text: Had a problem in the restroom commode; they responded pretty fast and solved the problem on the same day. I think they are trying hard to be better as maintenance team by working sincerely, which is a great thing of course!
owner_answer:
Sadiul, thank you for taking time to leave a thoughtful review.
We are so glad that you have enjoyed your experience with our maintenance staff. Please let us know if there is anything else that we can do to help. Feel free to follow us on social media: @UniversityGroupCU
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text: I've been stay in the apartment of university group for two years. I really like how fast they responded to our requests. We got a brand new fridge the day we submitted our maintenance request. They also changed our ceiling lamp to a brand new one when we found the old one broken. Not like some other places, they didn't charge us for the maintenance. I think they are doing a good job making sure we are living in a safe and comfortable place. I recommended the university group to my friends and they like their apartment as well. I think we will renew our lease to next year. I would recommend this place to people who are looking for apartment near campus.

name: University Group
review_text: Regarding the free maintenance requests here, our maintenance guy, Paul, has been coming to fix all of our maintenance issues and I wanted to express how well he has been doing. Paul is always very polite, friendly, and respective of our property. He has quickly fixed every maintenance issue that we have had so far and happily answers every question that we have.  He is very knowledgeable of the apartment structure and systems involved, and I feel as though I can trust him with any fixes. My roommates and I all agree that he is a fantastic employee and deserves more acknowledgment for his work ethic and amiability!

name: University Group
review_text: Really quick response! I sent the maintenance request Sunday evening, a technician came on Monday morning and got everything done perfectly.

name: University Group
review_text:
One thing that the university group is amazing for is certainly the maintenance, the turnaround time is always quick. I lived at 706 S 1st for 2 years and overall the stay was fine. Honestly this building is pretty old as compared to other properties and that was evident with the appliances etc provided to us and one could see that after looking at the overall building condition. We requested and got the couch as well as the mattresses changed since they were in a bad condition and Ugroup did that without charging us any extra amount.

However the biggest problem for us was the laundry.  While most buildings have card operated laundry , our building had just 1 old coin slot washer and dryer and every month the coin circuit would get blocked and we had to raise a complain. On asking Ugroup for a new card operated machine, they mentioned it was upto coinmach(the machine providers) to replace it and when I spoke to coinmach they said it was upto Ugroup to raise a request, so basically a dead end. For more than 3 months in the winter of 2020, our building laundry was out of service and we were forced to do laundry in another building which was a big pain specially in peak winter months where we had to carry our clothes while it was freezing outside. We did complain but Ugroup simply mentioned that we need to get in touch with coinmach since they are the ones who own the machines. After making literally 20+ calls to coinmach over a span of 3 months, our machine was repaired and all this was without the help of Ugroup. However towards the end of our lease , we again faced problems and were without our dryer for a month and Ugroup simply said they couldn't do anything. When you have just 1 washer and 1 dryer in a building of 20+ residents, this inconvenience is unbearable. Ugroup should have a better alternative in such situations because we certainly are paying them the rent for residing in their building and not coinmach.

As far as the security deposit is concerned, Andy from the accounts team was super helpful. They had charged us for apartment painting but after showing the before move in and before move out photos, we got the full amount refunded to us. They did charge us for carpet cleaning and other cleaning charges which were a bit higher due to covid as per Ugroup, however it was still not that bad when I see other tenant reviews. They do send you a PDF that has all the breakdown of the cleaning charges and they also send you videos of areas/things that needed extreme cleaning, so that was certainly helpful. The carpet cleaning was $50 extra than what was estimated in the lease (covid was given as the reason) but our apartment cleaning charges were a bit more that what I expected. Overall I'm just happy atleast Andy was reasonable with us and did refund the painting cost which was a huge amount.
owner_answer:
Rahul, thank you for taking the time to provide thorough feedback.

We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed our efficient maintenance services.
At the same time, we are so sorry that you experienced these inconveniences.
We can certainly understand your frustration with the washer/dryer and security deposit.

Unfortunately, the building has only one washer and dryer hookup and it's not possible to install more given the electrical, plumbing, and space limitations of the building.
As for the security deposit, we have a high standard for the cleanliness of apartment units. The units must be fully cleaned according to the PDF that we sent you and the move-out procedures on our website: https://ugroupcu.com/move-in-move-out/

These procedures are the same steps that we go through to make sure the apartment is clean enough for a new renter or the unit must be professionally cleaned. In this case, cleaning was still necessary to make the unit move-in ready for the next tenant.

We want to say thank you for choosing to live with us.
Once again, we are sorry for the inconveniences that you experienced, Rahul.

Feel free to reach out to us if there is anything more we can do!
You can email us at Account.Inquiries@UGroupCU.com.

-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text: When I requested maintenance they came within 24 hours to fix my requests and were super friendly. I have had no problems with this leasing group thus far and appreciate how quickly the maintenance issues were resolved. Leasing here next year as well.

name: University Group
review_text: I used to give a 5 star to university group for its maintenance. I didn't regret it, but I have to change this to 1 star now because they ridiculously take most of the deposit for so-called cleaning fees. We spent so much effort cleaning the apartment, and makes it clean enough for direct move-ins. We have taken and sent videos to them before the charging, and still got a cleaning bill of more than $1000.
owner_answer:
Zhe, thank you for providing us with feedback. We are so sorry that you had unexpected charges against your security deposit. We can see how this must have been a very frustrating experience.
We have a high standard for the cleanliness of our apartment units. The units must be cleaned according to the move-out procedures on our website: https://ugroupcu.com/move-in-move-out/
These procedures are the same steps that we go through to make sure the apartment is clean enough for a new renter or it must be professionally cleaned before the next tenant moves in. In this case, a significant amount of cleaning was still necessary for the unit to be move-in ready for the next tenant.
We would be happy to speak with you about this to see how we might improve.
Please email us at Account.Inquiries@UGroupCU.com.
We look forward to hearing from you, Zhe.
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text:
I have had a really wonderful experience with University Group, since my initial interest to rent an apartment in Champaign.  When I was touring their units, Rick took the time and showed me multiple units.  He was really responsive and followed up even after work hours when I had questions about the lease.  I just moved in this past week into one of their new apartments (Midtown Plaza).  The key hand-off was very smooth with the leasing office (they had everything prepared already before I arrived).  When I found some minor defects with the unit (this is expected with new constructions), the maintenance team was extremely responsive to get the issues resolved.  I was amazed at their professionalism and responsiveness.  Cameron, from the maintenance team, was very cordial and helped fixed a number of the issues.  The team also dispatched the general contractor out the same day to take care of any additional issues under warranty with the unit.  Cory and Jeremy from the maintenance team also followed up on my requests to make sure they were resolved successfully; this is the kind of professionalism I have not witnessed before from other property management groups.  I'm worry-free living at a University Group apartment, knowing there is a dependable maintenance team for any issues I may come across.

Update: I've been living here for 6 months and the experience is very stellar.  Putting in a maintenance request yesterday evening, someone came by to check out the issue this morning.  Everyone is friendly and professional.

Update: Living here for a year now.  Putting in 2 maintenance requests just this morning (light bulb burned out and lock needed some lubrication).  Staff came same day in the early afternoon to fix it.  Really appreciate the University Group staff.  (Note: University Group has an online portal which makes it easy to put in requests as well.)

10/03/19 Update: submitted a maintenance request for running toilet in bathroom. Provided permission to enter.  Next day I came back home, it was fixed. = responsive maintenance team!

1/14/20 update: submitted request for light bulb burned out in the afternoon yesterday. Came this morning and it's replaced.  = continued expeditious maintenance service turn-arounds.  Thank you Cameron!

name: University Group
review_text: The 305 North Lincoln Avenue apartment complex was fabulous, neat and well maintained. The maintenance staff was super responsive with a response time of less than 24-48 hours in most cases. They were meticulous in repairing any damages and would conduct routine checks for pest control, A/C maintenance and leakages. I stayed with the University group in the same apartment for 2 years and had a wonderful time. Thanks a ton for your fantastic services ! I would strongly recommend the University Group apartments due to the best value for money.

name: University Group
review_text: This rental agency is a scam through and through. They drain your security deposit with the most uncalled for reasons. They charged my roommate and I 300 dollars for painting. When we first moved in (602 E Stoughton) there was not fresh paint on the walls. We did not make the condition of the paint any worse. I also only lived there for 4/12 months of my lease due to a cockroach infestation that we noticed on day 2 after we moved in. I finally had to move back home and drop my in person classes because the cockroach problem was persistent. Another 175 for carpet cleaning which is an absurd amount for the amount of carpet in the apartment. And another 145 for general apartment cleaning even though we left the apartment very clean. Save yourselves the trouble and avoid signing with UGroup. I know rental agencies can be difficult to work with but this agency is impossible and takes advantage of its tenants every chance they can.
owner_answer:
Doris, thank you for taking the time to give us feedback in your review. We are so sorry that you had unexpected charges against your security deposit. We have eradicated the cockroach issue and will continue to do so should the need arise. We can see how all of this must have been frustrating.

We do have a high standard for the cleanliness of our apartment units. The units must be cleaned according to the move-out procedures on our website: https://ugroupcu.com/move-in-move-out/
These procedures are the same steps that we go through to make sure the apartment is clean enough for a new renter or it must be cleaned. Furthermore, carpet cleaning is stated on the lease as a standard charge for this apartment unit as it needs consistent cleaning to be move-in ready. In this case, some cleaning was still necessary to make the unit move-in ready.

We would be happy to speak with you more about this to see how we might improve.
Please email us at Account.Inquiries@UGroupCU.com.
We look forward to hearing from you about this, Doris.
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text: I've rented an apartment from the University Group since July 10, 2017, and the services they provide are just timely and efficient. The maintenance crew are quick to my request, extremely helpful in fixing the problems I have raised. They are friendly and professional, and won't bother going back and forth just to meet my needs. Overall, I've had a wonderful stay so far. Highly recommended...

name: University Group
review_text: I have lived with The University Group for two consecutive years and I plan to finish my PhD studies in the apartment I currently live in, so that should tell you how happy I am with the company. My building is a bit old but the maintenance service is excellent and has always responded promptly to all my requests. I really wouldn't look somewhere else if you are on a tight budget but still expect the best service.

name: University Group
review_text:
I have had great experiences with their maintenance group so far. My requests are met quickly and fulfilled to my satisfaction! They always send an email to check in to see if the problem was fixed and if it was not they will send someone out again.
I am grateful to have such efficient and helpful maintenance.

name: University Group
review_text: Great maintenance experience. A couple of bulbs had went out in my apartment due to prolonged use. The maintenance staff helped me replace not only the defective bulbs but also those that seemed old. I sent in a request early morning and the staff arrived within 2 hours to help out. Very responsive and helpful!

name: University Group
review_text: I requested fro maintenance and all the maintenance was conducted with couple of days. The issues were resolved comprehensively. Maintenance team changed one door handle, one door and a sheet in Kitchen. I am happy with their professional attitude.

name: University Group
review_text:
After reading some of the negative reviews, I am surprised that so many people have had bad experiences. I hope their new homes are much better.

Fortunately for me, my experience was interesting and overall ended positively. When I first walked in, the apartment had carpet on the living room floor and the place smelled a little funny, but everything looked sanitized within the last week (except for the blinds). Everything worked well, except for a half broken couch, and a few dining chairs that needed to be repaired.

The same day, I input my maintenance requests to get any items I found wrong to be fixed. Within three business days, everything was fixed with quality products and very promptly. I now have hard wood floors as was agreed on the lease and the place looks great! Especially with the new furniture provided.

All in all, although the initial impression wasn’t the greatest, the fact that maintenance was professional and prompt with each response showed that they understand the value of attending to their tenants. Shoutout to Cory for being so helpful during my first week back on campus and thanks to University Group for the quick action. Were it not for that, I would probably also be writing a poor review.

Thanks!

name: University Group
review_text: My and my roommate's experience with University Group over the course of 4 semesters has been excellent. We never had large maintenance issues, and when we did have one, the maintenance team responded quickly and fixed the issue immediately. Very impressed!

name: University Group
review_text: So far, great experience with university group. University Group has already helped me find a lost package and always responds very quickly to any maintenance issues. Cameron (maintenance tech) was very helpful and efficient with helping with a crack in the wall. Way better than my last apartment leasing office (JSM). Will update review at the end of my lease with University group.

name: University Group
review_text: The maintenance team has always been very quick to respond to any issue I have. Most recently, my fridge stopped working. The immediate day following my maintenance request, they had a tech checking out the issue by noon, and by 2pm I had a new fridge!
owner_answer:
Reese, we are proud that we were able to resolve the fridge issue in a timely manner.
Thank you for letting us know about your experience.
Follow us on social media! @UniversityGroupCU
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text:
The maintenance and people working are nice and very helpful. Most of the apartment is nice and all the furniture are clean and new as well. However, the celing is extremely thin and I can hear my upstairs neighbor when they walk to the bathroom or pull out a chair. Other than that Id want to give 5 stars but just having to constantly hear people walking around sucks.

Edit: After seeing whats happening at Seven07 and living here for a while, I've decided to chang my rating from a 3 to a 4. I also kinda got used to my upstairs neighbor walking around. It kinda grows on you and its nice to know that hes still alive and well.
owner_answer:
Will, thank you for taking time to leave a review.
We are so glad that you have enjoyed your apartment as well as our kind maintenance and office staff. We’re sorry that the noise has been bothersome. Please let us know if there is anything else that we can do to help.
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text: I had great experience with the maintenance team really. I reported a toilet problem. And they not only repaired the toilet. They just made everything better, like cleaning A/C filter, replacing old cooking bench with new one. It dose great help for a new early move-in tenant.

name: University Group
review_text: I am happy to live in UG, I had a great experience to move in. And the agent Rick and Meg quick answered all my questions everyday, helps a lot. The apartment is really clean and maintain pretty well. Also the maintenance team is highly efficient, they come next day while I sent out the request maintenance.  What amazing me is the maintenance technician, Darrell, clean very well after fixing. Well, its my experience, wish everyone could find your best apt.

name: University Group
review_text: Stay away from this greedy company！they will charge you all your deposit and ask you to pay hundreds dollars more. We lived in a ugroup apt And today I got mail from UGROUP saying that we are charged for the cleaning painting and carpet cleaning. I think the carpet cleaning fee is ok. But they charged 600 cleaning fee and 500 painting fee. We have cleaned the whole apt and make no difference to the wall. it's just like we moved in.  So if it's need to paint, they should charge the previous tennants. So basically they not only want your deposit but also want you to pay more than your deposit. So disgusting. I lived with many apt companies and none of them charged me more than 300 when I moved out.
owner_answer:
Stephen, thank you for leaving us feedback.
However, we do not see your name in our system.
Would you be willing to reach out to us about this?

We have a high standard for the cleanliness of our apartment units. The units must be fully cleaned according to the move-out procedures on our website: https://ugroupcu.com/move-in-move-out/
These procedures are the same steps that we go through to make sure the apartment is clean enough for a new renter or the unit must be professionally cleaned.

Feel free to reach out to us about your specific situation.
We would be happy to discuss this with you.
Please email us at Account.Inquiries@UGroupCU.com.
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text: I lived at Healey place and it was fine overall, but they really don’t care about the quality of their buildings. I had a cockroach problem that never actually got fixed despite pest control coming many times. Also, the elevator was out of service (might still be broken as of right now) and they didn’t seem to prioritize fixing it while many leases were ending.  I had to move out using the stairs, which was obviously a major inconvenience. The price of the apartments does not match the quality. Additionally, the apartments are supposedly cleaned between tenants, however, when I moved in, the floors were disgusting, there was dust everywhere, and cockroaches all around the apartment.  I can’t say any other apartment managing companies are much better, but Ugroup and Healey place were majorly disappointing.
owner_answer:
Natalie, we are so sorry that you experienced these inconveniences.
As previously stated, unfortunately, the elevator was not a simple fix. A part of the elevator that needed to be replaced had to be custom made (fabrication itself took 4 weeks) resulting in longer downtime than we could have predicted. We wanted to make sure the elevator was completely safe and functional before it was used by the public again. The safety of our tenants is our number one priority. We are happy to report that the new part was installed and the elevator at Healey Place was returned to a safe, fully functional status as of around 9am this morning (August 3rd).
As for the cockroach issue, that's awful and we're so sorry that you experienced that, Natalie. We would like to hear more information so we can make sure this issue is resolved.
We would love to speak with you to understand what we can do better and for a chance to make this right. Please email us at Leasing@UGroupCU.com or call (217) 352-3182. We look forward to talking with you.
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text:
Only had one maintenance issue while I lived with them and they responded quickly and fixed it.

My friends had some horror stories living with other companies but my roommates and I didn’t have any problems with university group.  They let us know when they were going to show our apartment and were overall easy to work with.

name: University Group
review_text:
Been with them at a couple different addresses for around six years now. My interactions with the front office have been fairly limited, but they’ve been positive. In my experience they are really responsive to emails and accommodating to most concerns.
The maintenance team is easily the best I’ve ever experienced. They are very quick, usually making repairs the same day. The repairs have also been really thorough and better than you might expect. Most recently, a squeaky ceiling fan was replaced with a new model that looks great and runs whisper quiet. At my previous building, a caretaker lived on site. He did a fantastic job of making the space look great and clean, and quickly responding to repair and upkeep issues.
The unit I live in looks great, but I do wish the same level of upkeep were given to the building. The halls have old carpet and the staircases are exposed concrete with stains from spills over the years. It’s not the biggest issue, but it doesn’t give a great first impression to guests. A numerical keyless entry system was disabled about a year after moving into the building. While I understand the choice to disable it, having to unlock two sets of doors while carrying in grocieries is pretty frustrating.
Overall, I would definitely recommend them.

name: University Group
review_text: I've been staying in a university group apartment for the past two years, and the apartments are quite comfortable, given the location and the price. The best part is that they are very prompt in attending to all maintenance requests! The maintenance technicians are also very friendly. We have had nothing to complain about so far

name: University Group
review_text:
Way too expensive for what you get. My apartment air conditioning was always broken and had to be fixed often. The shower-water quality was low. My roommate and I couldn't be using water at the same time. The garage door or elevator were broke for over 50% of the year. The reason for such a low review mainly came since the fees after moving out. We received outrageous fees for carpet cleaning, regular cleaning, and painting, even though we left the apartment spotless.

I would recommend finding a cheaper place. Where I live now is half the price and much more accommodating.
owner_answer:
Hello, we are sorry to hear that you had a negative experience with us. We would love a chance to discuss this with you. Please get in touch with us by emailing Leasing@UGroupCU.com, calling 217-352-1472, or visiting our office at 309 S 1st St in Champaign. We look forward to hearing from you regarding this.
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text:
Unfortunately, the University group took over ownership to the property we rented from.

Meg lacks social skills and is very unprofessional and condescending. Someone in the reviews mentioned how she “had robotic responses” and I completely agree with that statement.

Be prepared to have half or more of your security deposit withheld for: “carpet cleaning, painting and cleaning”; what most lessors consider as normal wear and tear. *As we did live there for almost 3 years. It wouldn’t matter if you hired professionals to remodel the unit you rented before you moved out, you still wouldn’t receive your deposit back. I’m being sarcastic to make the point that you will never receive your full deposit back.

I received an email from Meg to see if it was okay to show the property to potential renters, which I was currently renting, DURING A WORLDWIDE PANDEMIC. However, I didn’t receive a courteous email about move out procedures. As Meg stated, “Move out procedures can be found on the website.”

The University group does not build relationships with their tenants. Tenants are strictly seen as business opportunities. I can tell they rent to a lot of college students as I received emails about leaving the temperature set to 62 degrees when not in the apartment. Theses emails didn’t apply to me as me and my family lived in their properties off campus.
A simple check-in/ anniversary email would have been nice to receive.

I WOULD NOT recommend anyone to rent from the University Group, EVER! This was my first and last time leasing from a company.

A note to the University group: Please hire a better representative to communicate with tenants.
owner_answer:
Hello B Porter, we are very sorry to hear about your negative experience with us. We would love a chance to make this right. Please email us at Leasing@UGroupCU.com or call (217) 352-3182. We look forward to hearing from you regarding this.
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text: They are all good until it's time to return your security deposit. They charged us $200 for paint job and we returned the apartment to them in the same condition we got it. There was over a $1000 worth cleaning charge and they said it's because of the pandemic. Illinois law states the tenants should not be charged for this but we still ended up paying to avoid all the hassle. I don't recommend.
owner_answer:
Archana, thank you for leaving us feedback.
However, we do not see anyone with your name in our system.
Would you be willing to reach out to us about this?
We want to better understand your specific situation.

We have a high standard for the cleanliness of our apartment units. The units must be fully cleaned according to the move-out procedures on our website: https://ugroupcu.com/move-in-move-out/
These procedures are the same steps that we go through to make sure the apartment is clean enough for a new renter or the unit must be professionally cleaned.

We would be happy to discuss this with you.
Please email us at Account.Inquiries@UGroupCU.com.
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text: They moved us from our original apartment lease because the decided to renovate it right before the school year. Then then place they moved us into did not have air conditioning or furniture for the first month of our lease. We took great care of the place and received less than 10% of our security deposit back because they charged over $350 to clean a 600sq ft apartment. They are scammers.
owner_answer:
Jake, thank you for taking the time to give us feedback.
We are so sorry that you experienced unexpected charges.
We can certainly understand your frustration.

We do have a high standard for the cleanliness of our apartment units. The units must be fully cleaned according to the move-out procedures on our website: https://ugroupcu.com/move-in-move-out/
These procedures are the same steps that we go through to make sure the apartment is clean enough for a new renter or the unit must be professionally cleaned. In this case, cleaning was still necessary to make the unit move-in ready for the next tenant.

We would love to speak with you about this to see how we might improve.
Please email us at Account.Inquiries@UGroupCU.com.
We look forward to hearing from you, Jake.
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text:
Main reasons I was very dissipated with this agency (there were many more but here are the big ones)

1. Our apartment was very dirty and only half painted when we moved in.  Our bathtub was pink, the kitchen floor was sticky and there was an inch of dust in the closets. Oh and by the way, we paid a $200 cleaning fee BEFORE moving in.

2. Moving out early ended up costing us much more than if we had just moved out and didn't turn in our keys. Apparently, someone came into our apartment a month after we moved out, set the ac to 62 degrees, turned the oven on, and opened up every faucet. We had to pay for 8,000 gallons of water and 4,000 kWh we didn't use. We literally paid more in utilities for the 3 months we weren't living there than the previous 8 months.

3. Got charged a $900 cleaning fee despite leaving the apartment with a clean bathtub, mopped floors and clean closets. Literally in SIGNIFICANTLY better shape than how we got it.

In all, wouldn't recommend

name: University Group
review_text: I have lived in one of the units in Main Street for two years and I’m overall satisfied with the responsiveness of all UG staff. They are very responsive and cooperative. The maintenance at my building has always been great. I would like to express my appreciation for Jason at the maintenance team who has politely and prompttly addressed my requests.

name: University Group
review_text: I live at Healey Place (601 S. 1st St.) and am currently in the process of moving out. (See recent reviews about the elevator being broken). I live on the top floor and have been moving everything up and down the stairs alone. As someone who isn’t that strong, I have dropped things, sprained my ankle, and literally walked up over 100 flights of stairs over the past few days to move my stuff. The leasing office responded to a review that the elevator would be fixed by the move out date of August 3rd. Well, it’s August 3rd and the elevator is STILL not fixed. I do not recommend living at a University Group property. They are untrustworthy and clearly do not care about their residents. I have called several times about the elevator with my frustrations and never once did they offer any type of reparations or extensions for me to move my things out.
owner_answer:
QQ, it makes us sad to hear about your expereince with the elevator issue. We can certainly understand how frustrating it must have been to use the stairs to move all of your things.
As previously stated, unfortunately, the elevator was not a simple fix. A part of the elevator that needed to be replaced had to be custom made (fabrication itself took 4 weeks) resulting in longer downtime than we could have predicted. We wanted to make sure the elevator was completely safe and functional before it was used by the public again. The safety of our tenants is our number one priority. We are happy to report that the new part was installed and the elevator at Healey Place was returned to a safe, fully functional status as of around 9am this morning (August 3rd).
Once again, we are so sorry for the many inconveniences you've had to experience with the elevator being out of operation. Could you reach out to us one more time? We would love to speak with you for a chance to make this right. Please email us at Leasing@UGroupCU.com or call (217) 352-3182. We look forward to hearing from you, QQ.
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text:
The apartment wasn't clean at move in, despite having a note from cleaning company saying they had come and cleaned it. Then they still took $600 dollars from our security deposit for general cleaning, carpet cleaning and painting even though there was nothing dirty or broken in the apartment and it was returned in better condition than we had left it. I had rented with American Campus Communities the year before and they were much nicer and respectable company to work with and did not do this last minute money grab on our way out.

I will update this review if they resolve this issue with me.

name: University Group
review_text: University Group attempts to exploit student renters through falsified, exorbitant charges that always seem to result in U Group keeping the entirety of your security deposit (or more!). They’ll try to charge you hundreds of dollars for carpet cleaning when your apartment only has vinyl/wood floors — not to mention the fact that normal carpet cleaning charges are explicitly against the IL Security Deposit law in Illinois. Read up on tenants’ rights in Champaign-Urbana and do not rent from University Group.

name: University Group
review_text: University Group is a pretty decent management group. Although I've only heard bad things before leasing from them a few years ago, it's not been bad. I cleaned the place very well prior to moving out and received my entire security deposit minus carpet cleaning, per the lease. When I moved in to my new place with University Group, there was a hole in the wall; it was patched promptly. My heater went out in the middle of the winter, and the unit was replaced by the end of the day. The maintenance is swift and the office staff are nice.

name: University Group
review_text:
Upgrade Again in Mid-July: so I am really impressed by the work of Maintenance here. I had two holes from ceiling that were result of water pipe leakage. Today the maintenance came and fixed the holes and re-brushed my walls. After I got back the ceiling was perfect and all the water spill stains are gone! The maintenance moved back my furnitures and it feels like the holes and the stains were my hallucinations. Great great team!

Upgrade on July 2019: it has been a year with UG and I still feel great about my apartment. The maintenance team kept up their good work and they are super nice and efficient. All the request I put in will be fixed within next 24 hours, and the team was great on finding the cause of the problems and tackling them.

Great service with the maintenance! My apartment was bought by UG this summer and I like how they kept the stuffs pretty much the same for the building's maintenance team.

name: University Group
review_text: I lived in 1007 on W. Main and before signing the lease i had read terrible reviews online. I can assure you that they do a great job in satisfying you. The apartment is not super luxurious but its super comfortable for a student. The maintenance team did an excellent job throughout the year and i had no issues with them. The Apartment was well maintained and cleaned prior to our move in date. I Highly recommend them

name: University Group
review_text: Avoid this company at all cost. The cheap rent is just a bait. They will take much more back through your security deposit. Those 5 stars are most likely from bots. I will rate them 0 star if possible. The apartment is extremely dirty when moved in. The AC was leaking water. Washer and dryer was really old and broke several times. Heater in bathroom create intolerable noise when running. And there was a strange smell in the kitchen probably caused by pest control. Before I moved out, I cleaned the whole room carefully. Yet they still charged me $450 for cleaning!
owner_answer:
Ted, we are so sorry to hear about your negative experience with your unit and the appliances. We would love a chance to talk with you about this. Please get in touch with us by emailing Leasing@UGroupCU.com, calling (217) 352-3182, or visiting our office at 309 S 1st St in Champaign. We look forward to hearing from you.
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text: University Group and its maintenance service team, they are wonderful. I'd highly recommend them. Whenever I requested something not properly working, they repaired it right away and most of time just changed to a new one. I'm highly satisfied with my living condition in this apartment. I'm thankful to University Group.

name: University Group
review_text: While maintenance is decent, they'll definitely screw you out of your security deposit. My roommate and I kept that apartment meticulously clean up until the day we left. We even hired a PROFESSIONAL CLEANING SERVICE to do one last thorough cleaning before leaving. Regardless of that, University Group still deducted cleaning fees from our deposit. When we tried arguing with them about the issue, they're response was to hire a better cleaning service next time. Additionally, they deducted us for a painting fee, even though nothing in our apartment had peeling paint. We even went to the great length of securing us a lawyer to help us with our security deposit case. It took our lawyer almost a year to try and work with them, but they still would not budge on the unfair deductions; therefore, we decided to drop the case due to not wanting to put anymore time and aggravation into it.

name: University Group
review_text: I lived at Gregory Towers with them and they emailed us the summer before our lease started asking us if we wanted to move so they could renovate. They ran out of spaces for people to move into so we had to live with loud construction and workers throwing things off balconies for an entire year. Then in March, they had us move to a new unit so they could renovate ours and they promised we would get our entire security deposit back for doing so. Wrong. They charged us over $600 in cleaning fees after stating in email and the lease that they wouldn't. It's been 3 weeks with no response from them despite calling multiple times. Don't sign with them.
owner_answer:
Maggie, good news! We charged you $600 in a clerical error. We are sincerely sorry for the delay in getting back to you. However, you will be receiving the $600 back IN FULL within the next 5-10 business days.
Thank you for letting us know about this.
We are grateful that you made this issue known to us, Maggie.
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text:
The office people are very nice and professional about the leasing part.
However, the maintenance seems to be too proud about what they're doing.
The dryer in my apartment has not been working well since I moved in. The clothes were heated but still wet. Kevin, who is the maintenance supervisor of my building, insisted that he checked and cleaned the vent.
After five days submitting the request, he came in with "So your dryer is not working AGAIN?" And would not listen to me but kept saying "I have 20 years of experience working on dryers." "It is very normal for a dryer to run two cycles to get the clothes dry."
Until later I personally disconnected the vent to find a whole bag of lint dust soaked in water piled up through out the duct which Kevin said he had cleaned already. Problem solved with zero experience on dryers.

name: University Group
review_text: I lived in Park Place apartments for 3 years and the University Group took over management while I was in my last lease. I had no issues until it was time to get my security deposit back and then it was a major headache. I was charged for professional carpet cleaning when I have emails where I literally had an employee say "I can confirm you will not be charged for this" - but ended up getting charged for it. I was charged $15 for leaving one roll of toilet paper, which I left out of courtesy of any workers that might be in my unit. I was also charged $60 for them to clean the refrigerator, though I took many photos of my unit after I was done cleaning knowing this would happen. Attached is the photo that clearly required no additional cleaning. I will NEVER recommend any leasing company that tries to pull all of this when it comes to giving back your security deposit.

name: University Group
review_text: Phenomenal maintenance personnel- perhaps the best I've ever encountered. I needed a new bed and they replaced it within the same day. My toilet was leaking and it was fixed within 24hrs. They really seem to take pride in their work.

name: University Group
review_text: University group is pretty fast to service maintenance requests. Had a plumbing problem earlier and a door know problem earlier. I think they go it serviced immediately the next morning  even though i had raised the request late night the earlier day.  Good and prompt service

name: University Group
review_text: The University Group has a really prompt maintenance team. They are professional, friendly and fast in responding to the requests and emails. The quality of their service is commendable too. The group has made sure to make me comfortable at the new place. Super content and happy!
owner_answer:
Chappidi, we're so happy you're happy! So glad to hear that you've had a positive experience. We're very proud of our maintenance team!
Follow us on social media! @UniversityGroupCU
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text:
Been living at the Healey Place for the past year. To be fair, the apartments are very nice but the elevator issue has been ridiculous. The elevator at our apartment complex has been broken for over a month. OVER A MONTH. I’ve had to walk up 7 flights of stairs from my car to my apartment every single day. That itself is annoying but the worst part is there are 5 days until my lease ends and the elevator still isn’t fixed. If this elevator isn’t fixed within the next day or two, I don’t know how I’m going to move all of my stuff out and down 7 flights of stairs. It’s been a stress not for me, but plenty of other residents in the complex.

I understand there needing to be time for repair but this has been egregiously long. They emailed us saying it would be fixed this week, but yet it is not. This whole elevator issue ruins any good aspects of the Healey Place or University Group.
owner_answer:
Noah, we are very sorry to hear that the elevator issue at Healey Place has been so challenging. I'm sure it has been frustrating to have to use the stairs for a month. Unfortunately, it is not a simple fix and we want to make sure the elevator is completely safe and functional before it's used by the public again. We are working tirelessly to have the elevator fixed well before your move-out date coming up on August 3!
Once again, we're so sorry for all of the inconveniences you've had to experience with the elevator being down. We would love to speak with you for a chance to make this right. Please email maintenance at Maintenance@UGroupCU.com or call (217) 352-1472. We look forward to hearing from you regarding this.
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text: Take customer complaints very seriously. If you have a problem say something because your concerns will be heard. Has incredible maintenance. They have a fantastic staff that works fast, is knowledgeable and is extremely kind. I lived in a pretty poor apartment and got to know one maintenance worker well ( Rich D.).He was fantastic and I truly believe maintenance deserves a raise for all they do.

name: University Group
review_text: Awesome maintenance staff!! My heat went out. it was 4:00 in the evening when I noticed it.  I emailed maintenance about the issue. I figured nothing would be done until the next day.  Later that evening to my surprise Cory ( I think) brought me 2 space heaters for the night! The next day the heat was fixed! And it’s working great! Thanks University Group and Cory!!!

name: University Group
review_text: I put in a maintenance request for getting my sink fixed and then had to leave the house for a couple hours for an interview and the sink was fixed by the time I got back. I am amazed at the quality and speed of the maintenance team. They deserve all the praise in the world :)

name: University Group
review_text: Not people you can trust. If you plan to live at any of their places please be assured you will not get your deposit back. They will have “cleaning” charger to your account.
owner_answer:
Mohit, thank you for taking the time to give us feedback.
We are so sorry that your experience didn't meet your expectations.
Could you give us some more specific feedback as to how we might improve?
Please email us at Leasing@UGroupCU.com.
We look forward to hearing from you, Mohit.
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text: The university group is like vampire. It will take all your deposit with nonsense reasons. Painting on the wall? I have taken pictures when I move out. There are plenty of proof showing there is no painting. Cleaning fee? We did cleaning and there are pictures proving it.
owner_answer:
Hello Junsheng, we are so sorry that your move out experience hasn't gone as planned.
We have a high standard for the cleanliness of our apartment units.
Once again, we are sorry that the charges were unexpected.
All that being said, we'd love a chance to make this right. Please email us at Account.Inquiries@UGroupCU.com. We look forward to talking with you.
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text: The maintenance team has always been prompt to our needs, fixing most of the issue within a couple of days. Compared to maintenance service of many of my friend's lessors, UGroup's service team stands out! They have a simple and efficient online interface integrated with the rent payment portal, for ease of use. One can upload an image and explain the needs, and rest they take care of. Thanks!

name: University Group
review_text:
PS added after the typically dishonest "answer" from the University Group crook: PLEASE KEEP YOUR phony "regrets" for anybody gullible enough to buy them. You are despicable.

It is rather unfortunate that the overgenerous Google rating system doesn't allow for negative stars. Renting from these people can become a nightmare of biblical proportions. AVOID. Many reviews mention the shady practice of offering tenants a dirty apartment when moving in, while still charging hundreds upon hundreds of dollars worth of the "cleaning" they never do, upon moving out. They've been called on it innumerable times, but they continue this banana republic, corrupt practice. They even respond to reviews with great "innocence" but recidivate over and over and over again. Greed, dishonesty, incompetence, and shamelessness are just the polite ones among the attributes which define "university group". If you don't value your health, by all means go ahead and rent. If there are 5 degrees out there and your heating breaks, or if there are 100 degrees and the AC fails, they will do NOTHING for many long days, not to mention the insolent, callous, crude attitude of the employees, when you "dare" to complain.

In this hospitable, lovely university town, with hundreds of honest, welcoming businesses, "university group" is a stain and a disgrace. Save your money and your health, find a landlord who knows the meaning of decency.
owner_answer:
Hello, we appreciate you taking the time to leave us detailed feedback. We are so sorry that you have experienced all of these frustrations. We can see how frustrating this must have been.

We are typically known for our quick maintenance service. I am very sorry that you experienced an outage and weren't able to get timely service. You must have reached us on a busy day.

As for the security deposit, we have a high standard for the cleanliness of our apartment units. The units must be cleaned according to the move-out procedures on our website. ( https://ugroupcu.com/move-in-move-out/ ) These procedures are the same steps that we go through to make sure the apartment is clean enough for a new renter or it must be cleaned.

Either way, we take making our units ready for the next tenant very seriously.
Once again, we are sorry that the charges were unexpected.
Our team aims to serve our tenants with a high standard of excellence.

We would love to speak with you about this to see how we might improve.
Please email us at Account.Inquiries@UGroupCU.com.
We look forward to hearing from you.
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text: STAY away from this place. I was subleasing an apartment that I did not even get in a 100% clean condition. I was sleeping on the floor for 2 weeks cause they didn’t furnish the apartment as promised. I paid my deposit to the lesser and was promised to get a deposit back. Well, you can say goodbye to your money as soon as you sign the papers with University Group. Charged ridiculous amount for the carpet cleaning and painting walls and kept my check in their office for almost 2 months. Barely got 10% of what was paid to this scammers. Don’t bother replying with your copy/paste answer, I will make sure to leave the worst reviews to your company anywhere possible and let all people I know in Champaign Urbana area to stay away from this company.
owner_answer:
Alyona, we do not have your listed name in our system, however, could you reach out to us about this?
We do appreciate that you informed us of this issue.

We take the cleanliness of our units very seriously and require that our tenants follow the cleaning guidelines detailed on our website closely. You can find them here: https://ugroupcu.com/move-in-move-out/
If the units are not cleaned by following our move-out cleaning guidelines then the unit must be professionally cleaned.

We want to understand your unique situation and how we might improve.
Could you reach out to us?
Please email: Account.Inquiries@UGroupCU.com
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text: I am extremely frustrated with the customer service of the University Group and would not recommend anyone to live in there properties.  Not only is there customer service atrocious they are also charging tenants for services they never completed.  Since we moved in early, our apartment was never cleaned yet they charged the previous tenants for a cleaning fees and proceeded to charge us with a cleaning fee even though we left the apartment 100 times better than how we received it. The previous charges should have covered this years cleaning fee since they already took it out of the previous tenants security deposit but never completed the work.  I have emailed 4 times and called 2 times both times I was told that I needed to wait to hear back via email in the past 2 weeks and have yet to hear back from them on the matter or even receive a detailed list of our charges.  They intentionally only have 1 person responding to questions about the security deposit because we only have a month from the security deposit being finalized to dispute the charges and then blame their poor customer service on the fact only one person is handling those emails.  While they market as a more affordable place to live you should take into account they are basically going to take your whole security deposit.

name: University Group
review_text: As previous people have stated, maintenance is their best point. Affordable, budget-oriented housing group with good locations, hands-off approach to subleasing which is great because of flexibility but can get confusing with wording/accountability (no problems if you sublease with honest people). Always responsive services from Corey! Team kept hard work on multiple issues as they could get to it: new carpeting because of leak, screens, lights, mailbox. Speaking from past experiences, I would hope other leasing companies had maintenance like yours.

name: University Group
review_text: They took my entire security deposit for ridiculous reasons. I was charged for carpet cleaning. Guess what? The apartment doesn't even have carpets! I was charged for rekeying when I returned the key. I was charged for repainting when there was nothing different about the paint from when I moved in vs out. Just a horrible experience.
owner_answer:
Hello Kevin, we are so sorry that you have experienced these security deposit issues.
On rare occasions, our system charges incorrectly. If you do not have carpet then you will receive a refund for that charge. Please email us at the email below if you do not receive that in the coming weeks.
We have a high standard for the cleanliness of our apartment units. The units must be cleaned according to the move-out procedures on our website: https://ugroupcu.com/move-in-move-out/
Once again, we are sorry that the charges were unexpected.
Our team aims to serve our tenants with a high standard of excellence.
Could you reach out to us one more time?
We would love to speak with you for a chance to make this right. Please email us at Account.Inquiries@UGroupCU.com. We look forward to hearing from you, Kevin.
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text:
Great work done by maintenance people!

Update: They haven't kept their promises that new laundry units will be installed in unit when I signed the lease. Been 3 months now still need to go to another building for laundry.

name: University Group
review_text: Living with University Group has been great! I love my location and brand new apartment. The staff is also amazing! They have been responsive to my requests and truly make this place a great place to live.

name: University Group
review_text: Adrian, one of the maintenance technicians, was amazing! He was knowledgeable, friendly, and honest about the issue with our apartment. It is clear that he takes his job seriously and cares about the tenants he is helping. Such a positive experience, and it is a good feeling to know that he is a part of the staff here!

name: University Group
review_text: Unreasonable charges after u leave, they will charge about $1500 for cleaning and painting fees after u leave even if u have cleaned very carefully. Besides, they do not provide any details about the bill, just tell u to give them money. Isn't this insane?
owner_answer:
Marvin, thanks for taking time to give us feedback.
Although we do not see your name in our system, we would like to understand more about your specific situation. Could you reach out to us at the email below?

We have a high standard for the cleanliness of our apartment units. The units must be fully cleaned according to the move-out procedures on our website: https://ugroupcu.com/move-in-move-out/
These procedures are the same steps that we go through to make sure the apartment is clean enough for a new renter or the unit must be professionally cleaned.

Please email us at Account.Inquiries@UGroupCU.com.
We would be happy to discuss your specific situation, Marvin.
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text: I had a really bad experience with University Group a long time ago. University Group took over my current apartment a few years ago, and they've been great since. The management staff has been gracious with responding to my requests to adjust rent increases over the years, and the Maintenance staff stay on top of things as long as you're willing to take the time to go into the office to make the requests.

name: University Group
review_text: I live in 1005 S 6th and the maintenance team is GREATLY kind and capable. I was suffering from the water leakage problem in the restroom and the maintenance technicians got it perfectly repaired. They are very responsive and very friendly to the tenant. I definitely recommend University group housing if your first priority is the maintenance!

name: University Group
review_text: Maintenance department is so nice and so quick, this is one of the many reasons I stayed with the University Group for more than 6 years! Came back from work to find a blind in the bedroom broken and down. Sent in maintenance request and had an amazing maintenance man (Rick) come out and fix it in under an hour.

name: University Group
review_text: University Group's staff and maintenance crew provided great service whenever an issue arose. I had to call the maintenance crew a few times and each instance they resolved the problem relatively quickly. Moreover,  I had a utility billing dilemma after my lease expired. I had called Ameren to turn off my utilities via phone, but was unfortunately kept on for some reason. UGroup's repair staff used up some of the power, which increased my monthly bill by quite a bit even though I was expecting less than $40 for the month. After contacting University Group, they agreed to refund me their portion of the bill. They were understanding and made the problem disappear without giving me any issues.

name: University Group
review_text: I've lived at an apartment at The University Group for a year now and I have nothing but nice things to say about the company. It probably has the most competitive prices out there. For the price I pay, the apartment has some decent furniture. They offer a $100 renewal credit if your renew your lease. The maintenance staff is always ready to help you with any minor thing (I honestly haven't experienced any major issue). The staff in general is very professional and friendly.

name: University Group
review_text: Day classes began and all of the showers backed up on the first floor of one of their buildings, I had furniture that didn't fit in my studio, and someone parked in my parking spot because some idiot without a permit parked in theirs.... maintenance and the leasing consultant I talked with were amazing. They helped me straighten everything out with the parking spot, got rid of the furniture and fixed/cleaned my shower (and I assume the other poor souls'). Definitely a good crew! And this all happened an hour after their office hours started so they are hard at work!

name: University Group
review_text:
I've rented an apt managed by this company and reviews here are spot on, you can pretty much kiss goodbye to your security deposit by signing a lease with them.

Maintenance was quick though.

EDIT: updating it to 3*. I got a small amount back after reaching out to the management office.
owner_answer:
Ankit, we're sorry to hear about this. We're glad to hear that the issue was at least partially resolved. If there is anything else that we can do please reach out to us at Leasing@UGroupCU.com or call (217) 352-3182. We'd love to hear from you!
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text:
They charged 635 for cleaning while other managements only charge $100

I am so disappointed and ran out of words. They deducted my deposit of $720 and left me $85. They claimed they charged -$635 for a heavy cleaning service like heavy clean, carpet cleaning, bedroom kitchen living room (without giving any details of what they actually do). The price are ABSOLUTELY RIDICULOUS. It took me a day to made sure that everything is clean before I left. But... How good would they clean?? The apt was dirty and stain in the sink when I first came. I cleaned again on the day I moved in (and I never complained about it). ******CPM only takes $100 from their tenants for cleaning.  Their contract paper is a trap!!! I was planning to continue with university group in different management.... Not any more.

name: University Group
review_text: Our back door handle was not working properly and within 2 days of my apartment members submitting a maintenance request a technician came by and got it working in about 10 minutes. Very polite, friendly, and incredibly helpful.

name: University Group
review_text: I just moved in Aug 15.. After moving in, there was some problems, something like drainage things. The maintenance team handled my problem within 24 hours. They were really kind and nice. At first, when I checked the google review rate, I worried about University group's bad reputation.  But, I think current low rate is unreasonable. Their service was nice and I was satisfied.

name: University Group
review_text: I re-signed with UGroup and now realize that it was one of the biggest mistakes I have ever made. Be prepared for big charges at the end of your lease. This is a company that will default to taking your security deposit and make you deal with them for several months to get it back. Took an extra month for the landlord to return painting charges for the walls that were unpainted at move-in. I strongly recommend that you stay away from this company. The attached photos are an example of what the apartment looked like when we moved in. Can't believe the management group can live with themselves knowing they run a business like this. Would give 0 starts if it were possible.

name: University Group
review_text:
I spent days cleaning the apartment and made sure everything even better than when I first moved in. However, out of the 1490 deposit, I was only refunded 985. I understand the necessity of carpet cleaning. However,  it completely makes no sense charging 180 for painting and 145 for cleaning while I did all these cleaning and behaving normally. They didn't even care to respond to my email asking for the details of the cleaning fee.

I would have given 0 star if that's an option... this is so disappointing. Avoid at your best unless you don't care for your deposit.

============================================

These were the photos of the apartment when I first moved in, which I suppose is what you called as "high standard" for the cleanliness... these were just a small portion of the collections I took.

============================================

Update after several weeks:
UGroup refunded me the $145 cleaning fee after this post and my 2nd email attempt.
owner_answer:
Hello Eric, thank you for taking the time to let us know about your experience.
We are so sorry that you experienced unexpected charges.

We do have a high standard for the cleanliness of our apartment units. The units must be fully cleaned according to the move-out procedures on our website: https://ugroupcu.com/move-in-move-out/
These procedures are the same steps that we go through to make sure the apartment is clean enough for a new renter or the unit must be professionally cleaned. In this case, cleaning was still necessary to make the unit move-in ready for the next tenant.

We would love to speak with you about this to see how we might improve.
Did you email us at Account.Inquiries@UGroupCU.com?
We look forward to hearing from you, Eric.
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text: I have lived with the University group for two years. If you move in early, they will give you dirty apartments, and then will charge you the multiple cleaning fees later. You can forgot about getting back your deposit. Apartments are seldom maintained. Maintenance staff is unfriendly.

name: University Group
review_text: Consider your deposit gone when you pay these guys. In 2016 they charged me for carpet cleaning in an apartment that didn't have carpets. They also charge outrageous fees for painting and carpet cleaning. Painting and carpet cleaning are standard procedures by any rental company this size.
owner_answer:
Amirali, thank you for taking the time to give us feedback.
We are so sorry that you experienced unexpected charges.
We can certainly understand your frustration.

We have a high standard for the cleanliness of our apartment units. The units must be fully cleaned according to the move-out procedures on our website: https://ugroupcu.com/move-in-move-out/
These procedures are the same steps that we go through to make sure the apartment is clean enough for a new renter or the unit must be professionally cleaned. In this case, cleaning was still necessary to make the unit move-in ready for the next tenant.

In regards to the carpet cleaning fee in apartments that do not have carpet, on rare occasions, our system incorrectly charges tenants. In those cases, the tenants are refunded the carpet cleaning fee.
Did you receive your carpet cleaning refund?

Feel free to reach out to us!
Please email us at Account.Inquiries@UGroupCU.com.
We look forward to hearing from you, Amirali.
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text:
Great

They take covid-19 seriously and have adopted policies and disinfectant programs. 👍👍👍👍👍

Thank you for making my daughter health a priority.

they have 24 hour lock out service.

New apartment complex is constructed well.

New and efficient utilities 🤑🤑🤑

The owner is in the office all the time (plus). I don't know but makes me feel happy to know I can talk to the owner directly. ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
owner_answer:
Vernon, we're glad you're enjoying the new and efficient appliances. Feel free to get in touch with us if you need anything! Follow us on social media! @UniversityGroupCU
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text: Could have received a positive review if it weren't for the deceit during my showing. Me and my roommate toured a unit and asked if anyone was living in it currently. They said no but they keep it open for showings. We said okay well is every unit in this building the same lay out with the same amenities? He said yes. We said are you sure. He said yes. We move in and there is no dishwasher in our unit but there was one in the unit we toured. Kitchen layout in general was very different. We sent an email and they said sorry we don't know who would tell you that and you're out of luck. Shame on us for not getting it in writing but false advertising at the outset bodes horribly for the rest of the experience.
owner_answer:
Hello Carrick, we're sorry to see that this happened. We would love a chance to discuss this with you. Please get in touch with us by emailing Leasing@UGroupCU.com, calling 217-352-1472, or visiting our office at 309 S 1st St in Champaign. We look forward to hearing from you regarding this.
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text:
Edit (2018):

We made the mistake of continuing the lease with UGroup. They've done it again. Scammed $400 from our security deposit. The reason is "cleaning". Literally the bill attached to our security deposit check had "cleaning - $408.25" and NO explanation. I called them for an explanation and they haven't gotten back to me for a month now! Avoid leasing with Ugroup if you can! They love scamming.

Edit (2017):

I got part of the deposit back. It took sometime, but they got back to me because they wanted me to take down this review.

Original post:

Maintenance response is good. But they scam the deposit and when asked about it they said there is a huge wait to meet with the managers to talk about it, which just confirms that there are lot of victims here. It's been months and still they haven't gotten back to me.

name: University Group
review_text: After paying a $1200 security deposit (my roommate paid $600, and I paid $600), we each only received $192 back. We did not break anything, we did not leave the apartment in shambles, and we even made sure to clean before we moved out. I've talked to other tenants in the same building and they said UG also kept more than half of their security deposit. Upon these charges were a "$300 cleaning fee" and "$400 painting fee." Please do not lease with University Group. They think just because you are college students, that it's okay to rob you blind; and in the middle of a pandemic no less.
owner_answer:
Crystal, we're sorry to hear this. We would love a chance to make this right. Please get in touch with us by emailing Leasing@UGroupCU.com, calling 217-352-1472, or visiting our office at 309 S 1st St in Champaign. We look forward to hearing from you regarding this.
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text: The maintenance technicians were very polite and professional. They had my air conditioning repaired in less than 24 hours after putting in a ticket. God Bless you maintenance technicians of the University Group!

name: University Group
review_text: They did an awesome job following up on my maintenance request. It wasn’t up to par the first time, but they checked back in and ask for my feedback. After giving honest feedback, they made sure it was done right. Great customer service.

name: University Group
review_text: University Group has consistently performed maintenance requests within 1-2 days of receiving the requests.  There is a reason I signed a lease for another year.  I've been very happy with my overall experience.

name: University Group
review_text:
Pros: They have a very responsive maintenance group. Any problem is usually resolved in a day or two.
Cons: Will take as much of your security deposit as possible. Charged for painting, cleaning, and rekeying. I handed in all my keys and did not chip any of the paint, yet I was charged for both. Also does not respond to your email claims.

Update: Was finally sent a check for some of the deposit back. It took nearly 6 months and several emails...
owner_answer:
Steve, we very much appreciate your feedback on this. I'm glad the issue was at least mostly resolved. If there is anything else that we can do please reach out to us at Leasing@UGroupCU.com or call (217) 352-3182. We would enjoy hearing from you!
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text: I’m very satisfied with the maintenance service and happy that my request was completed very quickly!! I made the request online and they came at around 9am the next day! The man who did the maintenance was very nice to me and my roommate and did the necessary repairs very quickly! :)
owner_answer:
Ava, we're so glad to hear this! We certainly do our best to resolve any issues in a timely manner. Follow us on social media! @UniversityGroupCU
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text:
I stayed at their property for 1.5 year and I can assure you that they are one of the most dishonest people I have worked with. They charged us all our security deposit for "painting" "carpet cleaning" and other charges. The building itself was in horrible condition and they were renovating it for the new year. So what's the best way to pay for the building renovation? Charge all the tenants their security deposit. And it's funny how all the charges add up exactly to 25-50 dollars less than security deposit. All my friends have similar complaints.
I would recommend to stay away as far as possible from them.

name: University Group
review_text: This review is about security deposit after moving out. One month after I moved out of the property I received a letter asking for money $400! I was expecting $495 refund. They made up very hogh fees like painting and wall repair and carpet cleaning $895!! $345 for painting, 390 general cleaning and $110 for carpet cleaning. I don't know how they came up with that numbers. I am extremely unhappy about this and can't afford to pay this. I guess this is their way of saying that we're not returning your security deposit by asking more and more money.

name: University Group
review_text: Rude and charge as much as they can for your deposit. I have been to their office several times to ask about things. They were rude and easily told you to "talk to their lawyer," when they obviously cannot answer your question. I have stayed in the same apartment for 5 years, and they charged almost all my deposit, mostly due to repainting. When you rent, you should not be charged for normal wear and tear. And what happened to the cheap painting after 5 years? Of course get chipped and discolored. And they charged a lot for it.

name: University Group
review_text:
On moving out, we cleaned our room/bath room/sink/bath tab and also vaccinated the carpet completely.
While after we moved out, they took all our security deposit ($885) with additional charges for "cleaning the carpet" +" cleaning the room" + "painting the room". Similar cases happen a lot among international students.

The University group is the worst and most dishonest landlord I have ever seen in United States up till now.
owner_answer:
Hello, we do not have your listed name in our system. However, we would like to connect with you about this as we do appreciate you letting us know about what you experienced.

We have a high standard for the cleanliness of our apartment units. The units must be cleaned according to the move-out procedures on our website. ( https://ugroupcu.com/move-in-move-out/ ) These procedures are the same steps that we go through to make sure the apartment is clean enough for a new renter or it must be cleaned.

However, we want to understand your individual situation to see how we can improve in the future.
Could you email us about this?
You can email us at: Account.Inquiries@UGroupCU.com
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text: The maintenance team did a good job at responding to requests timely. Kitchen light was broken and they came over to fix it in 2 business days. Kudos to the staff that showed up early morning while its -15 outside.

name: University Group
review_text: Had a great experience with the maintenance team with Ugroup. They have responded to my requests quickly and professionally even when they were not urgent. Big thanks to Cory who is always fast to communicate.

name: University Group
review_text: The maintenance team and indeed the management is fantastic! The maintenance team came out and fixed my AC immediately upon request.  They are timely, innovative and quick responders. Big Kudos to them!!

name: University Group
review_text: Rented a 1 br apt during my time at the university. The apartment was very dingy and rarely ever cleaned. Laundry machines were constantly broken and took forever to get fixed  Neighbor across the complex smoked weed that filled the complex with the smell. Despite repeated complaints University Group did nothing to address the problem. They almost charge too much for their properties. Would advise looking elsewhere.
owner_answer:
Hello Nicholas, we are very sorry to hear about your negative experience with us. If there is anything we can do please email us at Leasing@UGroupCU.com or call (217) 352-3182. We look forward to hearing from you.
-The University Group Team

name: University Group
review_text:
I currently have a lease for a 1BR property for the 2019/2020 rental period. While I haven't yet moved in, I can attest that the University Group's customer service is admirably attentive to their tenants' concerns. I had some issues with the (for me) unforeseen additional fee that is assigned whenever one adds a second tenant to an existing lease. UGroup's representative Meg was able to offer me a monthly rate that better suited my budget, for which I am grateful.

I am rating the University Group four stars for their ability to overcome an initial miscommunication with kindness and flexibility. I intend to revisit my review following my experiences as a resident this next year.

name: University Group
review_text:
Reached out to Property Management due to an outstanding maintenance issue that has not be resolved to date.  As someone who does not create maintenance tickets and to have to wait and have to endure the ignorance of office staff I think its a bit concerning.  It is going on two weeks now where I have had issues gaining entry into my own apartment complex.  When I called and spoke to property staff they were extremely polite to begin with, however, when I asked if I could have an update regarding my maintenance issue I was told that I needed to call a separate number.  I'm not going to hang up to call someone else when I am actually speaking to a member of property staff in management office especially since issues are not being resolved.  This is just creating a further inconvenience for residents.

When I was on the phone with the member of property staff who stated that her name was Bervely, I asked if she would be able to transfer me over because I am not going to hang up and call someone when I am speaking to you, especially since the issue was not been resolved to date.  She said no that she could not transfer me over to maintenance but I could call and I asked if she could ask what the issue is with the my work order, she stated that I called the leasing office and I would need to call maintenance.  When in reality, I called my management company to get an escalation on a work order that has not been completed to date.  And then Beverly decided to hang up on me.

When I called back Beverly picked up the phone and I informed her that I just called in relation to a work order and she hung up on me.  Beverly responded with, "I didn't hang up on you, I transferred you."  I basically went back and forth with Beverly as if I were a child in grade school about the fact that earlier she told me that I had to call the Maintenance number, she responded with you do.  I personally, do not know how someone so trite and just plain ignorant who has zero to no customers service skills whatsoever could be given the responsibility to pick up the phone and represent a company that is reliant on the appreciation of customers.  Not only did Beverly not provide me with adequate customer support but even if she were to hint a smidge of frustration over my end in relation to my outstanding work order to not take my name, unit, and phone number to try to escalate the issue that has been an issue for so long but to just hang up on me, and may I add prior to actually even providing me with the maintenance phone number is by far one of the worst forms of customer support I have ever had the experience of enduring.  Not only that but to be a representative of an industry that is reliant on customers informing them of property conditions and to be non-shalant about a property issue and doesnt do anything to assist in preserving  property is unfair to customers who reside in properties.

name: University Group
review_text:
UPDATE: After I communicated with the manager of UG, he agreed to refund me $60 for Wall Painting as obviously the Wall does not need to be repainted.

BE CAREFUL when you choose to rent from here.
