review_text:
I don't even know where to start.
EVERYTHING went wrong after signing the lease.
Before signing the lease, they treat you like your family.
After signing, they treat you like empty air.
Completely ignored all of my messages and was very disrespectful at many times.
Overall, a very RUDE and TERRIBLE place to live in.
I see that a lot of people had negative experience with them, this pretty much proves their dis-respectfulness.

If you are willing to give us another chance, please contact us at (217) 689-1111 so we can understand your situation better in order to try and turn your experience around.Thank you,The Dean Campustown

name: The Dean Campustown
review_text:
TERRIBLE
They don't reply to your message at all.
Tried contacting them through the portal for more than 6 times.
They just ignore your message.
SAME THING happened to my friends who signed there.
You're paying more than a thousand dollars per month, and they just ignore every message that you send, great job Dean
I wish no one else will experience such a trash service and I encourage everyone to *STAY OUT* of this rude property.

name: The Dean Campustown
review_text: This building's management is ON IT. They truly care about each resident and follow-up on any issues or concerns expressed to them. The open year-round pool & hot tub is also a big plus.
owner_answer: Hi Abigail Pfeiffer, we are very happy to have provided you with such a positive experience!

name: The Dean Campustown
review_text: This appartment is the worst place I have ever lived. First of all, Internet would occasionally break out. One of my friend was taking midterm when dean wiki is broken out and he can only get D on that class. Actually, there is no internet in apartment right now for aound 3 hours and no stuff can be contacted yet. And utilities has to be charged in a totally different platfrom called simple bill which cost you additional service fee each month. Last, if you click on those who grade 5 star, you will find they "coincidentally" have a lot of other review in Texas and nowhere else, it's probably that those reviewers are hired to give 5 star review.
owner_answer: Here at The Dean Campustown, we strive for excellence, and are disappointed to hear that you received anything less. We hope you are willing to give us another chance. Please reach out to us at (217) 689-1111 so we can work towards a resolution.

name: The Dean Campustown
review_text: Its a nice place but i have not had wifi in my room for 2 months. They just kept responding to work orders with complete, but still no wifi, which was promised in my lease. Still get charged full price rent and then some
owner_answer: Matt Cleary, we regret to hear that you had a negative experience with us, but would appreciate the chance to turn your experience around.

name: The Dean Campustown
review_text:
So REGRET to sign the lease with them. There is NO responses after you called them. They set up a time slot for me to check in on August 19th WITHOUT my consent. I can’t arrive at that time due to my flight.
They do NOT response after I called them serveral times.
It said that I can’t get my keys if I do not check in at the time slot they provided. That is Ridiculous!
With their unprofessional services, I do not know why there are many 5 star good reviews.
owner_answer: Hi Alice L, we appreciate your honest review. We set a high standard for ourselves, so we are disappointed to hear that your experience with us was not a positive one. We would like the opportunity to find out how we can better assist you in the future. If you are willing, please contact us (217) 689-1111.

review_text: This group is clearly purchasing reviews to make their score look good, the reviewers all are fake accounts with the same generic review. name: The Dean Campustown
review_text:
The customer service is HORRIBLE.
They never reply to your message or email.
They only care about money, nothing else.
After you sign the lease, the horror begins. You ask them 10 questions through the email / message and you will get ZERO response.
With this kind of service, I can't justify the high cost of living there.
Signing the lease here has been the worst decision this year.
I hope nobody else suffers from this. AVOID AVOID AVOID this place

review_text: While living at the hub they have been generous and have made the living experience here great! They are very helpful with any issues that might come up and are quick to fix it. They also have many amenities that add to the overall experience living here. Overall, the hub has done a great job creating a living experience that has been fun and enjoyable.

name: Hub on Campus Champaign - Daniel
review_text: Living at the Hub has been an amazing experience. The amenities the building offers makes for a luxury residence. Everything from the rooftop pool to the workout room and 6th floor outdoor terrace is incredible.  Additionally, the staff including front desk workers, management and maintenance are all so friendly and quick to help with any issues you may experience.  The building location is unbeatable and makes it easy to get around campus.

review_text: I’ve been living at hub for the past 3 years with my roommates. I love the centralized location, only a few minutes from green street, my classes, and the quad. The amenities here are great, I use the gym year round and love the rooftop pool during the summer months. I’ve met some amazing people living here and all the staff are nice and always willing to help.

The staff is super helpful and the location is so close to the quad. I already resigned for next year and will continue to live here until I graduate.

name: Hub on Campus Champaign - Daniel
review_text: We went on a tour of the Hub and fell in love with the space they showed to us. When moving my daughter in it wasn’t anything like what they showed us. Her room was like a dungeon and it wasn’t updated like the apartment they show to everyone. So, we asked for her to be moved and they wouldn’t let us see the apartment first but they said it would be closer to the one they showed us. WRONG!!!! They moved my daughter from a dungeon to complete filth. I am horrified by how dirty this apartment is. A film of grease and grime on literally every part of it. The floors are filthy and the air vent was so full and black. After asking around to some of the residents the hub apparently has a reputation of lying about EVERYTHING! We went from so excited to get my daughter into this cool space we saw to overwhelmed and sad and spending a fortune on cleaning supplies. Instead of a fun experience I’m having to spend my time cleaning this disgusting apartment. The management should be embarrassed. I’m embarrassed for them. Do your research and ask many questions. It’s not what they show you. I’ll show some pics but they don’t do it justice. Way worse in person.
owner_answer: Tina, thank you for voicing your concerns. We are displeased to hear about the inconvenience these issues have caused you. I truly appreciate you taking the time to discuss this matter over the phone today and hope to have a positive year moving forward. – Renee Severe, Community Manager

name: Hub on Campus Champaign - Daniel
review_text:
Reasons why you should live at the Hub:

Living in an apartment complex with excellent amenities can greatly enhance your quality of life. The terrace provides a beautiful outdoor space to relax and enjoy fresh air, while the pool offers a refreshing place to cool off during the hot summer months. Having access to a beautiful clubroom provides a great space for entertaining guests or hosting events. It can also be a place to socialize and meet new people within the complex.

For those who need a quiet space to study or work, the study spots in the lobby can be a convenient solution. The lobby can also serve as a communal area where residents can relax and chat with neighbors.

The furniture and amenities in the apartment complex can also make a significant difference in your living experience. If the furniture is comfortable and stylish, it can make your apartment feel like a home. Large windows can provide plenty of natural light, making your space feel bright and inviting. Additionally, amenities such as a gym and package delivery services can make life more convenient for residents.

One of the most important factors in any apartment complex is the staff. It is important to have friendly and attentive staff who can assist with any issues or concerns that arise. They can provide a sense of security and ensure that the complex is well-maintained and safe for residents.

Overall, living in an apartment complex with excellent amenities and attentive staff can greatly improve your quality of life. It can provide opportunities for relaxation, entertainment, and socialization, while also making daily tasks more convenient. So if you are fortunate enough to live in such a place, be sure to express your gratitude to the staff for their hard work and dedication to creating a comfortable and enjoyable living environment.

Living at the Hub was one of the best decisions I have made. I wish everyone could experience this living environment for your college experience!
owner_answer: John, you’re too kind! We sincerely value your feedback and are so happy that you are enjoying living here at Hub Champaign Daniel! Please let us know if there is anything we can do to improve your experience. Have an awesome day! -Kelcie O'Neal, Community Leasing Manager

name: Hub on Campus Champaign - Daniel
review_text: My name is Celeste Fallas, I have been a resident here since August and I have resigned for the next year. One of the many things I love about The Hub is that I cannot hear anything outside of my window while it is closed or pretty much anything from neighbors other than the occasional noise. I also love how close and active it is to all my classes. All the staff is extremely helpful with the questions I have. The unit is also updated with decent appliances. However, I do have issue with the lack of parking available and some of the flimsy qualities of the other furniture in the units. My closet shelving has slowly started to come apart throughout the year. Otherwise, maintenance has been very active in fixing these issues when I put in requests. Thank you so much for keeping up with everything.
owner_answer: Thank you for your review, Celeste! We care for our residents and take all feedback very seriously. We are thrilled that the majority of your experience at Hub Champaign Daniel has been enjoyable, but are sorry to hear that some things failed to meet your expectations. We want to go above and beyond to deliver exceptional customer service to our residents. We are confident that we can improve your experience at Hub Champaign Daniel. Please feel free to contact our office if you wish to further discuss your concerns. Thanks, Josee Carlson, Community Manager

A big 'chase' after our two months rent refund that they required upon signing the lease!"

name: Hub on Campus Champaign - Daniel
review_text: The Hub has been an interesting place to live. While there are many luxury aspects of the apartment such as the lobby area, pool and rooftop areas, I have faced many problems with maintenance areas. For example, we were provided with an oven that had malfunctioned in an apartment, but was placed in ours and we weren't made aware of potential safety concerns with it until second semester of living here. The stairways and exit hallways are not well kept and are dirty, as well as the outdoor lounge not being cleaned which removed some of the pleasant atmosphere of it. Additionally, we had problems with our thermostat and a maintenance guy who came in just told us not to put on the AC because it wasn't working rather than fixing it. Lastly, while I have had a couple positive experiences with staff, my roommates have had rude encounters when having discussions with staff about problems they were having. Another issue is that the layout we were provided with didn't match what we had in our apartment. A couple of things were positive, like 100 sheets of free printing per month and safety with the key fobs. However, for the price I am paying each month the lack of upkeep and issues with maintenance is ridiculous, which is why I am not choosing to live there again next year.
owner_answer: Thank you for voicing your concerns. Maggie, I sincerely apologize for the frustration these items have caused you. We are dedicated to finding a resolution to your situation. To discuss in more detail, will you please call me at (217)615-2983 or livechampaign@huboncampus.com? I look forward to hearing from you soon. -Josee Carlson, Community Manager

name: Hub on Campus Champaign - Daniel
review_text: Good Location, nice amenities. Fire alarms go off a ton and since it’s a corporate chain they have more of those kinda secret add on fees (mandatory insurance etc) than a local company would. They also do giveaways based on reviewing them on google so maybe take some of these reviews with a grain of salt. Enjoyed my time here, I like the pool when it’s filled. Not all bedrooms will have a window and some look into other peoples rooms so don’t expect every window to be a cool view.
owner_answer: Thank you for the honest feedback. If there is anything we can do further for you, please don't hesitate to reach out! -The Hub Champaign Daniel Team

name: Hub on Campus Champaign - Daniel
review_text: Super disappointed with the Hub's move out inspection. They already require DEEP cleaning before moving out (cleaning the fan, inside the fan light, etc.), which is not required to that extent many other places, but also charges fees for ANYTHING after move-out. I got a $150 fee calming that painting ALL of my bedroom walls is needed because of holes (the size of small nails and thumb tacks). Even if they are filled, you still get charged. On top of this, I was told during my tour that you are ALLOWED to have holes up to the size of a dime or nickel and no need to fill or paint when moving out. Very disappointed with them.
owner_answer: Kathryn, thank you for your feedback. We hope to have the chance to resolve this issue for you. Should there be any mistakes on our end, we truly apologize. Please reach out to us at LiveChampaign@HubOnCampus.com so we can be of assistance. Thanks. -The Hub Champaign Daniel Team

name: Hub on Campus Champaign - Daniel
review_text: DO NOT live here. They will charge you an ABSURD amount of money in "damages, painting", etc. for the smallest paint chip or literally made up damages (pictures that literally show no damages). Before moving out, I spoke to management and asked whether the apartment needed to be perfectly clean and they told me no. Then they try to charge me an absurd amount of money for the smallest little things and even things that maintenance should have been keeping up with, such as changing the HVAC. They tried to charge us for a missing desk chair that they never gave us in the first place, and a missing fridge shelf that never existed. The lease says that they won't charge you for paint and damages that do not exceed expectations for the duration of your renting period, then do exactly that. They say that you can discuss and dispute the charges, yet when you email, they do not have a conversation with you, rather minorly adjust the charges but not adjust to what the charges should really be. It is against Champaign country regulations what they are doing. They are GREEDY and EXTORTIONISTS. Do not bother.
owner_answer:
Hailey, thank you for your feedback. We understand communication with our current and former residents is very important. We apologize that your experience here failed to meet your expectations and take this
review as a chance to improve moving forward. Thank you. -Renee Severe, Community Manager

But it is nice to live at an apartment building that feels like a retreat. It is truly a home away from home and a great community to live in! Highly recommend.

name: Hub on Campus Champaign - Daniel
review_text:
Loved my experience at HUB as it was so close to classes, has a coffee shop, and nice studying areas! It is so centrally located and has really full amenities and events. Maintenance is always very quick, but I will say that the washers and dryers are not the best.

I have had a few poor experiences in roommate matching, getting an interior room when I paid for one with windows (this was mitigated), and with water pressure sometimes being wonky. Just know that the touring unit is probably not what your unit will look like (we have exposed concrete in our living room and ceilings, making it look unfinished). Guest policy is also a lot shorter than JSM's and they don't give you more fridges/storage space in a 4x4.

Overall though, I like how soundproof it is, the TV's, nest (I think VIP upgrade?), mattress, and how modern it looks!
owner_answer: Thank you for giving us your thorough feedback, Serena. We are happy to hear that overall you have loved calling Hub Champaign Daniel your home! We have really enjoyed having you as a part of our community. I am sorry to hear about the inconveniences that you have experienced. Please feel free to email us livechampaign@huboncampus.com so that we may further discuss your issues. -The Hub Champaign Daniel Team

name: Hub on Campus Champaign - Daniel
review_text: Changing my review from 5 stars to 1. For a 400 sq ft apartment I was charged $800 move out fee for normal wear & tear. $100-200 can be rationalized. $800 is ABSURD. Hire professional cleaners before you move out or expect to receive a bill for literal dust in the corner of your room. 2 year resident from the start of the Hub, wouldnt recommend it to anyone anymore.
owner_answer: Ava, thank you for your feedback. We hope to have the chance to resolve this issue for you. Should there be any mistakes on our end, we truly apologize. name: Hub on Campus Champaign - Daniel
review_text: There is no better location to live at UIUC based on proximity to campus buildings, amenities, and lifestyle within the building. The Hub offers a short walk (~10 minutes) to almost every school building you need to get to which is essential for students. Plus, the building goes out of its way to create community-building events for its residents to meet each other and build a sense of comradery which I have not seen anywhere else on UIUC's campus. The apartments are nicely furnished and access to the gym is always available. My only complaint would be that I wish the pool was open more regularly, but that is dependent on the inclement weather we get here in Champaign and not the properties doing at all. They do great at everything that is in their control including solving the maintenance problems that are inevitable to come up in any building in a timely manner!

name: Hub on Campus Champaign - Daniel
review_text:
As a recent resident of this stunning luxury apartment complex in Champaign, Illinois, I feel compelled to share my fantastic experience with others who may be considering a move. From the breathtaking views to the top-notch amenities, every aspect of life here exudes luxury and convenience.
First and foremost, the view from my apartment is nothing short of spectacular. The floor-to-ceiling windows provide an unobstructed panorama of the city's skyline, while the natural light pouring in creates an airy and welcoming ambiance. Watching the sun rise and set each day has become a personal highlight and a constant reminder of the beauty that surrounds us.

The outdoor pool area is an oasis that instantly transports you to a high-end resort. Surrounded by comfortable lounge chairs, it's the perfect place to relax and soak up some sun after a long day. The pool itself is immaculate, with crystal-clear water that's always at the perfect temperature.

As a fitness enthusiast, I'm particularly impressed with the on-site workout room. Filled with state-of-the-art equipment and plenty of space to move, it rivals any high-end gym I've visited. From cardio machines to free weights, there's something for everyone, regardless of their fitness level. Plus, the floor-to-ceiling mirrors and ambient lighting create an inspiring atmosphere that motivates me to push harder during my workouts.

One of the standout features of this apartment complex is the attentive and professional staff. From the moment I first inquired about living here, they've gone above and beyond to ensure my every need is met. It's clear that the management team takes great pride in providing exceptional service to their residents.

The location of the luxury apartment is another major perk. Nestled in the heart of Champaign, I'm just a stone's throw away from shopping, dining, and entertainment options.

Inside my apartment, the attention to detail is evident in every corner. High-quality fixtures and finishes, such as quartz countertops and stainless steel appliances, create a modern and sophisticated living space. The open floor plan allows for seamless movement between the living and dining areas, while the spacious bedrooms offer ample storage and a restful retreat at the end of the day.

In summary, my experience living at this luxury apartment complex in Champaign has been nothing short of extraordinary. The combination of stunning views, resort-style amenities, and impeccable service has elevated my lifestyle to new heights.
owner_answer: We are so pleased to hear that you enjoy living at Hub Champaign Daniel! Thank you so much for the sweet words and for such a detailed review of Hub! As always, feel free to stop in the office to say hey! Thanks, -Kelcie O'Neal, Community Leasing Manager

name: Hub on Campus Champaign - Daniel
review_text:
Overall, I have enjoyed my experience being a Hub community member. While here, I have appreciated having so many ammenties to use and events to participate in. Additionally, I appreciate the staff always being so friendly and willing to help when needed!

Would reccomand!

Thank you for your positive review! We are ecstatic to hear our team gave you excellent customer service!  We look forward to seeing you soon, Gabby,

name: Hub on Campus Champaign - Daniel
review_text: My roommates and I chose to live at The Hub this year since we had friends who lived here in the past and told us they loved it. Overall we have been happy with our decision and agree with all the typical positive reviews mentioning location convenience, nice apartments, lots of amenities, and social aspects. The only frustration for me has been with follow through on maintenance requests. We have had a few issues in our apartment and they’ve taken weeks to be resolved. Our dishwasher did not work since August move in and it was not fixed until after fall break. Currently, our ice machine has been broken for a few weeks. We were told we’d be getting a new one but are still waiting. This kind of stuff happens at all complexes though so it’s not really something we could’ve avoided by living somewhere else.
owner_answer: Thank you for your review, Rachel! We care for our residents and take all feedback very seriously. We are thrilled that the majority of your experience at Hub Champaign Daniel has been enjoyable, but are sorry to hear that some things failed to meet your expectations. We want to go above and beyond to deliver exceptional customer service to our residents. We are confident that we can improve your experience at Hub Champaign Daniel and hope you’ll decide to stay with us next year. Thanks, Kelcie O'Neal, Community Leasing Manager

name: Hub on Campus Champaign - Daniel
review_text: I signed a $900+ lease for a room on the pent house floor, and I couldn’t have been more disappointed. The one glaring issue that I have is that my room doesn’t even have a window, and my room is incapable of getting a good air flow. I’ve woken up constantly with a dry throat and nearly choking. Secondly, the window we do have in the main area doesn’t even look out towards champaign, it looks directly into a girl’s bedroom (I live in a guy’s apartment) and it makes everyone extremely uncomfortable. Do not sign a lease for the room 1324. Plus one star because of the amazing location, but I personally cannot wait to leave.

name: Campus Circle
review_text: I live in three different apartments during my UG time in UIUC, and Campus Circle is the best! Great price with large spaces, perfect amenities and super-friendly faculties! The apartment facilities are relatively new and they come with indoor washing and laundry, oven and a TV. There’s no network fee as well. And there’s bus stop right outside the leasing office, 20 minutes you can get to anywhere around the campus. The staff are very friendly, willing to help with most of the problems! They showed professionalism quite a lot! Great experience, surely would recommend!
owner_answer: Shen Ricky, thank you for sharing your positive experience with us!  It makes us so happy when we hear good things from our customers and it encourages us to keep striving hard to create positive experiences for our residents and guests.  Please let us know if you ever have any ideas for improvement - your feedback helps us grow.  We look forward to having you stick around as a resident (and tell your friends to come live with us too!) Thanks! - Your Campus Circle Team, (217) 619-0116, campuscircle@peakmade.com.

name: Campus Circle
review_text: If there was a way to give this place no stars, it would be the first thing I give it. this place was disgusting. From the Smell of garbage throughout the hallways To the people that have come in and stolen bicycles and vehicles. The staff is not accommodating at all here. There have been massive parties on the rooftops and they tow peoples cars that live here. On top of all of this is they charge outrageous fees for moving in and out of this apartment. Just know this is not a luxury apartment and the management continues to change. Horrible treatment of the people who live here.
owner_answer:
Hello,

I'm sorry to hear about your experience at our apartment community. We genuinely apologize for any inconveniences you faced during your stay. We understand cleanliness and feeling comfortable are essential factors in creating a positive living environment and we strive to maintain a high standard.

Regarding the issues mentioned, we do charge for extreme cleaning and damages that go beyond normal wear and tear. This is to ensure we can maintain the premises for the benefit of all residents. We are always open to reviewing specific cases to ensure fairness.

For the gatherings on the rooftops, we are constantly working with our courtesy patrol and our residents to ensure these can be reported and addressed immediately.  We apologize for any disturbances that were not reported.  

Our team is dedicated to providing the best possible service to all residents. We value your feedback and are committed to learning from it to improve our services and address any shortcomings.  We apologize for your experience and hope you will give us another chance to make things right. If you have any specific concerns or issues you would like to discuss, please feel free to reach out to us directly. Your satisfaction is important to us, and we will do our best to address your concerns and create a better living environment for everyone in the community. 

Sincerely,

Campus Circle Management

name: Campus Circle
review_text: The apartment furniture is the best of all of campus it gives nice luxury hotel. The closet space is nice & big but definitely not enough for us ladies!! Only issues I have with the apartment is packages tend to get lost but the staff is super helpful! Especially Mario who was even able to help with a huge spider in my apartment I was too chicken to kill. The rent might get a little crazy but they do have deals so I would definitely recommend!
owner_answer:
Dear Destiny,

Thank you so much for taking the time to share your feedback about our apartments. We're thrilled to hear that you find our furniture to be top-notch, providing a luxurious hotel-like experience. We strive to create a comfortable and stylish living environment for our residents.

We understand that closet space is an important consideration, especially for our female residents. While we aim to provide spacious closets, we appreciate your feedback and will take it into account for future improvements.

We're glad to hear that our staff, particularly Mario, has been helpful and accommodating. We pride ourselves on providing exceptional service, whether it's assisting with package inquiries or even handling unexpected visitors like the spider you mentioned. We're here to ensure your peace of mind and a comfortable living experience.

Regarding the rent, we understand that it can be a concern for some. However, we consistently offer special deals and promotions to make living in our community more affordable. We appreciate your recommendation and are delighted that you would recommend us to others.

If you have any further suggestions or concerns, please don't hesitate to reach out to us. We value your feedback and are always striving to improve the resident experience.

Thank you again for choosing our apartments, and we look forward to continuing to provide you with a wonderful living environment.

name: Campus Circle
review_text:
UPDATE:

Another leasing team member later took the responsibility and helped me solve the issue. Special thanks to the diligent and exceptional work of Whitney, who really cares how residents feel.

-----------------------------------------

When I was in the process of selecting a unit, I was recommended for my current one with what was described as "premium features", notably including big windows. I was also shown a model room (regular one) in which the window was openable, which is important to me as I care about air freshness and humidity.

However, upon moving into the actual unit, I discovered that all the big windows in my unit are not openable, thereby depriving me of any natural air flow.

This detail was never communicated to me by the leasing team beforehand, and the misrepresentation in the model room further misled me in my decision-making process. If I had been made aware of this, I would have certainly opted for a different unit.

Moreover, I find it objectionable that I am charged an additional fee for this the big window as "premium feature" – about an extra $20 per month.

While I would like to believe that this omission of information was not intentional, unfortunately, it does give the impression of dishonesty.

More sadly, when I approached the assistant manager of the building seeking a resolution or potential compensation for this issue, I felt she was being impatient and trying to brush me off without a real discussion or any meaningful effort to address the situation by just stating there’s nothing she could do as there’s no such policy.
owner_answer:
We appreciate your detailed feedback and apologize for the inconvenience you've faced regarding the windows in your unit. We understand your frustration and acknowledge that our communication could have been clearer in this regard.

While it's not typical for us to explicitly mention that windows are non-openable during tours for a select amount of premium units with big window views, we recognize that this detail is important to you, and we're sorry for any misalignment between your expectations and the actual unit. We genuinely strive to provide accurate information during the selection process.

We did our best to fulfill your preferences based on your description, and we understand that we fell short in meeting your expectations in this specific aspect. Your feedback highlights an area where we can improve to ensure our residents' needs and preferences are better understood and addressed.

Thank you for giving us the opportunity to address this matter. Your input is valuable, and we're committed to learning from this experience and enhancing our communication and service going forward. If there's anything else you'd like to discuss or if you have further questions, please feel free to reach out to us directly.

name: Campus Circle
review_text:
Where do I even begin? My friends and I started the apartment search pretty late in the game and were concerned that we wouldn't be able to find an apartment that we loved. However, what I appreciated about CC is that management here is super friendly, helpful, and accommodating in getting us housed for next year.

Of course, CC isn't the only apartment with competitive features. However, here are some features that really won our hearts:

- Fantastic Amenities: 20 study rooms with screens and open tables? This is a student's dream, and as a telecommuter, I'm even more impressed with how every floor has a handful of conference rooms for group or individual studying. The clubhouse, gym, etc. are really nice, but the sheer number of conference rooms far exceeded any that we saw in other apartment complexes.

- Location, Location, Location: Proximity to the Engineering library on campus is key. You can bike, bus, or walk to campus in a matter of minutes.

- Super responsive management: Shout out to ZACH! Every email, phone call, question, etc. was fielded promptly and with a friendly willingness to help. Zach even stayed after hours to help clear up any of myriad of questions and get through the application/lease signing process. I saw other residents pop in and out of the leasing office for random requests, and there were always a handful of staff that jumped on to help them.

- Diversity & Community: It's no big secret that UIUC hosts a rich demographic of students from various backgrounds. It feels friendly, community-like, and safe and I see really cute decorations hung up around people's doors celebrating their cultural background. Every resident I've run into has been nice, and I see various people walking their dogs around. It feels like a nice dorm experience but with an upscale swing.

- Parking: CC has way more affordable parking than other vendors out there. And during the winter when it snows, you'll want covered parking if you own a car.

- Layouts: The units that we visited (and I visited friends' non-model units as well for a "real look") were pretty clean and comparable to the ones we saw online through pictures. I like the kitchen island space since I do plan on cooking a lot, but the furnishings are convenient if you don't want to move in/out a lot of items.

I can't speak much for the roommate selection process since I'm moving in with friends I already know, but each one of the rooms can lock according to a keyfob so it seems to be reasonably safe & private if that's your thing.

Needless to say, my friends and I are super stoked to be able to move in :) Good luck on your apartment search, everyone!
owner_answer: Hi Esther,WOW - We are blown away by how thoughtful this review was. We are so thankful for the team that we have in place to ensure your experience is worth a review like this. :)We were more than happy to adjust our time for you as we are with anyone. Your time is just as important as ours. If you have any other questions or need anything at all, please let us know! All the best, Zach | Leasing Manager

name: Campus Circle
review_text: Its is not a bad or good review. It is just a feedback to management. My friend is already second year with CC (Campus Circle), and this her last year. She told me that CC does a very nice treats for residents like free massage or desserts and etc. Unfortunately, she said that they only give it to first top 10 residents who signed up. The issue is, CC never been transparent with their selections. They never inform who were the winners and even if they selected the winners. So it seems like they have favorite people to select among all list or even not giving these type of rewards at all. It is a minor thing since CC does not even have to do it, but if they organize such days with treats where people have to sign up, they have to be transparent and show how they selected and etc. Like any lottery in the world. So it does not matter for her since she is leaving, but it would be nice for the future residents. Decided to leave it here. Sending my much love to everyone at CC.
owner_answer:
Thank you for taking the time to provide us with your feedback. We understand your frustration regarding the transparency of our selection process for events like free massages or desserts. We apologize for any confusion caused.

We'd like to clarify that we typically organize these treats for a few select events, particularly during summer hours when there are fewer residents present. We do understand the importance of transparency, and while we may not explicitly announce the winners to everyone, we often post the names of the winners on our social media platforms, specifically on our Instagram page (@campuscircleurbana). We encourage you to check out our social media for updates and announcements regarding these events.

We appreciate your input and will take it into consideration as we strive to improve our communication and make these events more inclusive and transparent for future residents. Thank you again for your review, and we send our warmest regards to you and everyone.

name: Campus Circle
review_text: I came to take a tour and the process was so easy. The facility was beautiful and the apartments are really nice. I do need to brag on Whitney Redman though. She’s fairly new she said but she went above and beyond to help with any questions I had. She’s so kind and super friendly.
owner_answer: We truly appreciate your kind words about Whitney Redman. We take great pride in our team members, and it's always a pleasure to hear when someone goes above and beyond to provide exceptional service. We will make sure to pass along your compliments to Whitney and recognize her dedication to creating a positive living environment for our residents.

name: Campus Circle
review_text: The apartment staff demonstrated exceptional commitment to customer service, handling an unexpected moving situation with remarkable care and efficiency. They coordinated seamlessly with my friends, transforming a potential hassle into a smooth process. It's a community that genuinely prioritizes its residents' comfort and needs.
owner_answer:
Thank you for sharing your experience with the apartment staff. It's wonderful to hear that they demonstrated exceptional commitment to customer service and went above and beyond to handle your unexpected moving situation with care and efficiency.

The fact that they seamlessly coordinated with your friends and turned a potential hassle into a smooth process is truly commendable. It reflects their dedication and professionalism, ensuring that your comfort and needs were prioritized throughout the entire experience.

Creating a community that genuinely cares about its residents speaks volumes about the apartment staff's commitment to fostering a positive living environment. Their efforts in providing outstanding customer service contribute to making the community a welcoming and comfortable place to call home.

Your review highlights the staff's remarkable care and efficiency, and I'm sure it will be valuable feedback for both the apartment management and prospective residents considering this community.

name: Campus Circle
review_text:
I worked at Campus Circle for 3 years, as a leasing consultant, and then as the Assistant Manager. I left Campus Circle last month after getting my Master's, and I am very confident in the staff and management.

The Property Manager, Meriem, is wonderful, caring, and has big goals and aspirations for making Campus Circle the best place it can be. The Assistant Manager, Cat, is extremely kind, empathetic, and cares about the residents. The Leasing Manager, Abbey, is genuine, personable and always willing to help. Emily, a leasing consultant, knows many residents by name and makes them feel welcomed and at home. Mario, another leasing consultant, is funny and always willing to help. The maintenance supervisor, Marcus, is incredibly hard working, detail oriented, and trustworthy.

I have nothing but good things to say about the staff. They go above and beyond to make sure that Campus Circle is a great place to call home!
owner_answer:
Dear Sophie,

Thank you so much for taking the time to write such a wonderful review of Campus Circle. We greatly appreciate your kind words and are thrilled to hear that you had such a positive experience working with our staff during your time here.

We are also very proud of the team we have assembled at Campus Circle and are grateful for the contributions they make each day to ensure our residents feel welcomed and at home. It is always wonderful to hear feedback from former employees such as yourself, and we are delighted to know that you have such high regard for our staff.

We miss having you around and would love to catch up with you sometime. Please do not hesitate to stop by and say hello whenever you are in the area. We hope you are doing well and wish you all the best in your future endeavors.

name: Campus Circle
review_text: I love it here.  Everything I need is close by and in walking distance if need be.  The tour was amazing! I want to give a huge shout out to Whitney Redman.  She is absolutely amazing.  Very easy to talk too, caring and friendly!
owner_answer:
Thank you for your wonderful feedback! We're delighted to hear that you're enjoying your experience at our establishment and that everything you need is conveniently located within walking distance. We're thrilled that you had an amazing tour.

We greatly appreciate your kind words regarding Whitney Redman. We'll make sure to pass along your compliments to her. It's fantastic to know that she made a positive impression on you with her approachability, care, and friendliness. We value our team members who go above and beyond to provide exceptional service to our residents.

If there's anything else we can assist you with or if you have any further feedback, please don't hesitate to let us know. We're here to ensure that your stay with us continues to be enjoyable and fulfilling. Thank you once again for your kind words, and we look forward to providing you with continued excellent service.

name: Campus Circle
review_text:
Multiple car break-ins in the parking garage several weeks ago, and now another incident in the ‘secured’ bike storage room. Following uninformed instructions from an employee resulted in my car being towed, along with associated fees and damage to my car; following an employee’s instructions had me facing all the repercussions. And now my bike was stolen.

While certain measures are being taken to up security, the damage has already been done, and I faced all the financial repercussions. This is completely unacceptable.
owner_answer:
Dear Ahmed,

I want to extend my deepest empathy for the experiences you've had with the recent incidents in our parking garage and bike storage room. It's truly disheartening to hear about the difficulties you've faced and I understand your concern.

Upon thorough investigation, we discovered your car was parked in an area where towing is enforced due to unauthorized parking.  Additionally, your vehicle was not registered in our system, making it challenging for us to promptly reach out to you. This combination of factors resulted in your car being towed.

I want to assure you that your concerns are of the utmost importance to us.  We are taking decisive action to enhance patrol measures throughout our building. This includes implementing an overnight security guard.
Please know we deeply value you as a resident.  If there is anything else we can do to assist you or if you have any further concerns, please do not hesitate to reach out to us. We are here to listen, support, and address your needs to ensure you have a 5 star living experience in our community.

Sincerely,

Campus Circle Management Team

name: Campus Circle
review_text: This apartment is overall really nice and the people who work here are also super helpful. I really enjoy all the amenities that they offer for the residents. Jerry is always super helpful with packages and any other questions or concerns I may have as well. A great experience!
owner_answer: Thank you for your review! Jerry is awesome and we are lucky to have him!

name: Campus Circle
review_text: I enjoyed the time living in this apartment, and I feel really thankful to those warm people who work here, especially Nakya. She helped me a lot with my sublease. I wasn’t quite familiar with the process, and she was always kind and nice to help me solve problems, confirm important information with me, double check the request that I made. I believe Campus Circle would be better and better in the future with the help of such excellent employees.
owner_answer: Thank you so much for your review!!! It is so nice to hear your appreciation of Nakya and recognizing her. She really is a star employee and we are lucky to have her! We are also glad to hear your positive experience here at Campus Circle. Anytime any of our residents are happy with their experience is a motivation to keep giving 5 star service. Thank you!

name: Campus Circle
review_text:
EDIT: Want to edit this to warn people. The people who helped us sign the lease no longer work there, and it's not worth my initial review.

When we moved in, the place was disgusting. They charged us three weeks of rent for cleaning and preparing the place before we were allowed to move in. But clearly they didn't clean the place. There was red stuff in the dishwasher, dirt and trash, dust CAKED onto the floors... We called maintenance asking for help, and the guy said incredulously, "I don't have a mop."

Well, fast forward to us scrubbing the place down, putting up with it for a year, and moving out.... I just got a notice from a debt collector 5 months after I moved out that I owe them additional post-moving cleaning fees?? The fees don't make sense, and it's frustrating, given our bad move in experience. I tried to call them and they said there's nothing they can do about these fees now that it's gone to a debt collector.

Live somewhere else that's cheaper and with better management!
owner_answer:
Hi Mackenzie,

Thanks so much for leaving this kind review! It is wonderful to hear that other people are talking about Campus Circle as well. We take pride in these types of reviews since it is one of Peak's Mindsets to "Create Moments" for all current residents and future residents alike.
Looking forward to you moving in!

All the best,
Zach | Leasing Manager

name: Campus Circle
review_text:
Campus Circle Apartments is an excellent property. As a former employee, I had the pleasure to serve residents alongside a team of dedicated leasing consultants and managers who truly care for the personhood of our residents and staff. The leasing office team collaborates to ensure prospect concerns and residents needs are met in a reliable and timely matter. name: Campus Circle
review_text: Whitney gave me a tour and she was very thorough in ensuring that I had all of the information. Very nice person and very nice apartments and facility.
owner_answer:
Thank you for sharing your experience with us! We're delighted to hear that Whitney provided you with a thorough and informative tour of our apartment complex. We take pride in our team's dedication to providing exceptional customer service, and it's wonderful to know that Whitney went above and beyond to ensure you had all the information you needed.

We're also thrilled to hear that you found our apartments and facilities to be very nice. We strive to create a comfortable and welcoming environment for our residents, and we're glad that our efforts have met your expectations.

We will make sure to pass along your kind words to Whitney. Recognition like this motivates our team to continue delivering outstanding service.

If you have any further questions or if there's anything else we can assist you with, please feel free to reach out. We appreciate having you as a prospective resident, and we hope to have the opportunity to serve you and provide you with a wonderful living experience.

name: Campus Circle
review_text:
I recently completed a year of living at Campus Circle Apartments and I couldn't be more thrilled with my experience. This modern, well-designed community offers a perfect combination of convenience, luxury, and top-notch amenities that cater to students and young professionals alike.

Location: Campus Circle is ideally situated within walking distance to the university campus, making it a breeze to get to classes, events, and study sessions. The surrounding neighborhood is vibrant, filled with various shops, eateries, and entertainment options that make it easy to enjoy a balanced lifestyle.

Apartment Features: The apartments themselves are spacious, with contemporary design elements and high-quality fixtures. The full-sized kitchen, complete with stainless steel appliances, provided me with everything I needed to prepare my meals. In-unit washer and dryer were a lifesaver during busy weeks, and the abundant storage space made organization a breeze.

Amenities: Campus Circle truly shines with its amazing amenities. The 24-hour fitness center is well-equipped, clean, and allowed me to maintain my workout routine without any hassle. The study rooms and computer lab were perfect for focused work sessions, while the resort-style pool, outdoor grilling areas, and clubhouse provided opportunities to relax and socialize.

Staff & Management: The staff at Campus Circle are professional, friendly, and always eager to help. They made the move-in process seamless and were prompt in addressing any maintenance requests or concerns. The management also organized regular community events, fostering a sense of camaraderie among the residents.

Safety: The security measures in place, such as controlled access gates and well-lit common areas, made me feel secure throughout my stay. The presence of surveillance cameras and attentive staff contributed to an overall sense of safety.

Weekly Events: One of the highlights of living at Campus Circle Apartments was the fantastic weekly events organized by the management team. Sushi Night and Taco Night were delicious and fun ways to unwind with fellow residents, offering a delightful opportunity to sample different cuisines and bond over a shared love of food. The Easter Egg Hunt added a festive touch to the spring season, bringing joy to residents of all ages. The Earth Day Dirt Cups event was a delightful and eco-conscious celebration that not only satisfied our sweet cravings but also promoted environmental awareness. These events truly enhanced the living experience at Campus Circle, fostering a warm and friendly community atmosphere where it's easy to make lasting connections.
owner_answer: Wow! Your review was so thought out and detailed. We appreciate you so much for taking your time and giving us a first hand insight on why you love Campus Circle and what we mean to you! The events, the amenities, and the office staff would be nothing without our residents. We take pride in giving the best experience possible while making us your HOME! We do our best to be prompt with maintenance request, getting residents their packages, and addressing concerns. We want everyone to feel welcomed and comfortable. Thank you for letting us know what you enjoyed!

name: Campus Circle
review_text:
This is NOT the luxury building they promote at all. They charge residents for things that they do not provide adequate services for.

The key fobs to access the elevators, lobby, garage, amenities, staircases, etc. were broken for FOUR months. Directly meaning complete strangers were free to roam the halls, use the parking garage, and use any of the amenities for months on end. Management blamed their contractor and also stated they “contacted their vendor” every time I inquired about it.

The parking garage gates have broken several times even within the first month I lived there. Eventually, management just stopped getting it repaired and it was nonfunctional for several months following. Staff blamed it on “delivery drivers” but that does not make much sense at all considering the mail room/lobby is in the front of the building. There are absolutely no mirrors in the parking garage either. I have almost gotten into multiple head-on collisions.

I moved to Campus Circle in August 2021 and the pool was never opened that summer. Apparently it was closed because they were “changing it to salt water”. June of 2022 I asked again why the pool will not be opening this summer and I was told that they were again “contacting their vendors”. Seriously? ‘Heated Pool’ what a JOKE.

During my lease period, my roommate tested positive for covid and I was in quarantine. She contacted the office several times with calls and emails disclosing to staff that she had tested positive. Thursday came and they were checking on the fire alarm systems throughout the building, maintenance enters anyways. We told staff AGAIN, while they were in our apartment, that we have covid. The following day there were quarterly inspections of the fourth floor units and they entered the apartment yet AGAIN. The whole experience was unprofessional to say the least.
owner_answer:
Torie, 

Our records show you moved out in July of 2022. We discussed your concerns with you and in response to your other reviews. We're sorry to hear you didn’t have a great experience with Campus Circle. We rectified all of the issues as quickly as possible given external complications not unique to our building.

Regarding amenities, unfortunately, we do need to rely on vendors for some services and we do apologize for taking longer to open as certain parts were needed to get things up and running again.  Our lock system has been fully operational for over a year now as well as the parking garage gates.

The delivery drivers our staff member referred to were the food delivery drivers, not packages. We continuously and repeatedly remind residents to meet with their drivers and not have them enter the parking garage. The annual fire alarm inspection is required by the City of Urbana for your safety and the safety of others in the building. We can assure you we do not want to put our staff at risk, which is why we told your roommate we could listen to her alarm system from outside of her bedroom door, and not enter her room. She was more than understanding of this. 

We will certainly take into consideration adding mirrors to the parking garage as we take resident suggestions very seriously. Thank you for your recommendation. 

Sincerely, 
Campus Circle Management

name: Campus Circle
review_text:
They will charge you for everything. Do not come here.
Update: see, this is exactly what they would do to you if you lived here. I have never went out of my way to diss someone or to find trouble. But this apartment is ridicules.
Once you check out, they would squeeze every dime of your deposit. They charge you for all the little stains you left behind. If they feel the needs to make renovations, just take the money out of our pocket. How convenient is that! Anything you say, they will use the contract you sign to slap you across the face.
Feel bad for all the people that’s been blinded by the fake reviews. By the way Sophie if you are responsible for replying to all the comments, you did a really good job for cc to pay for your minimum wage. Keep up the good work.
owner_answer:
Hello Laurent Huang,

We are sorry to hear you feel your experience was not top notch. Our staff works hard to provide a clean and comfortable environment for our residents and community. We do provide each resident with a move in agreement, a move out checklist that states residents should take certain precautions to avoid cleaning fees, and many emails to help prevent any move-out charges. We also provided reminders about charges associated with late move out if one should occur.  If you could , please reach out to the leasing office as we would be glad to discuss any charges you are concerned about and we will provide clarity about them.  Thank you so much.

Best,

Campus Circle

name: Campus Circle
review_text: It is a great place to live has a wonderful staff who helps you with every thing that you need a great location and great modern living facilities
owner_answer: Thank you for taking the time to share your positive experience with us! We are thrilled to hear that you find our apartment complex to be a great place to live. It's wonderful to know that our staff has been helpful and attentive, providing you with the support you need. We take pride in delivering excellent customer service, and we're glad it has made a positive impact on your living experience.

name: Campus Circle
review_text: My year at campus circle has been pleasant and I have no regrets about renting here. Jerry has always been extremely helpful with packages and helping resolve any issues that came up during the year!
owner_answer: Thank you for your review! Jerry is awesome and we are lucky to have him!

name: Campus Circle
review_text: I loveee living here, perfect location right off-campus. Great transportation right infront of the building and quick-response maintenance time. I feel more safe here (in terms of security/area) than any other apartment I’ve lived in during my time at U of I. The staff in the office are all super friendly and resourceful as well! From Molly(property manager) and Zach to Sophie, Toni, Emily, and Danielle! They’re all super pleasant and willing to help at all times.
owner_answer:
Hi Destini,

We are so happy to see you have had a great experience with us! These are the types of reviews we love to see and encourage us to continue providing this type of service to our residents.

If you need anything at all during the rest of your stay here, please let us know!

All the best,
Campus Circle Management

name: Campus Circle
review_text: I love living here!!!! Abigail made me feel so welcome and safe. Thanks again Abigail
owner_answer:
Ava,
Thank you for taking your time to recognize the Leasing Manager Abbey. Having warm and welcoming staff is something we strive for here at Campus Circle and we are glad to know you experienced that while interacting with staff.

name: Campus Circle
review_text: Do you want to pay 1000 over a 2b2b apartment and away from school? Do you want to hear construction site working everyday? Do you want to wake up in the morning with truck noise? If your answer is no, please don’t sign the contract and choose another one, Latitude or Gregory place. I’m suffering right now because I live in campus circle. Oh by the way, the train pass through sometimes at night. One more thing, I emailed the manager Molly , she basically told me that there’s nothing they can do. I think under this circumstances, I’m only willing to pay $500 a month.
owner_answer: Hi Zixuan,   Thank you for expressing your concern. We will reply to both of your reviews.  We are very sorry for the disturbances caused by the train that may pass through once in a while at night and for the construction. We are unable to stop their construction as it is an entirely separate project from Campus Circle and its owners. They will be done soon, but you always have a right to file a complaint with the county and city board.  We appreciate your residency and want to ensure you are enjoying your stay, especially with the things we can control.  While other apartments may offer a lower rate, they may not have all utilities included, a fully furnished apartment, and resort-style amenities. We are conveniently located near the engineering campus and restaurants. Unfortunately we cannot be located near all colleges at the University of Illinois since it is a very large campus. We would love to have the opportunity to meet with you to discuss each concern that you have. At your earliest convenience, please let us know when you may be able to meet in person, via Skype or FaceTime.   Sincerely,   Campus Circle Management  217.330.5607 | CampusCircle@PeakCampus.Com

name: Campus Circle
review_text: Loooove my place! Best apartment I’ve ever had & the management is amazing !
owner_answer: Thank you for sharing your positive feedback with us! We're absolutely thrilled to hear that you love living in our apartment complex. Creating a comfortable and enjoyable living environment for our residents is our utmost priority, and your satisfaction is truly rewarding for us.

name: Campus Circle
review_text:
I really like this place.
Ok, my first day was not the best so I didn't really now what to expect, but I have enjoyed my time here ever since, and plan on continue doing so for another year at least.
The staff has been very friendly and responsive, often coming up with ways of cheering people up, which is very nice.
The rooms are very spacious (I'm in a 4b4b) and the amenities are great (gym and lots of common areas to hang out with friends). There are also several study rooms and the environment is usually very quiet so it's ideal for that.
I really hope they open up the pool on spring.
owner_answer: Javier,Thank you for taking the time to leave such a kind and thoughtful review! We have enjoyed having you as a resident (and Insider) and are happy to have you around for another year. We only hope to continue impressing you! If there is anything that can make your experience in Campus Circle that much better, never hesitate to reach out to our office. Best,Marisa with Campus Circle

name: Campus Circle
review_text:
Extremely disingenuous leasing agency. Note when looking into this place that they only want to impress you to sign your lease, after that, they fall short on promises and provide limited services. For example, the pool was a large selling point that made the hike to campus worth it and was something the leasing manager sold to us during our tour. I come to find out, 3 days after moving in, that the pool will not be available until next summer and I had to ask someone to receive this information.  Additionally, TV's in the amenity rooms don't work. The room is nice I do like it, however I can get even nicer rooms at the same price closer to campus. To be fair, all of the workers I have come into contact with are very nice and helpful where they can be. However, the fact that they sold us the pool when it may never be available, this apartment is in way too poor of a location to justify the price. Please do not sign here, you will be severely disappointed.
Edit:  The pool will not be ready this fall. This shows perfectly how they lie to look better than they are. They "contact vendors" then have no urgency at all and wait for when the vendors feel like it. The doors aren't even locked at this apartment. If someone wanted to waltz into the amenity area uninvited they could easily do so.
owner_answer: Hi Chris, Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback on your stay thus far. We appreciate having an opportunity to improve your experience.  We’re glad to hear you’ve had a positive experience with our team and your room. Our pool will be opened this fall 2021 once our vendor changes our equipment from chlorine to salt-water and the pool is inspected by the department of public health for reopening. We are currently in the process of getting a new vendor in and getting the pool up and running.  The package pick up delay is atypical for the year. At the start of the school year people are purchasing additional items for their new homes, and school. This could easily mean 5 packages per person and we have 524 residents in our community. We see a surge in the volume of packages now and this will slow down in the next week. You'll be able to pick up your package in the same day pending the delivery time of your item.  We want to ensure all of our team members are providing world class customer service and are knowledgeable We are only able to address what we know and we appreciate you informing us that the amenity TV's aren’t working. This is the first we have been made aware of this issue. We inspected these this morning and found these are working. If you’re free, we’d love to connect with you to see which one you were having trouble with. The MTD bus drops off at all major locations on campus and is located directly outside of our office. We also offer free bike storage, and covered parking is available for different transportation options if you’d like to avoid the walk to class. As always, please feel free to reach out to us directly should you need anything else. Sincere regards,Molly with Campus Circle | Property Manager

name: Campus Circle
review_text: Marisa gave me my tour and was extremely knowledgeable about the property and it’s policies. I was impressed with the amenities and bed spaces. Zack and Tonii were also helpful during my leasing process and setting up important meetings. Molly the Property Manager and Kyle the Assistant Manager were helpful as well when it came down to my accommodations. The staff made me feel as if I was a resident before I even signed!
owner_answer: Hi Makyla,What a kind review! We are very happy to hear that our staff has impressed you since your very first encounter with Campus Circle. We strive for each of our customers to have the same positive experience and only hope to continue impressing you moving forward. If you need anything at all, please do not hesitate to reach out to our office. Welcome to the Campus Circle family!All the best,Marisa with Campus Circle

name: Campus Circle
review_text: After dropping something off to a friend, I toured the place and really loved it. The staff was wonderful and very welcoming. I loved getting to know both Zack and Molly. The amenities are great and the space was very neat and clean. They have great specials and an inviting environment that welcome any and everyone.
owner_answer: Hi Kiara,Thanks a ton for this kind review! It was a pleasure meeting the four of you. We are so excited for our new rates to drop late September and even more excited for you guys to be one of the first new residents for the 22-23 year! We will be in touch.All the best,Zach Leasing Manager

name: Campus Circle
review_text: I would highly recommend staying at Campus Circle! The price is pretty reasonable and the apartment features are very nice. Sophia is very friendly and helpful throughout the move-in process and is always happy to assist with any issues or picking up packages. The maintenance team is also very responsive to fixing any problems I encountered within my room. Thank you for offering such a wonderful place to live at during my time at UIUC.
owner_answer: Hi Ruby! Thanks so much for this glowing review! We love hearing that your experience with us has been nothing, but the best. We certainly strive to give our residents the best experience we can. I will let our Sophie and our maintenance team know that their efforts are not going unnoticed! If you are to need anything else during your stay with us, let us know.All the best,Zach | Leasing Manager

name: Campus Circle
review_text: Makya gave me a great tour and she answered all the questions I had. For all the things they offer I’d say the price is fair compared to nearby competitors and the apartment is located in a great spot. Thanks.
owner_answer:
Hi Mario! Thanks for the great review. I will make sure Nakya sees this too! I'm glad to hear you liked Campus Circle. We hope you'll choose our community to call home next fall.

Best wishes,

name: Campus Circle
review_text:
Worst landlord I've ever seen. DO NOT LIVE HERE!!! If you have animals, they will charge you 2500+ when you move out! They do inspections 4 times a year. When they do the inspection, they will break into your room, open your closet, with their shoes on. NO PRIVACY AND BRING THE DIRTS IN!

REPLY: I never had 5 pets, there was once when my friend visited me and she brounght her cats. For that case we had an agreement with Campus Circke and I paid the fine as requested. My 2 cats use the litter box properly and never pee outside. I clean my litter box regularly and I use deodorizers. I cleaned up the apartment after I moved out to the best extend. When I left, there was no odor. I also don't believe that the deodorizer doesn't work and you have to renovate the entire apartment and charge us $5,000.
owner_answer: Hello Yurui, The majority of our residents who have cats and dogs receive most or all of their full deposit back. Of the 5 cats in the apartment, 3 were not approved and considered illegal pets. They urinated all over the furniture, carpets, and vinyl flooring. There was pet hair, dander, and litter caked into several areas of your apartment and with having multiple litter boxes, there was a lingering odor that remained after your move-out that was experienced by not only our staff, but by all 3 vendors.To ensure the enjoyment of the apartment for the next resident, we could not in good faith keep the apartment as it was returned. Your usage of the space required a full replace of your flooring due to the urine and claw marks (damage) from your multiple pets.We do not enjoy charging our residents as this doesn't make anyone happy and we understand the basis of our business is its people. This not only adds work for the resident, but for our maintenance team, and vendors, prolonging the time it takes to prepare the apartment for the next person. All exact receipts for the vendors and repairs were provided within a week of closing your account justifying all charges associated.We do provide a notice of entry at least 24 hours in advance to complete quarterly inspections to replace the air filter. This is not considered breaking in as we have provided ample communication, knock and announce ourselves three times before entry, and nothing is in fact broken by our team.  Quarterly inspections are also explained in the move-in packet everyone received physically and digitally. The purpose and expectations are clearly laid out in our communication to our residents.  We are pro-active and are responsible for protecting and maintaining the building for your enjoyment and all other residents.  We follow OSHA requirements and while we cannot remove our shoes we do wear slippers to cover our shoes for those that request it.  Should you have any other questions, please feel free to reach back out. Campus Circle Team,

name: Campus Circle
review_text:
Modern, luxurious, and incredibly well kitted out with amenities—like a theater, pool, and bar. At this price point, you’ll be hard pressed to find a better pad to live in. Just check out the rooms and see for yourself.

The front office staff answered all my questions with a welcoming blend of affability and expertise. They know their stuff. I was lucky enough to get Zach to show me around some models, and he really impressed me with his knowledge and candor. He’s a whiz. Plus, he’s a very genial guy. The apartments are splendid, but the service sold me. If you come down here, ask for Zach.

I looked at so many apartments around here, and none of them had anything as amazing as what Campus Circle had to offer. What could have been a daunting decision was made much easier when I chose Campus Circle. If you’re lucky enough to get a room, maybe you will too.
owner_answer: Hi Jason,Thanks so much for this glowing review! We strive to give excellent customer service to anyone sparking an interest in Campus Circle.These types of reviews push us to continue doing what we love! We are so excited for you to move in and enjoy everything Campus Circle has to offer. Best,ZachLeasing Manager

name: Campus Circle
review_text:
The parking garage gates broke 5 times in the first month I lived here before they stopped getting repaired. Management blamed it on a delivery driver, but that doesn't excuse it happening so many times and it doesn't excuse poorly designed gates (you can easily drive in after a resident who has a gate tag, and then be trapped in the garage with no way to open the gate and no clear signage for delivery drivers that the gates operate by tag only). Management has "contacted their vendor," but that was months ago and there's been no update.

The key fob entry for the exterior building doors doesn't work anymore, leaving most exterior doors fully unlocked. Happened around the same time as the garage gates, and management gave the same answer. "We've contacted out vendor." Either their vendor is incredibly slow or they never did contact them, because the doors still don't work.

The key fob entry for my unit stopped working, meaning I couldn't lock the door from the outside. And for some reason the doors don't have physical keys for redundancy. It took several maintenance requests, emails, and calls for us to finally get it fixed so we could lock our door when we go to class. Campus Circle may claim that holiday hours were to blame for the delay, but on the day they were supposed to be fully open we still could barely get a hold of the office. And also, shouldn't they have some manager on hand for emergencies like this? Especially considering that the exterior doors STILL don't lock anyone off the street could have walked into my apartment when I was gone.

Not to mention the other issues mentioned in these reviews. The pool hasn't been open since I got here. The package pickup is slow at best so I just order my packages to amazon lockers. There's been a spilled pint of ice cream hidden behind a hallway door since October that custodial staff hasn't cleaned. They advertise internet and cable, but the internet is a single public network (so I just set up my own router anyway) and the cable signal looks absolutely garbage. The parking garage is so narrow and has blind turns, which is made worse by a lack of mirrors and center lines, resulting in near head on collisions every week.

They'll certainly have excuses related to their vendors, other residents, and delivery drivers. But the fact of the matter is that the building and its facilities are poorly thought out and poorly maintained. If it weren't for the rent concession I got for signing early this year, I could easily get better for cheaper.

At least the front desk staff are all nice.
owner_answer: Hi Tobias,We appreciate you leaving your honest feedback.  We already sent a schedule out to reprogram all keys now that the doors have been fully fixed. Thank you for you continued patience while we exercised every available option to ensure these issues were resolved.  We could only move as fast as the parts could get here to fix the doors.  To address any other concerns you may have, please contact the office directly so we can better understand and further assist you.All the best, Campus Circle Management

name: Campus Circle
review_text: I had a tour with teja today and it was awesome. She was very optimistic and real. I also got a chance to speak with the manager Zach and not only did he answer all the questions I had but he actually felt like he was interested in my concerns. I had a very pleasant experience !
owner_answer:
Hi Sabrina,

Thanks so much for leaving this review! It was so nice getting to know you and discussing your wants in an apartment. We would be delighted to have you as a resident for Fall 22-23. Looking forward to speaking more with you soon.

Zach
Leasing Manager

name: Campus Circle
review_text: This is my first review because I feel the team deserves really positive one. I have lived here for 2 yrs, and I previously lived in Latitude. 0. Their team is super friendly and the maintenance is professional and fast! 1. The building on the garage side is super quiet (for light sleepers). The parking garage is convenient, and you don't need to take the elevator. 2. It has good sunshine due to the south east direction. 3. the times for emergency alerts are far less than Latitude. If they can add a package system, then it would even better. Strongly recommended.

name: Campus Circle
review_text:
Please be careful if you order food delivery to this apartment complex.

I have ordered my delivery from Walmart, fall asleep and went to pick my delivery late. When I arrived my delivery was not there and it was 9 am (office opens at 10 am). However, there were some people inside and asked if they have any idea. They gave me some of the Walmart delivery packets.

When I brought them home I realized some of the items are missing compare to the picture that Walmart shared with me. I went back to the Office to tell the situation. They talked very rudely and said it's bad for their office if there is food outside and it's not their responsibility. Also they told me to go to market to buy food instead of ordering to home.

This is my home and I felt like they are violating my right to use my home. Seems like they don't like ordering to home issue and they are trying to discourage us to do that.

This was a very uncomfortable experience for me.
owner_answer:
Hi Ayse,

We appreciate you leaving your honest feedback.  On the move-in agreement form, we do ask all residents to be timely with retrieving their deliveries and/or meeting with their delivery driver immediately in order to decrease any possibility of error.  We understand your frustration, and we hope that this does not happen again in the future. To address any other concerns you may have, please contact the office directly so we can better understand and further assist you.

All the best, Campus Circle Management
