name: Campus Circle
review_text:
Final update after one year here: the apartment itself is great. New building and all kinds of fancy facilities. What bugged me is the property management company, Peak Campus. It’s just uneasy to live with them. For example, they have their “quarterly inspection” and would enter your room without asking whether you allow that or not, even if you’re sleeping, simply because they “have no time” for that. And for the lock down, I don’t think the gym is now open despite other apartments being able to do that month ago. There’s no refund for that, of course. Whole-building fire alarm triggered 4-5 times at midnight before they finally found out who did it. If you constantly complain that there are way too many residents to handle (thus there’s no way to be a little bit more considerate), please just hire more staff!
==========
There were some glitches at the time of signing but they were well resolved later. You may need to ask the manager (instead of receptionists) if you're unclear about some specific terms. Hopefully I will spend a good year here.
==========
I’m still feeling that they don’t know how to best leverage customers’ time. For example, I was asked to sign some documents for about 4-5 times (spanning several months), with one reason being “there are some typos in the document”. I’ve also been to their office a couple of times for these document related things. Anyway, get ready to be bugged by them from time to time!
owner_answer: Hi Wenyu,   Thank you for sharing your feedback. We are very sorry you feel the application process is unclear, and are grateful for the opportunity you’ve provided us to meet in person to discuss further. Our goal is not to mislead anyone who is interested in applying as we want each person to feel confident in what they are signing and agreeing to. We look forward to speaking with you! In the meantime, should you need anything please call 217.330.5607 or send an e-mail to CampusCircle@PeakCampus.Com.   Kind regards,   Campus Circle Management www.LiveCampusCircle.Com   217.330.5607 | CampusCircle@PeakCampus.Com

name: Campus Circle
review_text: You will get wrongfully towed I was in parking for less than an hour in the 4 hour space and got towed. They say “parking was thoroughly discussed on move in” all they told me on move in was “you can park there for 4 hours” never did they say it was for resident guests. They will charge you for everything one of my friends got charged for smoking and he does even smoke and their response “was do not have  paraphernalia in your room”. They have unannounced inspections. I was accused for stealing the study room chairs the chair they provide for the room and that was the only chair in the room. I would never live there again even if it was free because they will fine you more than it would be to live elsewhere. Although they do have excellent customer service and are happy to help however they can which is hard to find.
owner_answer: Hi Bruce,   We see you have updated your Google Review from June and appreciate your positive comment about our customer service. We aim to provide a positive experience for each resident and their guests and are sorry to see you did not enjoy living with us. Thank you for providing insight on how we may improve.  We are sorry you didn’t want to register your vehicle with our office. It was made aware to us that guests could not find a parking space because there were a few cars consistently parked in 4 hour guest parking; moving from space to space and as a result many residents were frustrated their guests could not find a space due to consistent violators. After looking into this issue further, we noticed you had been relocating your vehicle every 4 hours. This is not how our 4 hour parking was intended to be used. We provided a warning notice on your vehicle prior to towing as well as a phone call. Once you noted your vehicle had been towed, you acknowledged to Campus Circle staff you saw the notice and continued moving from space to space in our 4 hour parking.    Each resident is provided with a map of our parking and the policies on move-in day as a reference should they need it in the future. This includes the 4 Hour Parking highlighted as "Guest Parking". While we understand residents like to temporarily park in these spaces to unload groceries or grab something from their apartment, this takes away from other residents whose guests are visiting. This parking is very limited and residents who’ve registered for our attached garage parking should use their spaces so guests can enjoy the 4 hour parking.  In regards to your friend, we are more than happy to talk to him individually. Our goal is to provide excellent customer service and ensure each person is enjoying their stay. Please understand it is not in our best interest to blindly assess fines. Each fine has an image to support the charge and we always provide an opportunity for residents to remedy small damages. We are disappointed when residents do not respond to our e-mails or phone calls as we do reach out in hopes to work together to find solutions.   Each inspection we have performed has been prefaced with an e-mail and flyer on the unit door providing advance notice for entry. We also knock and announce ourselves before entering units and bed spaces. We have tried arranging a time to discuss this further in person but have been unsuccessful. If you would like to meet with us, Skype, FaceTime, or WeChat, we’d be more than happy to walk through each item of concern at your earliest convenience.   Sincerely,   Campus Circle Management  217.330.5607 | CampusCircle@PeakCampus.Com

name: Campus Circle
review_text: This is a warning to everyone thinking of moving into this horrendous apartment. During the move-out process, these pathetic landlords charged upwards of $200 in fees even after my family and I were finished moving out and cleaned every single part of the apartment. There were absolutely no issues without our apartment - I left it EXACTLY how I found it. DO NOT LIVE HERE.

Campus Circle Staff
