name: Campus Circle
review_text:
This is my second year living in Campus Circle. The room that I moved in this year was terrible. The mattress had red stain, furnitures were slightly damaged and dirty, some lights didnt work, construction are going on in the main gate so the noise is terrible. Furthermore, last year, lots of residents would gather in the common area drinking alcohol and hosting a party. I would not recommend this apartment!
Also, the staff customer service is not great. I referred my roommate after seeing a flyer that said I would receive 300 dollar gift card. However, when I asked for 300 dollar gift card, they said I don’t qualify for the deal because my roommate signed earlier than when the deal was supposed to be in effect.
Again, apartment condition is bad, constructions are going on around the apartment, bad management of common area, and customer service is bad. Do not sign contract with Campus circle!
owner_answer: Hi Tae In,We genuinely appreciate you taking the time to update your review and provide us with your honest feedback. We are sorry to hear you feel you have not had an ideal experience with move-in. I personally addressed your concerns immediately after you contacted our office during move-in and was able to alleviate your concerns by vacuuming your floor and wiping down your mattress. We also put in service requests regarding additional maintenance concerns that were addressed by our maintenance team the day the requests were placed. Given the current regulations in the amenities due to COVID-19, residents may not gather in groups larger than 10 as we require everyone in our community to wear masks and be cognizant of social distancing. Last year, however, residents were free to have gatherings and host small events with their peers/friends. Any complaints brought to the attention of our office staff regarding these gatherings have been addressed. We recommend contacting our office directly for any concerns that require the attention of Campus Circle management.We apologize about the construction occurring on University Avenue and how bothersome it can be.  Unfortunately, we have no control over the noise levels or when the construction team is scheduled to work. We recommend to reaching out to the City of Urbana to address any concerns you have regarding the construction.  The construction is not on the property of Campus Circle nor is it associated with us.  We offer many specials and incentives throughout the year, all of which are subject to change. At the time your friend signed, we offered a referral incentive of $100 if you referred someone to our property who signed and moved in. The special changed later in the year, but you signed when it was $100.  You were provided with the $100 gift card for referring your friend to our property and would be more than happy to explain the difference in special further should you feel inclined to contact our office directly.As always, feel free to reach out to our office for any questions at all.Best,Marisa at Campus CircleLeasing Manager

name: Campus Circle
review_text: I am not sure how to start. Or I am not still sure if they are trying to get out of the way or not. I have not problem about the facilities while I lived there at all. Loved it and even referred 3 my friends. I lived there for 3 months and moved out due to personal reason. I signed the apartment in February and were rewarded $500 gift card, and I have not STILL received it. That was a promotion gift and I was told that I will be given when I moved in which was June, 2016. When I moved in, I also was told that it will be given at least by August since August is the "Official" move in date. I did not understand "The official" term, because the company apparently promoted the apartment as "Early move-in available." But okay, I understood because they are new and headquarters are far way. Meanwhile, I referred 3 my friends, and was reward $250 each. So in total, I am supposed to received $1250 gift card. I was given many dates that they will hand me the cards until I moved out. Been almost 4weeks since I have moved out, so I left a memo for general manager that I would like to get updates with the gift cards. Same response and no returning calls as promised. I am so disappointed in the company because if the tenants were late for rent, they would charge bunch of extra late fee, but they would like for tenants to be patients and understood. I have been patient way long enough to speak up about this issue. IF you do promotion, please keep the promise with your customers. Your time that you spent on marketing could destroy in just one negative&truthful review. I can say this because I was being patient with you and I only have legal rights to pursue at this point. With all respects, I was being understood when you were constructing the building 6am and 8am without any announcement (Yes, I have video footages), and all delayed work because this is new building. I still cannot believe that I am still dealing with this up to this point. If you see this, please return my calls or keep me updated. PLEASE reward your customers who are waiting as YOU PROMISED.
owner_answer: Hi Dami, thank you for reaching out to us through Google. We apologize on the delay for the receiving of your gift card. I am so glad that we were able to resolve this issue. We are very grateful for your patience and understanding. We truly value your feedback and we were able to make a few changes to our gift card process based on your comments. Thank you again. We appreciate your continued support!

name: Campus Circle
review_text: Highly recommend leasing with Campus Circle they are an amazing group of people. Campus Circle not only has some of the best amenities on campus, but they have the best workers who care which is extremely hard to find anywhere on campus. Molly helped me out so much getting all of my documentation in order, and Zach gave me a tour that made it a no brainer that Campus Circle is the best choice for a friendly circle to not just live in, but be a part of!
owner_answer: Hi Jayden,We appreciate this awesome feedback! Our main goal at Campus Circle is to provide an extraordinary customer service and living experience for every resident. We are proud to have met those standards today. We can't wait for the day you move in, Jayden. All the best,Zach and Molly from Campus Circle

name: Campus Circle
review_text: One staff is being sarcastic, unhelpful, even discriminated. When you have any problem, they don’t consider your situation at all. My neighbor keeps making loud noise all night long, I couldn’t sleep at all. She kept saying “I don’t know what you say” “I don’t know what you want me to do” with even sarcastic laughs sometimes. What she wants me to do is to wait and call a police. I said if this kept happening for one week even though I tell them and call the police, can I transfer to another room by paying the 200dollars fee, she said let’s go back the start, to call the police and record their voice???? When I lived in HERE Apartment, my friend had conflict with her roommate, the staff there is nice and patient. Quickly resolved the issue by transferring her roommate with no additional fee in less than 3days. Hope you not choose the terrible apartment!
owner_answer: Hi Yimeng,Thank you for taking the time to provide us with your feedback so we may address your concerns. First and foremost, we are sorry to hear you feel this way and would like to assure you we take all noise complaints seriously. Whenever a noise complaint is brought to our attention, we take the initiative to reach out to the resident causing the noise. If the noise is bothersome enough or late enough, we also encourage you contact the non-emergency police number if the situation occurs after office hours as well as offer to mediate a discussion between both neighbors. After looking into this matter for you, all of the above listed solutions were offered. We also reached out to your neighbor and were able to confirm that this noise came from a Bluetooth speaker that was accidentally left on when the residents were not home. While we do allow transfers (pending unit availability), in situations like these, it is best to attempt to resolve the issue in question rather than instantly transfer a resident. For issues that are able to be resolved, we would certainly not want any resident to be burdened with moving their items to another unit. We apologize that this information was not delivered clearly and would be more than willing to discuss this matter further should you like to contact our office directly. Sincere regards,Marisa with Campus Circle

name: Campus Circle
review_text:
Red flag: a lot of 5-star reviews for Campus Circle are from people who have never lived with them. There is no way to verify if any of these people actually “visited their friend here once” or  “had their food delivered here accidentally.”

Unfortunately, it’s common for skeevy businesses to hire people to leave reviews like this where they don’t necessarily say they lived here but they leave 5-star reviews for the business doing practically nothing.

So, I’m leaving this review because Campus Circle seems to have some bad business practices. I haven’t lived with them, but I still think they’re a bad business and people should know that. I’d recommend ignoring the cover-up reply Campus Circle will undoubtedly leave on this comment or any other 1-star review.
owner_answer: Hello, Thank you for leaving your feedback. We would love to learn more about your experience and if there is anything in particular with which you were displeased. We strive to create a 5-star experience, and without knowing more information, it's difficult for us to know where improvement is needed. Our reviews are genuine and from many residents who live here.  I see in your review you state you have not lived and do not live with us.  Feel free to reach out to the office at 217-619-0116 and we would be happy to discuss this further any issues you have. Sincerely, Campus Circle Management

name: Campus Circle
review_text: The most bomb diggity place to live.  If you like bomb diggity of course
owner_answer:
Hello Brent,

Thank you for your five star review and loving Campus Circle.  If there is anything else that we could possibly do for you, please let us know.  Otherwise, it's great to see you are enjoying our community.  Thank you. 

Sincerely,

The Campus Circle Management Team

name: Campus Circle
review_text: I signed a lease with CC but had to transfer it to somebody else. Their management was EXTREMELY helpful and specific when it came to the whole process of finding somebody else to take my lease as well as answering any of the many questions that I had! Molly is one of the nicest people I have ever met and made the entire process much less stressful! Would absolutely never hesitate to recommend this apartment to anyone considering a luxury apartment in UIUC!
owner_answer: Hi Samuel! Thank you for taking the time to leave a review for us about our staff. We are happy we could meet your expectations and help you find some one to take over your lease! We hope you enjoy the rest of your summer.

name: Campus Circle
review_text:
Patient and efficient service! Worth recommending.
Due to the COVID pandemic I have to quite my reservation. Thanks Assistant Manager Kyle White so much for helping with my refund of lease reservation.
owner_answer: Williams, Thank you so much for this glowing review! We are so happy to hear that Campus Circle exceeded your expectations during unprecedented times. If you are ever back in town, we'd love to have you as a resident for another year!Take care, Campus Circle Management

name: Campus Circle
review_text:
On the day I moved in I locked myself out of the lobby, and the movers were there waiting while I was paying them. So I went to the leasing office begging you to open the lobby door for me，and the lobby door was 2 feet away from the leasing office. However the staff Molly ordered me to wait in line waiting for her finishing helping two other residents signing the lease.  In this process Molly was having very rude attitude and talking to me like police talking to prisoner（If you have to insist on first come first serve,  though not proper at that time since I was kind of in an emergency,  at least talk to me politely,  treating me like a guest）.  By the time it's finally my turn,  it was already like 1 hour（BTW,  you do everything slowly）and the time I paid the movers had run out and I had to carry all the big heavy furnitures inside all by myself.
I really don't understand why Molly could not spent 10 seconds open the lobby door that was 2 feet away from her.  Also I saw some other staff had nothing to do at the office（I saw them sitting there like having a rest) and Molly refused me to let them help me though I have begged her again and again in the process.
Also what puzzles me is that the Campus Circle staff would like to spend huge amount of time on arguing on Google review But would not like to improve the attitude in reality.
owner_answer: Hi Kobe, We noticed you updated your review of our property. We would be more than happy to discuss your concerns with you, however, using a fake name hinders us from being able to reach out to you and assist you accordingly. Please reach out our office directly so we may look into the issues you are experiencing. We can be reached via email at CampusCircle@PeakCampus.Com.

name: Campus Circle
review_text: I never leave reviews but have to for this place. DO NOT LIVE HERE. They nickel and dime you for everything and their staff has never been on the same page, from the moment I went through the subleasing process to when I moved out. They will charge the entire floor if one person somewhere on your floor leaves a trash bag lying outside of the door, which is COMPLETELY out of others' control. At one point, other people were continuing to leave trash in the hallway and my roommate and I went downstairs to talk to the office and even volunteered to pick up the trash so that the rest of the floor would not be charged. They did not offer to help us at all but basically suggested that yes, it would be a good idea to pick up other people's trash to avoid the rest of us being charged since their manager was not in the apt. Seriously?? Knowing their reputation of charging for everything, I also triple checked with their staff on ways to avoid these fees when I thoroughly cleaned everything and they recommended taking pictures. As expected, even after these pics, I was charged with move-out fees that I was not at fault for whatsoever. The place may look nice but their staff is a mess. AVOID this place at all costs.
owner_answer: Hello Shozab, we are genuinely disheartened to hear that you have had an unpleasant experience with our team. We pride ourselves in providing exceptional service to all of our residents and are concerned to hear that we fell short. We would love the opportunity to meet with you personally to discuss your concerns.  Please reach out to us at (217) 619-0630 so we may identify ways to improve your experience.

name: Campus Circle
review_text: Everything is almost perfect until the COVID. Now people pick up their package only through appointments, "for the community's safety," as the management says. HOWEVER, when I was scheduling for pickup, the earliest time would be days away, if not weeks, while there is no one picking up packages when I pass through the office. They don't allow people to pick up their packages during the weekend, even during their "busy" weekend office hours, because of the "understaff and short amount of office hours." : ) We didn't pay the rent for that kind of service.
owner_answer: Hi Frost,Thank you for providing us with your feedback. We cannot seem to locate your name in our system.  The first or last name do not show up.  Please feel free to contact the office directly so we may assist you and navigate any concerns or suggestions you may have. We apologize the package appointments may not be ideal; however, we created separated appointment times to minimize contact between our residents and staff alike. We sympathize it may be ideal to not receive your package as soon as it’s delivered, but we must prioritize the health and safety of our team and our residents. Appointments are scheduled on a first come, first serve basis and the availability will vary depending on the volume of packages being delivered to our office. It looks like right now our earliest available time slot is tomorrow, December 8th at 10:30am. Our package system is very thorough from logging each individual package to organizing it in our package room. This takes a longer time during weeks where a large volume of packages are delivered. With our shortened staffing and weekend hours, it can prove difficult for a staff of two people, sometimes only one person, to have to deliver packages for an entire community of residents while also completing daily tasks. Package pick-ups are available on the weekends, we just have shorter hours.  Let us know if you have any other concerns, want to set an appointment to talk about this in person, or would like to call and talk.  Thank you,Campus Circle Management

name: Campus Circle
review_text:
I used to live here and it's terrible. Our CC residents have WeChat group of hundred members and very many of us don't think it deserves the rating. They are manipulating the rating.

I guess you will say you don't find me in your list. I changed my ID name that's why you won't find me in your list. I think you people debating online under every review is absurd. Especially a lot of them are sophism.

相信我学弟学妹们，别被控评骗了。
owner_answer: Ziyu,Thank you for reaching out.  We are sorry that your experience at Campus Circle has not been a positive one and want to work with you to address your concerns.  If you are willing to meet with us in person or over the phone, we are confident we can work through a lot of these issues together. Our reviews are genuine and we would love to see what we can do to improve yours.  We sincerely want you to have the best experience possible and we’ll do what we can to help.  We look forward to you reaching out. Best,Zach Leasing Manager

name: Campus Circle
review_text:
Due to travel arrangement, we were unable to come back before July 31st which is the move out day. Since we have renewed with CC and sublease to someone else, we thought things could be different and repeatedly checked with the desk if we were also required turning in our key to the front desk before August. We talked to the officer ,officer asked Molly and we talked to Molly. The only response I received is “No, you don’t have to move out by July 31st, but make sure giving us 24hours for inspection prior to new residents arrival”. With that said, we packed everything in the room and were ready to move them out when fall comes. Unfortunately, at the midnight of August 1st, in another country that’s 10000miles away,we were told that we would have to move everything out within two hours , or they will throw everything away. After several rounds of negotiations , they told us they were sorry for telling me the wrong informations but we do need to move things out and if we need lawful assistant they would be able to help. (What the heck was even that ) Also , they offered to move things out for us at a price of 50bucks per garbage bag or item. Okay. We stayed up all night looking for friends staying in Champaign to move things for us ( and thank god there was one or we probably would lose everything. Eventually we were “ only “charged for 300 bucks:) including 50 bucks for a toilet towel , 50 for a unmoved curtain, another 85 for not returning key in time.

Well, I’m not evaluating the apartment but rather stating some experiences of mine. You all would be able to think and make decision based on this. But Trust Me, Never Come Here.
owner_answer: Hi Summer, We see you have not contacted us before and hope to have the opportunity to understand the rating you have given and the situation. We track all prospects and residents within our system and do not see you anywhere. Do you go by a different name and are you sure it was Campus Circle?  We strive to provide the best customer service experience for each person with which we communicate. Please reach out to us at your earliest convenience.  Campus Circle Management  217-330-5607 | CampusCircle@PeakCampus.Com

name: Campus Circle
review_text: the facility is really good and the office's service is really nice. they help me fixed a lot of problem regarding living, repairing and leasing really fast. i would like to live at CC again if i am going to stay in campus for another year.
owner_answer: Hi Xinghan,Thank you very much for leaving a nice review! We are happy that you have liked your stay with us. If there is anything we can do to continue improving your stay, please let us know. Have a great night!Best,Campus Circle Management

name: Campus Circle
review_text: They nickel and dime you for everything which is extremely ridiculous. Molly is nice at the time you signed lease, they will also let you leave positive feedback on every social network. But when you start moving in, things will change. They will frequently come in you apartment doing inspection, find something broken, repair it, and bill you (which other property management only does when you move out). It makes sense because they want to charge you more times. They repair and bill me the blinds on 01/31, which is also the day I paid my Feb rent. On 02/01, they sent me the blinds repair bill and then on 02/02, they said my payment is error because it didn’t include the blinds charges. How I can possibly includ blinds repairing fee before they send me the bill? Also, when I sent another check on 02/05 including the blinds fee, it counts as late. They told me on 02/06 and also 02/06 will be counted as another late day with extra cost. DO NOT LIVE HERE.
owner_answer: Hi Yinzhao,   Thank you for providing us with your feedback on our inspection process. We perform quarterly inspections to replace your air filter for your convenience and enjoyment of the space as well as to keep up our preventative maintenance.  Unfortunately, when we see damages, we do hold resid  ents accountable. Expectations and estimated charges are outlined prior to moving in and we do our best to ensure this is clearly communicated with each resident.  Moving forward we intend to give a bigger window for when you receive the notification for any charge (only if applicable) and when these are due. Should the unit be returned with normal wear and tear, charges will not be assessed again giving you the opportunity to receive your entire deposit back. We want to ensure all future residents moving in will be given the opportunity to move into a unit without damages.  In our conversation regarding rent, it was made clear late fees are assessed on the 4th of the month.  We hope that you might consider arranging a time to speak with us in person so we may walk through any outstanding concerns with you.

name: Campus Circle
review_text: Molly here is very helpful and kind. She guided me through all the steps and contracts and answered all of my questions on Skype, which is great. We also had a great chat about lots of things.  I'm looking forward to moving in this August.
owner_answer: Hi Pin-Chiao, thank you for taking the time to write a review about your Skype experience with our Assistant Manager, Molly! We always love to see positive feedback and shout outs to our team. Should you need anything at all, please don't hesitate to reach out to us. Enjoy the rest of your week!  Ca  mpus Circle Management 217-330-5607 | CampusCircle@PeakCampus.Com

name: Campus Circle
review_text: Marisa has been the most helpful throughout the entire process and so has Kyle. As an international student from Austria I had a lot of questions and they were prompt to put all my doubts to rest. I am so excited to be living in a community that is already making me feel so welcomed and at home. A big shoutout to the wonderful team ❤
owner_answer: Ateesha,   Thank you for sharing this experience with us! It makes me happy to hear that our team members created moments that stood out for you as exceptional service. We will be sure to share your feedback with them and the entire team!  We are always here to help so please never hesitate to reach out! - Have a great day! - Your Campus Circle Team, (217) 619-0116, campuscircle@peakcampus.com.

name: Campus Circle
review_text: Staff here are very very kind and helping me moving things.
owner_answer: Thank you for sharing your experience with us! We are thrilled to hear that our staff members were friendly and helpful during your move. Providing exceptional customer service is one of our top priorities, and it's rewarding to know that our team went above and beyond to assist you.

name: Campus Circle
review_text:
My son informed me today the KEY FOB to enter the building is not working. ANYONE can enter the building . They haven’t been working for over a week. I called the office myself , and they said they share in my frustration , but they have a call into the vendor and are waiting on them to respond . They have no idea when it will be fixed .  The gates in the garage are also not working , which allows ANYONE access to the garage as well . We are paying rent for a secured building , which this is NOT. This is a safety issue that needs to be resolved immediately . Their lack of urgency in this matter is extremely frustrating.

Updated Review - ONE MONTH LATER LOCKS ARE STILL NOT WORKING.  Safety is NOT a priority for Campus Circle.
Pool that was used as a selling point NEVER opened this season.  Zero concessions have been offered.  The cost to rent here with the lack of security and promised amenities is not right.

Advice to future Tenants looking for a place to rent - DO NOT RENT HERE.
owner_answer: Hi Angela, We understand your concern. We have been diligently working on resolving this issue since the moment this was discovered. We have been in contact with multiple vendors to get this addressed as quickly as humanly possible. We have authorized every avenue necessary to expedite the parts to the property. Please note, this is not impacting the apartment and bedroom doors. We are hoping to get this resolved very soon.  If you have any other questions or concerns, please feel free to reach out to us. Best,Campus Circle Management

name: Campus Circle
review_text: i think it is a pretty good apartment. I have lived here for more than half a year, and the feeeling is really good. It is a new apartment. The room is big, and the facilities are versatile, including gym, many study rooms , etc. The people here are also pretty nice!
owner_answer: Hi Xikun, thank you for leaving detailed feedback about your experience with Campus Circle. We strive to make your stay with us our number one priority!

name: Campus Circle
review_text:
CC seems like a great appartment at first, but it starts to charge unreasonable fines during inspection. My friend was charged 500 dollar for a really minor “sofa damage”. What’s more, the renew price in 2018 is even higher than the new signed price. This apartment is money oriented and please don’t choose CC if there’s any other choice.
Today they offer me the renew price of 780/month, but I promise to you all that the new signed price will be lower, and they will reduce their price when they realize that they can’t rent out all of the rooms. Last year, after they offer me a renew price of 780/month, and they told me that would be the best price I can get, they offer a price of 699 for new resident in the spring. Please don’t renew and wait for them to reduce their price.
By the way, Molley, the front desk of campus circle, she will ask resident to give five star rating on google. So don’t believe all of the five star reviews.
owner_answer: Hi Andong,   We appreciate you taking the time to leave a review about your experience at Campus Circle. We are disappointed to see your friend has not reached out to us to re-evaluate their charge as all residents have the opportunity to fix the issue and schedule a re-inspection. We re-assess the charge if it has been remedied. It is important our residents communicate with us as we cannot fix their issue if we do not know about it. While we do our absolute best to communicate our expectations and policies for the use of the apartment and community, we unfortunately have seen damages that may be repairable resulting in charges to replace the item(s). Estimated charges are given to each resident prior to moving in. We are open to any recommendations on how we may better communicate these policies. We provide notices before entry and notices after quarterly inspections should there be an issue to address. We are always looking for ways to improve the experience of our residents. Please help us help you and your friends. In regards to rates, they are based on a tier system and once we hit the number of spots in each tier, the rate goes up a predetermined amount.  This year we are doing our best to reward renewals who sign early.  We will continue increasing the rate for new leases as more people sign, so it’s better to sign earlier than later.  Let us know if you have any questions.    Campus Circle Management  217.330.5607 | CampusCircle@PeakCampus.Com

name: Campus Circle
review_text: Overall my experience here is great. The room is big and respond to maintenance is fast. I really like the entertainment room, yoga room and gym here. But unfortunately they are closed because of the virus.
owner_answer: Hi Yuxuan, thank you for sharing your feedback about your experience with us at Campus Circle Apartments! The gym  and club room were reopened last week, and we plan to open other spaces in phases. If you aren't receiving our community updates they may be delivered to your spam or junk e-mail, or you may not have opted in for these notifications. We'd be happy to assist you if you'd like to ensure your settings are the way you want them to be. As always, if you need anything at all, please let us know so we may assist you. Have a wonderful rest of your week!Best wishes, Molly with Campus Circle

name: Campus Circle
review_text:
The rent goes from 599 last year to 739 this year. Renewing the lease is by racing who fill in a google form they sent by email faster. If u check ur email box 15 minutes after they sent the forms, booooom, u will get a rate much higher than ur roomate who happened to found the form as soon as they sent them. So lack of respect to the residents!

Unreasonable charges. If they find a tiny stain on the carpet, congratulations, prepare $50 to lose.There are numerous reasons to charge u for any unnoticeable damages, so make these into ur budget when calculating ur living cost.

Countless room inspection. They enter ur room once a month on average. In July, they entered twice for many wired reasons.

The room arrangement shown to u is wrong when signing the lease, but they refuse to correct it and charge $100/person if u want to exchange ur room with ur roomates even if u have not moved in yet. When my suitemates and I were picking our rooms, I chose one far from the washing machine and dryer. On the first day I entered my unit, I found my room was the one that is close to the machines. The manager Molly said the room map is not correct and they refused to take any responsibility. I talked to my suitemate and he agreed to exchange the rooms, but the manager said we had to pay $200 for the exchange even if we had not moved in yet!

Campus Circle only care how much money they can earn from u. The residents are always on the last position on their priority list.
owner_answer: Hi Zhaorui, we appreciate your honest feedback so we may improve the experiences for you and our community. We set a high standard for ourselves and are disappointed to hear your experience with us was not a positive one. Would you like to arrange a time to discuss in person or over the phone/Skype call your concerns?  With the high demand for leasing in 2017-2018, we wanted to ensure the leasing process for 2018-2019 was as smooth as possible and gave current residents the opportunity to renew.  We had an overwhelming amount of inquiries about renewing, so we needed a system to keep track of who requested to renew first because we renew on a first come first served basis. People’s responses were time stamped and the difference in pricing was based on when we ran out of a certain rate.  It was true, the earlier you signed the better rate you would have received compared to waiting to sign your renewal lease; our rates were based on a tier system. We urged every resident to sign as soon as possible before the next tier came into effect.  We perform quarterly inspections and preventative maintenance to replace your air filter, to confirm no maintenance is needed, and to avoid pests.  If maintenance is needed, we are required to enter your unit to correct any issue.  With small damages such as carpet stains, we provide each resident an opportunity to correct the issue to avoid a charge.  This process is outlined in the Quarterly Inspections brochure provided in an e-mail to you and is also delivered to your door.  We always welcome residents to communicate with us so we can work together. Please let us know if you did not receive this and we can send it to you again.  When selecting a unit and signing your Exclusive Bed Space Addendum, we do our best to make applicants aware of unit differences. This is also described in your Contract before signing. We are very sorry there was a misunderstanding. We make it a priority to listen to our residents, but not everyone is willing to talk to us.  We hope you consider discussing these items with us further.  Sincerely,  Campus Circle Management  217.330.56007 | CampusCircle@PeakCampus.Com

name: Campus Circle
review_text:
This is how campus circle sucks.
Once I accidentally made a payment with an account which did not have enough fund. After I realized that, I made another payment and cleared out all my balance.
However, their system was still charging me repeatedly. Though the system credited back what it charged for, the bank placed a returned item fee on my account once campus circle tried to withdraw money.
I consulted bank workers and they said unless campus circle stopped charging me, the fee would come up again and again.
Then I emailed property manager for help. Clearly there is something wrong with their system and instead of helping me fix this, she gave me a ledger which showed nothing and ask me go figure it out myself.
I was so pissed off. I hope my broken English described this issue clear.
Besides, they raise the rent by whatever they want. I signed a 4B4B last year for 700+/mo and they asked me to renew with a price of around 900/mo. When they realized they cannot rent all rooms out, they repriced 4B4B to 650. Thank god I didn’t renew.
Lololol ridiculous property and its workers.
Never live here again
owner_answer: Hi Yang,   We are sorry to see you are having this issue with your bank.  We did present you with your ledger reflecting how Campus Circle is not charging you.  Per our conversation, we advised you to present this document to your bank as proof you are not being charged from Campus Circle and this may be another source acting as a payee from your previous payment history.  While we would love to speak with your bank, they will need to talk to the account holder directly.  Unfortunately, this is not in our control as we do not show any charges to your Campus Circle account. We hope you may arrange a time to speak with us in person to clarify this situation.   Sincerely,   Campus Circle Management  217.330.5607 | CampusCircle@PeakCampus.Com

name: Campus Circle
review_text: If you ever live here, you will enjoy many kinds of charges. They charge you on stain on the sofa for $500, shower curtains outside the bath tub for, they can simply says you have a pet in your room and charge for 300, also 600 charge for a dirty shelf. They even write other room number on your package so you won’t get it anyway and they just deny that the package has been delivered. Live in campus circle if you have no idea where to spend all your money.
owner_answer: Hi Eric, we are disheartened to see you have changed your glowing five out of five star review to a one.  We give each resident the opportunity to fix what has been provided in the notice.  We will re-evaluate our charges when a resident schedules a re-inspection.  To clarify, you received a warning for the shower curtain outside of your bathtub as excess water can leak into the unit below causing severe water damage and unhappy neighbors.  You were not charged.  All charges are supported with pictures.  If you are unsure about your notice, we’d be more than happy to review this with you to avoid any confusion.  It is not in best interest of customer service to write the incorrect room number on a package as this makes it difficult for us to locate it and for you to receive it.  This is certainly not intentional nor common.  We are sorry if you experienced a delay in receiving your package.  We hope to work with you to resolve your issue.   At your earliest convenience, please give us a call or send us an e-mail so we may assist you.   Campus Circle Management 217.330.5607  CampusCircle@PeakCampus.Com

name: Campus Circle
review_text: This place has major security issues as the main door is unlocked and allows anyone to enter the building. The gates to enter the garage also don't work which allows unauthorized vehicles to be in the garage. Despite overworking their staff, the management team seems to lack the ability to solve the problems that are clearly prominent at Campus Circle such as the security issues I just mentioned. The service that they provide is unacceptable because they charge extra for things that they don't provide adequate service for.
owner_answer: Hi Sohail,We share your frustration about the doors and gates. We have been diligently working on resolving these issues the moment they were discovered. We have been in contact with multiple vendors to get this addressed as quickly as humanly possible. Please note, this is not impacting the apartment and bedroom doors.  We are hoping to get this resolved very soon. Regarding the extra charges, feel free to reach out to us to directly to address any charge disputes you may have. Best,Zach | Leasing Manager

name: Campus Circle
review_text: Great amenities, nice location, great apartment. Bad review falls solely on the office staff. The answer to most of my questions are "I don't know" and they never get back to me with answers. I know a lot of the staff are part time employees, and students, but the lack of information and follow through is kinda absurd.
owner_answer: Hi CJ,Thank you for taking the time to provide feedback for our office. We appreciate you granting us the opportunity to improve your experience. To gain more insight into your specific concerns, please feel free to contact our office directly. We do have three managers in the office throughout the week and at times on the weekend, so if you are ever having any issues, please reach out to us via phone, email, or setting up an appointment to meet us in person.  We’d be more than happy to connect with you!Best,Campus Circle Management

name: Campus Circle
review_text: The staff in the office are super nice and helpful! From my several experiences, the maintenance service is always pretty quick and effective. The room is clean and modern.
owner_answer: Hi Charlotte,We are so happy to hear that you've enjoyed your experience in our community and are excited to have you around again next year! If there is anything we can do to continue impressing you, do not hesitate to reach out.Have a great evening!Best,Campus Circle Management

name: Campus Circle
review_text: I've had nothing but great customer experience with campus circle. Every question I had before I moved was addressed. The leasing office is connected to the building with convenient hours (10-7). Molly and her staff were very helpful and were flexible with my housing needs. Of all the places I have lived in Champaign Urbana Campus Circle has by far been the best.
owner_answer: Hi Brian, thank you for taking the time to write a kind review about our community! We greatly appreciate your feedback and are pleased to know that you have received excellent customer service. We're happy to have you as part of our community and look forward to a fantastic summer! As always, please let us know if you need anything at all.

name: Campus Circle
review_text: Campus Circle has exceeded the loftiest of expectations. From the warmly accommodating staff, to the convenient in-house gym and myriad other amenities, my experience has been a deeply satisfying one. I regret that I'm finishing school this year, because I know that wherever I move next is unlikely to compare.
owner_answer: Hi Zach! Thank you for taking the time to write this review about Campus Circle. We appreciate your kind words and hope your future living experiences will be great!

name: Campus Circle
review_text: When I firsts started looking for apartments at uiuc I was terrified. I went to several different places and never felt comfortable until I came to campus circle. First, the staff is beyond words phenomenal, helpful and welcoming. Shout out to Molly, Tatiana and Brittanie. Walking me through the process very carefully and and making me feel at ease. I'm a bit of a nervous person so I think I've called about 20 times in two months to ask about basic things like weather or not I need to bring a shower curtain and what size the beds are. They even went to far as to text me pictures of the model rooms they have so I can have a template on how to decorate my room. Second, the amenities and units are beyond luxuriously. From a heated swimming pool, yoga studio and dozens of study rooms to the small things like free printing and tanning beds, campus circle is is truly a perfect place to have a nurturing learning experience in a comfortable safe environment.
owner_answer: Hi Josh! Thank you for taking the time to write us an awesome review! We really appreciate your kind words. As always, please let us know if there's anything we can do for you. We're looking forward to having you as a resident this fall!

name: Campus Circle
review_text: The management and room is awesome. I have to say Kyle white helped me a lot during my stay. Just a little sad the pool is not open due to the coronavirus last term:)
owner_answer: Hi Xiaowei, thanks so much for giving our assistant manager, Kyle, and management team a shout out! We love hearing about positive experiences from our residents. As always, if you need anything at all, please feel free to reach out. Have a nice rest of your week! Sincerely, Campus Circle Management

name: Campus Circle
review_text: Extremely uncomfortable living here. The dripping noise in the bathroom is terribly annoying. First I tried service request, and they replied with "there is nothing we can do" by email. Then I talked with the staff and literally NO RESPONSE. I came to talk again, and still "nothing to help". Totally cheaply built and worst service ever.
owner_answer: Hi Feng,   We are disappointed to see you are uncomfortable living here as we have previously communicated with you to discuss your concern. Per all service requests, we follow up with each resident via phone call to ensure the service order was completed to their satisfaction. If we do not receive an answer, we send an e-mail. In the rare case we are not able to resolve an issue, we will also complete the same steps to communicate to the resident what attempts were made to resolve the issue and why were we unable to provide a solution. If you did not receive our phone call, please allow us to confirm we have the correct contact information for you; if our e-mail message did not reach your inbox, please let us help you to ensure Campus Circle is an approved sender in your e-mail.   The noise coming from the bathroom is from the lines inside the wall.  We have confirmed the noise was not coming from the toilet itself, checked the float valve, as well as inspecting the roof to check the vent line to confirm there is nothing restricting the air flow to the sewer vents. We would be more than happy to arrange a time at your earliest convenience to sit down with you and explain any of this in detail.  Thank you.     Campus Circle Management 217-330-5607  CampusCircle@Peakcampus.Com

name: Campus Circle
review_text:
Update: Of course you can't find me as a resident. I don't want to be stuck with unreasonable move-out charges by posting on my own account.

DON"T LIVE HERE! Not just the apartment is terrible, the management sucks too. They are like robbers when they do inspections! Almost sounds like they are knocking on the door with a hammer！ And someone's window glass was broken by one of the inspection people!!! How is that even possible?? The internet connection sucks. And what's the point of signing individual leases for a 4 bedroom apartment when I am still responsible for the mess my roommates make in the living room!?!?!? Recycling for boxes is also super far, if you don't want to take it there, you better be rich to pay all the fees! I think it's 20 or 30 a piece? Most importantly, the management likes to stalk whoever posted reviews. I think it's best if they give people some privacy.
owner_answer: Hi Sihan,   The employees of Campus Circle and Peak Campus do not retaliate against residents who leave reviews.  If you change your mind and would like to discuss our policies and inspections, feel free to call me, email me, or stop in the office.  We give people multiple chances and opportunities to remedy any issues before a charge is assessed.  Our inspections are important for both the resident and management to ensure we are keeping a well-maintained home for you and your roommates. Prior to entry, we announce ourselves to avoid surprise or disturbance when entering whereby following our e-mail that includes why we are inspecting your space and when. We replace your air filter and confirm that there are no issues that may have not been reported such as water spots on ceilings from lack of shower curtains in the unit above or lint traps that have not been emptied which can make it more difficult for your dryer to dry clothes which uses more energy. We are here to help as these are common issues apartment renters may not be aware of and you are not charged for these things. These are simply checks to make sure we can provide the best quality of living for everyone at Campus Circle.    Charges are only assessed if something has been damaged and needs to be replaced or repaired and require ordering parts or new pieces.  Blinds damaged by pets or a fine associated for smoking in the community are examples as this not only damages the apartment, but affects the surrounding neighbors.   While we do offer individual leases, it is made clear every person in the unit is responsible for the shared common areas. If someone takes responsibility for common area damages, only that person will be charged.   The most recent inspection was crucial as Urbana, Illinois had record breaking low temperatures and we needed to confirm all windows were properly closed to avoid frozen pipes and water damage. We closed windows that were open or not properly locked. The incident you are referring to is for a resident whose window was not shut and had been found cracked upon entry. Due to the -40 degree weather, it was easy for the double pane window to crack. Fortunately, the window was replaced immediately and no one was harmed. We take our residents experiences and comfort very seriously and are prompt in responding to any maintenance needed. Our property was not the only one that experienced cracked windows from the excessive cold for multiple days.    If you or your friend lives here and is experiencing any problem with the internet connection, please notify our Internet Provider as they can best trouble shoot your issue and are available 24/7. They can detect which router is closest to you, refresh a signal, or perform maintenance if needed.   Recycling bins are provided and available on each floor.  For bigger items, we do ask they are placed in the centrally located Recycling Bin. We also have one on the north-side of the building. Boxes left in the hallway are a trip and fire hazard and we want to ensure our community is clean and free of empty boxes and trash.  Lastly, when we see a negative review, we call the resident directly so we can work together to find a solution for any issue they are experiencing. If they do not answer, we do send an e-mail to ensure we are doing everything we can to improve that persons experience. We pride ourselves on customer service and take reviews very seriously. We hope you will consider meeting with us or speaking with us over the phone or e-mail.   Kind regards,   Molly at Campus Circle  Assistant Manager at Campus Circle CampusCircle@PeakCampus.Com | 217.330.5607 www.LiveCampusCircle.Com

name: Campus Circle
review_text: Good stay here, we have quite surroundings and neighbors are very nice. Also good for campus circle’s front desk, they are really helpful and warm.
owner_answer:
HI Seven,

Thanks so much for coming by the office for a package. It was great getting to know what your studies involve! We are delighted to hear your experience at Campus Circle is worth a 5-star rating. If you need anything at all, please let us know!

All the best,
Zach | Leasing Manager

name: Campus Circle
review_text: They will inspect you every month or 2 months. They charged you for ridiculous things. One thing so weird recently was that they charged my blinds. And Molly said they cannot move this balance to the deposit and they would change my blinds at that week. Of course the blinds weren't changed. Just a small amount of money so no one will notice. If you live here, just check your balance.
owner_answer: Hello Jia, Thank you for your review.  All charges are supported with an image.  Before assessing a charge, we confirm with your Move-In Condition Form the item was not listed in addition to reviewing previous inspections and their images.  After inspections, we bring the issue to your attention immediately with a notice in an e-mail.  We are very open with our process and what we will charge if the damage can’t be corrected. A balance is also e-mailed to you each month.  Your deposit is used for qualifying to live in our community if you do not choose to use the Self-Qualifying or Guarantor option provided.  It cannot be used for any other reason during the lease term.  We have continuously tried scheduling a time with you to review your blinds together but have been unsuccessful.  We have also offered for you to send us a picture of the existing damage so we may help you but have not received anything.  Please help us so we may help you.  Should they have been missed by maintenance, we should certainly replace them.   Sincere regards, Campus Circle Management

name: Campus Circle
review_text: Nice and friendly staff. Helped me a lot with my move-in. Also, the location and the facilities are good. Can't wait to live there.
owner_answer: Hi Rebecca, It was my pleasure guiding you through the leasing process! We are so excited for you to move in and take advantage of all we have to offer. If you need anything at all in the meantime, please do not hesitate to reach out to us! See you soon! Best,ZachLeasing Manager

name: Campus Circle
review_text: Campus Circle has been a wonderful student living experience! I was matched with random roommates who have become great friends, the staff and maintenance team are attentive and professional, and the building overall is beautiful! I would recommend the property to any student!
owner_answer: Hi Mike, thank you for taking the time to write such a positive review about our community at Campus Circle. We are thankful to have you as a resident! As always, please let us know if you need anything at all.

name: Campus Circle
review_text: Living at campus circle is one of the greatest apartment choices I've made. I won Lollapalooza tickets in a raffle here, there's super friendly and professional staff and any issues I've had here I've had support from the camps circle team in resolving them. I would definitely recommend living here for the price, location and private bathrooms! :D
owner_answer: Hi Stephen, thank you for taking the time to write us such a kind review. We're happy to have you at Campus Circle and wish you the best on your future endeavors as you graduate from U of I. We wish you could stay here another year! Don't forget, we're giving away free breakfast today and tomorrow for finals. We hope to see you there!

name: Campus Circle
review_text: Molly was of great help and made the leasing process nice and easy. Really recommend this place, specially if you’re a student. Great location and amenities!
owner_answer: Hi Luis! We really appreciate you sharing your experience on Google, and providing a five-star rating! We enjoyed getting to meet you and hearing about your temporary relocation to the area. We can't wait to get you moved in tomorrow and look forward to having you as part of our community! Please feel free to reach out if you need anything at all.Enjoy the rest of your Tuesday!All the best, Molly with Campus Circle | Property Manager | www.LiveCampusCircle.Com

name: Campus Circle
review_text: They try to seize every opportunity to charge you; constantly doing so-called quarterly inspections and looking for reasons to charge you penalty fees. Even worse, we were charged a penalty fee for replacing the sofa, we paid the fee and were promised to have the sofa replaced. We checked a couple of weeks later, was told the sofa was on its way and then checked again a month later, was told the replacement will be done when we move out... Our bills were calculated wrongly for several months and then was manipulated to make the numbers look correct. They even sent me the bills thinking we would not look at them carefully. When we questioned the bill, we were told that we were charged "correctly, and fairly"; so we had to waste a lot of time explaining to them and finally help them realize that their "math" was wrong. This kind of experiences make me really question how they manage the facility and care for their clients. I am very disappointed because this is not the type of experience I thought I was paying for.
owner_answer: Hi Fan, we sincerely appreciate your feedback and hope to have the opportunity to speak with you in person regarding each concern. Our quarterly inspections are completed only 4 times during your lease term. It is necessary to replace your air filters and maintain the community. Our intention is not to charge our residents as we understand no one wants to pay additional fees.  We provide every single person who received a notice for damages an opportunity to remedy the issue and we will perform a re-inspection if requested or required.   Unfortunately when checks are mislabeled under the memo line, it is difficult to decipher which accounts the amounts should be applied to. For example, if the payment is for two apartments but is not specified in the memo line, we will apply the check to the account whose name is on the check only. If you have questions about this process, please let us know.   This is not the type of experience we want you to have and we would truly like to work with you as well as Huimin Ru to improve your experience.   Campus Circle Management  217-330-5607 | CampusCircle@PeakCampus.Com

name: Campus Circle
review_text: My food order was accidently delivered here and the front desk staff was so kind and helpful in making sure I got my food. I called and originally my order wasn't there, but once it came in the actually called me back to let me know. I appreciate you all so much! Thank you.
owner_answer: Hi Robin, We appreciate the time you took to leave this kind review! So glad to hear that you successfully received your food! Our team has and always will make an effort to "Do the Right Thing" as it is one of our Peak Mindsets. I will be sure to notify the rest of the team about this kind review. In the meantime, if you are ever looking for housing in the future, we would be happy to assist in your apartment search at Campus Circle! All the best,Zach Leasing Manager

name: Campus Circle
review_text: Campus Circle is one of the greatest residential places in Champaign-Urbana, it's a great choice specially for engineering students. The staff are cool and fast responsive. The maintenance teams are always around and on call. The building is super nice and still smell new. It's a great place to live in.
owner_answer: Hi Mamdouh, thank you for taking the time to write a review about our community! We appreciate your feedback about our team and the property itself.

name: Campus Circle
review_text: Literally, living here changed my life. I was harassed daily whenever I was a single day late for rent, threatened to be evicted me for 1 violation (which I was overcharged for and eventually paid back because of it), would harass my mother at her place of work for fees, and we’re just overall money hungry individuals.  My account had to be credited due to inappropriate distribution of charges, my car was towed (TWICE) from the the parking zones located by the main entrance while other cars weren’t reprimanded for the same “violation,” and just overall discrimination towards myself and my roommate. Rules were regulated whenever they felt like it and there was no legit/proper structure to this business. We’ve both had to get our parents involved several times and it was just overall an uncomfortable living condition and as a black woman, I felt personally attacked for the entire year that I lived here. I wouldn’t recommend living here to my worst enemy. There’s no human decency or care for their residents, they just want your money!
owner_answer: Hi Kaila,   We are sorry you felt this way during your stay and are here to listen. Our business thrives on its people and our goal is not to upset our residents as this would not benefit either party. We hold each person equally accountable and it disappoints us when we see our residents are not following the Lease Contract and Rules and Regulations.   Without reaching out to residents and their guarantor, we cannot understand why rent is unpaid or if rent will be paid. We only call the numbers that have been provided to us upon signing and if we are unable to get in contact with one person, we reach out to the other based on what is in our system. It is our responsibility to let both people know of balances due. Sometimes both people do not respond and we have to continue to follow up until we receive a response to confirm we are on track for payment until rent is paid. We do this for all people who have an outstanding balance and not specifically directed to one person.   Common area charges are assessed to each individual in the unit. When a resident takes responsibility for a violation, we are able to reverse this for the other people involved. Regarding the towing of your vehicle, we give each person 1 warning. If they are repeat violators, they no longer receive a warning and are automatically towed because they have been made aware of the parking policies prior. To add, signs are posted clearly in all lots and a parking map is provided upon move-in for reference. We want to ensure residents and their guests have the opportunity to enjoy the assigned parking as there are limited spaces for the entire community. We do enforce rules equally and residents may not see other vehicles towed or charges for violations.  We are sorry you feel this is unresolved despite meeting with you in person yesterday. Please let us know if you have any additional feedback.  Sincerely,   Campus Circle Management  217.330.5607 | CampusCircle@PeakCampus.Com

name: Campus Circle
review_text:
They penalize the tenants without legitimate reasons. I moved out this year, and I am charged for something that doesn’t even make sense.
1. Loss of window screen
I checked everything when I moved in. Honestly, I don’t remember exactly, but I think if one out of six window screens is missing, I would have noticed it. Either the window screen is not there in the first place or someone steals it. Just think about it, why would anyone steal a window screen??? My roommate is graduating and going to California. I am moving out to another property, we both already have a lot to pack. Seriously, why would any of us take down a window screen...
2. Replace blinds (see attached photos)
I literally never use the blinds during my stay, so when I moved out, I specifically put it down and checked there is no damage on the blinds. Somehow, they said it is broken and charged me for 35 dollars.
owner_answer: Hi Yen-Ling,   We see your review and are sorry you did not have a positive experience with our move-out process. We understand our business thrives on its people and we aim to provide an incredible stay for each of our residents. Upon move-in, a condition form and expectations are provided to ensure new residents moving in are not charged for any damages that may have existed before their arrival. Prior to assessing charges we review all forms and your charges were not listed on your move-in condition form. An image was also provided to support this charge. The amounts for charges are based fairly and include the amount to replace items, shipping, and labor. An opportunity to sign the Responsibility of Damages form, should an issue be found in the common area, is also provided. If these damages were caused by someone else, we simply need this form signed from the responsible party to re-assess charges. Please let us know if you have any questions about this process.   Sincerely,   Campus Circle Management  217.330.5607 | CampusCircle@PeakCampus.Com

name: Campus Circle
review_text: Great office staff, always friendly
owner_answer: Thanks for leaving us a review Gus! We appreciate your support.

name: Campus Circle
review_text: Very cool apartment, the office staff know each of their residents by name and I'm truely impressed when Molly helped with my rent paying issue without even asked my apartment number since she remembered my name and my apartment number. Very friendly office staff and a very convienient environment.
owner_answer: Hi Fred, thank you so much for taking the time to write a review about our community and giving a shout-out to our leasing manager, Molly. We appreciate your feedback and as always, please let us know if we can assist you in any way!

name: Campus Circle
review_text: The apartment management is horrific, and they overcharges you for everything. If they find stins on sofa they will charge you for more than 300 dollars which is rediculous. Please check the review carefully before moving in to this apartment place. Best.
owner_answer: Hi Chang, thank you for providing us with information to better improve your experience as well as the experience of others in our community. It is disappointing to see damages to our property; as a result we do have to charge fines which are outlined in writing to each applicant prior to signing a Lease Contract. Furniture inspections were completed to ensure residents moving in August 2018 will have acceptable furniture during their stay just as you received upon move-in.   We always provide the opportunity to correct the item addressed in the notice after inspection. If this is resolved, please send us an e-mail to arrange a re-inspection. We will re-evaluate the charge if necessary. We would be more than happy to meet with you to discuss the charges assessed and how you may avoid them in the future.   Campus Circle Management 217.330.5607  CampusCircle@PeakCampus.Com

name: Campus Circle
review_text: Very good living experience here. Have plenty of public space. The staff are nice and responsible as well.
owner_answer:
Hi Yuxuan,

Thank you for the glowing review! We're so happy to hear that you are enjoying your stay with us. As always, if you need anything, don't hesitate to reach out to the office. Have a great week!

Sophie
Assistant Manager

name: Campus Circle
review_text: Upon movein, ethernet was not working. Until now, internet still super slow after 10pm; cardboard requires to be placed near office, which is fairly far from living garage side. Entrance lock on 5th garage broke for 2 months at least. Renewing price was based on the time filling out google form???? Experienced one day without hot water. Smoke alarm keeps beeping. Sound insulation is really bad, especially obvious at night. Staff were overall helpful.
owner_answer: Hi Honglu,    It appears that you may have posted a second review regarding similar matters that we have previously discussed. Please let us know if these issues have not been resolved so we can help you.    Kind regards,    Campus Circle Management CampusCircle@PeakCampus.Com  217.619.0630

name: Campus Circle
review_text: Have the employee with the worst attitudes-a white woman. Plzz stay away from her, her attitude makes u feel like you owe her money. The worst apartment experience of my life. Wont choose here
owner_answer: Good morning Liue,  After researching your name in our system we see you have not contacted us before. We are unsure if you meant to provide a review for Campus Circle in Urbana, Illinois and hope to have the opportunity to understand your Google review. We aim to provide excellent customer service to each person we communicate with. Please reach out to us at your earliest convenience.  All the best, Campus Circle Management 217-619-0116 | CampusCircle@PeakCampus.com

name: Campus Circle
review_text: Charged for damages that were present when moving in. Expect to be charged for everything on move out, take pictures of EVERYTHING. The fire alarm will go off several times (at least a dozen in a year) for no reason in the middle of the night, and you will be standing outside for a while. Common area's are frequently trashed and things broken (pool cue's, ping pong paddles, etc). People's pets use the bathroom in the hallways outside your door and it will go unnoticed for days. Avoid living here if possible. Friends at Latitude did not have these issues. Also writing my first ever google review because of this place.
owner_answer: Hi Kevin,   Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback regarding your living experience with us. We are disheartened to hear of your poor experience and hope to have an opportunity to discuss each concern with you so we may improve the quality of living for all residents. Please let us know at your earliest convenience when you would like to speak with us.  You can call our office at 217-619-0116.  Thank you.    Regards,   Campus Circle Management

name: Campus Circle
review_text: If you want to be fined thousands of dollars, please do come. They will never let you down when it comes to fine. They will charge hundreds even thousands of dollars during each so called quarterly inspections. And in fact, they do the inspections to charge money every month. What is more, they charge you for the chair that was damaged during the repair of maintenance for  over 100 dollars. Cheap sofa scratched by animal is 1500 dollars.
owner_answer: Hi Siyi, we are disappointed to see your 5 star review updated to a 1 star. The intention for our inspections every 3 months is to replace your air filter and ensure there are no missed maintenance needs in your apartment. We want to make certain that you are living in the best environment possible.   Unfortunately, there are times where we come across damage to the items included with your lease and will ask the person responsible to pay for the cost of replacement so we may provide the next resident with a like-new apartment. The cost includes the furniture, labor, and shipping.   When having an animal, there is always a risk for furniture being scratched. This would happen to any material if an animal is using it as a scratching post with their nails. After reviewing your ledger, you were properly charged the amount and it does not total $1,500.  In addition, the cost has been split between you and your roommate.   During our last quarterly inspection, you were not charged anything. We do not double charge for the same item and you were only charged to replace the property your pet damaged once.   Per our conversation, we can re-inspect the desk chair. We always prefer something is repaired rather than replaced as this benefits both you and our maintenance team. Please let us know if you have further questions.   Sincerely,   Campus Circle Management

name: Campus Circle
review_text:
I've been living in Campus Circle Apartment for a few weeks. I like this place a lot. It provides everything you can expect from a comfortable apartment, such as dish washer, washing machine and dryer and good furnitures. Looks like they also have great public amenities. It's close to CS and ECE buildings. There is also a MTD stop out the door and several restaurants nearby. It's a great choice for people like me who don't drive.
The only thing is that if you leave the window open, the University Avenue can be a little noisy (could be they are still building something). But it's not a big deal unless you are a very sensitive person.
owner_answer: Hi Xiaoxiao! We are so happy to hear that you are enjoying your stay! Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your experience. As always, please let us know if there's anything we can assist you with!

name: Campus Circle
review_text: Very good environment. The staff here are very nice and patient. The recreation center is also awesome. I go to the gym three times a week. Everything is good.
owner_answer: Hi Rui,  Thank you for sharing your positive experience with us!  It makes us so happy when we hear good things from our customers and it encourages us to keep striving hard to create positive experiences for our residents and guests.  We are happy to hear that you especially enjoy our fitness center! Please let us know if you ever have any ideas for improvement - your feedback helps us grow.  We look forward to having you stick around as a resident (and tell your friends to come live with us too!) Thanks!    Best, Campus Circle Team

name: Campus Circle
review_text: Very nice apartment. There are a lot of great amenities. The facility is clean and feels like a home. The staff is VERY friendly and quick to help out.
owner_answer: Tory, Thank you for sharing this experience with us! It is great to hear that you are enjoying your apartment and the amenities and that our team members are creating moments that stood out for you as exceptional service.  We are always here to help so please never hesitate to reach out!   Your Campus Circle Team

name: Campus Circle
review_text: Zach has been really helpful with the whole signing process. I was able to get everything done with one phone call. Very excited for the move-in :)
owner_answer: Hi Gunhee, Thanks so much for this kind review! We are always happy to help and enjoy hearing your positive feedback with our team members! We are so excited for you to move in. See you in August! Best,ZachLeasing Manager

name: Campus Circle
review_text: 4.5 stars for now. Better than latitude which I lived till last year. But the screen and window should be improved ASAP for bug prevention.
owner_answer: Hi Kangxuan, thank you for your rating of our community! I've sent you an email to see when we might be able to visit you to look at your window screen. We appreciate you providing us with an opportunity to improve your experience, and hope to hear from you soon!Best wishes, Molly with Campus Circle

name: Campus Circle
review_text: Now you are saying you would like to recheck the chair?!?!! You forget that when we trying to talk to you about the fine and make an appointment, the first sentence you said "If it is about the fine, it cannot be reversed"? Forget the certainty????!!!!And now what, the mantainence checked the chair and said the chair is not broken, and you have not replied any emails solve the issue. instead, you are able reply the google review really quick.呵呵
owner_answer: Hi Siyi, we see you have created another Google account and responded to your other review. We apologize for the delayed response to your e-mail as our assistant manager was away and your e-mail was only addressed to her. We offered a re-inspection of your chair in case something was overlooked. Fortunately your desk chair is repairable and you will not be charged at this time.   In respect to your time and ours, we ask that residents arrange an appointment to discuss disputes as we may not be available at the time you stop by. We value your time and want to provide our undivided attention.   We were sorry to inform you that you received another smoking fine and hope we will not have to fine you in the future for the same violation. The scent not only damages the unit but bothers other residents who can smell it. This fine is not reversible as cigarette odor is extremely difficult to remove as it  clings to our furniture, walls and ceilings, and requires our ozone machine to run for long periods of time in the apartment after your move-out. To add, special paint is used on the walls and ceiling, and we hope the carpet will not require replacement because the scent can stick to the carpet and pad underneath. Please let us know if you have further questions.   Sincerely,   Campus Circle Management

name: Campus Circle
review_text: Campus circle is a great apartment for U of I student to live! Newly constructed building, very close to campus. owner_answer: Hi Ting-ya, thank you for your thoughtful review and shout out to Molly. We all appreciate your feedback. We hope to see you at our free breakfast for finals today and tomorrow! As always, please let us know if you need anything at all.

name: Campus Circle
review_text:
The management is absurd. To get your package, you have to call to make appointments and when you call, the next appointment is like a week later?????????? It only takes less than a minute to get a package.
It seems like they only care about employees who get paid instead of us residents who actually are paying.
owner_answer: Hi Yvonne,Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review – we always appreciate the feedback.I apologize the earliest available time slot for you was not convenient. As a reminder, we schedule package appointments based on the earliest available time slot. We had an increase in packages deliver as August 19th was our move-in day.  We sincerely thank you for your patience while we moved in all new residents and also hand-logged all incoming packages while trying to follow COVID policies and procedures.Please feel free to reach out if there is anything else we can do for you.Best,Campus Circle Management

owner_answer: Hi Yimu, we are sad to see you have updated your 5-star review to a 1-star. In our last inspection, there were no issues addressed in your entire unit. On this most recent inspection, we noted continued smoking in your unit, resulting in your fourth smoking violation.   Cigarette odor is extremely difficult to remove as it clings to our furniture in the apartment, the walls and ceilings, and will require our ozone machine to run for long periods of time in the apartment after your move-out. It also bothers other residents who can smell it.  We also use a special paint on the walls and ceiling and hope the carpet will not require replacement because smoke can stick to the carpet and pad underneath.   This is not the first conversation we have had regarding smoking inside the apartment and we provided the opportunity to resolve this issue. We hope this will be the last time we will have to issue a smoking violation so you do not have to pay the fines. Please let us know if you have any questions about this.
