name: Campus Circle
review_text: I like my apartment, the amenities are good, although the price is a little bit expensive.
owner_answer: Hi Parisa, thank you for your review of Campus Circle. It was nice seeing you this morning at breakfast for finals! As always, please let us know if you need anything at all.

name: Campus Circle
review_text: Great place to live in. Very convenient for most engineering students.
owner_answer: Hi Arya! Thank you for your glowing review about our community and the convenience for engineering students. We appreciate your feedback!

name: Campus Circle
review_text: I really liked the place and Molly was super helpful and I love it!
owner_answer: Hi Jiang, thank you for writing a review about our community and giving a shout out to our leasing manager, Molly. We can't wait until you move-in!

name: Campus Circle
review_text: Staff are friendly, rooms are big, and location is good.
owner_answer: Zhengqi, our team strives to deliver an excellent experience, and are glad you found this to be the case during your visit. If you have further needs, please reach out!   Best regards, Campus Circle Management  217.330.5607 | CampusCircle@PeakCampus.Com

name: Campus Circle
review_text: I really the gym! it's very pretty convenient for us during the break!
owner_answer: Hi Wei, thank you for leaving a positive review of Campus Circle on Google. We are happy to hear that you are enjoying our 24 HR, Two-story fitness center. As always, please let us know if you need anything at all.

name: Campus Circle
review_text: The staff is awesome. Best place to live!
owner_answer: Hi Thomas, thank you for writing a review of our community. We're happy to help and are pleased to know you're enjoying your living experience. Enjoy the rest of your week!

name: Campus Circle
review_text: Maintenance are good and fast. The gym is fantastic.
owner_answer: Hi Yifan,  We are happy to hear you've had a pleasant experience here! Our maintenance team works hard to ensure that your service requests are responded to promptly and accurately and we are glad that you think so, too! We love that you enjoy our amenities as well. Should you have any suggestions for improvements in our fitness center or any of our other amenities, please feel free to let us know. Your feedback only helps us improve for you and our other residents!   Best, Campus Circle Management

name: Bankier Apartments
review_text: I leased one of their single bedroom apartments starting the Summer of 2016 and was a tenant with them for the remainder of my PhD program. Ashley was super helpful when drafting the first lease and working with me online since I was still in Austin, TX at the time. I had zero issues during move in, everything went smoothly. The apartments are well maintained, and they are constantly upgrading them. During my time there I got new appliance upgrades every couple of years which was a nice plus. Maintenance responds very quickly,  and any issue I had (even minor ones) were usually taken care of the same day. These are some of the reasons why I stuck with them during my time in Champaign as a graduate student.  Would highly recommend them.

name: Bankier Apartments
review_text: I am in my third year of living with Bankier and I have had a great experience every year. They are very helpful and understanding and really make me feel valued as a resident. They have been more accommodating to me and my roommates than I ever thought an agency would be. Throughout my time I sublet my room and switched apartments and they were all easy processes. The price is great for how nice the apartments are. Parking is a little pricy though.
owner_answer: HI Jesse, thank you so much for taking the time out of your day to write us such a detailed review! It has been an absolute pleasure having you and your roommates as tenants over the last few years, you all make our job easy! As always, let us know if need anything!

name: Bankier Apartments
review_text: I have been a tenant of Bankier three times. Two as a residential tenant, and once as a commercial tenant. Both times I have been highly satisfied. Every maintenance issue I have had has been handled quickly and effectively. I find the management to be very fair too. They are reasonable people, and are genuinely interested interested in having happy tenants and retaining them. Recently a contractor broke a water pipe in our building which caused substantial damage to our business. Bankier went above and beyond and made an apartment available to us that day in the same building. We were able to continue to operate our business while repairs were being made and did not have to turn away any business. If that isn't top notch customer service I don't know what is! I would highly advise anyone who has a problem to actually call in and talk to someone. I think you will find that your experience will be the same as mine has been. Being reasonable and friendly goes a long way these day. :)

name: Bankier Apartments
review_text: I’ve lived with Bankier for 2 years and just signed for my 3rd year. Everyone there is so nice and so helpful! The maintenance is always quick and gets the job done the first time! Their apartments are well taken care of and you can tell they really care about their tenants. Can’t imagine signing with anyone else!

name: Bankier Apartments
review_text: I have had the pleasure of leasing with Bankier Apartments for over 3 years. The staff here is AMAZING and they go above and beyond in assisting their customers. I have had a great experience living with them. When there was a minor issue, they went above and beyond to resolve it. My building was always kept clean inside and out. The landscaping was always well maintained and the maintenance staff were quick in making repairs.  I highly recommend them to students or anyone searching for a place to live in Champaign-Urbana.
owner_answer: Hi Jessica, thank you so much for the great review! We LOVE having you as a tenant so be sure to stop by and say hi whenever your on campus!

name: Bankier Apartments
review_text: Their office is on the heart of Green Street on campus. Their parking is towards the side and back of their office, and also at the very back for businesses. They just "painted" most of the walls in the back parking lot and made it look like an attraction for criminals. It looks like Chicago's railway yard where it's trains have been spray-painted to appeal to criminals and homeless (this is not against the homeless). It looks ugly, disoriented and a mess: it should look professional, clean and professionally appealing so those who have to park and walk back (some of us live there or have friends who live there and have to use that parking lot area) there feel safe (feeling safe is better than feeling unsafe). This is not left for opinion, it is reasonable, wise, mature, educated and true that those who have to park back there should feel (it's not guaranteed but feeling safe is better than not) safe. What an ugly place they made it with the graffiti.

name: Bankier Apartments
review_text: Lived at 202 E Green for 1.5 years and can't find a single bad thing to say about Bankier. Always responded to maintenance requests within the day,  very reasonably priced for the newly renovated units, and the staff was personable and easy to work with. Lived with 3 different leasing companies during my time in Champaign, and Bankier was by far the best!
owner_answer: HI Hannah, thank you so much for writing about your experience with us. We are so happy you enjoyed staying with us! Your friends here at Bankier wish you all the best with your future endeavors

name: Bankier Apartments
review_text: The bankier staff goes above and beyond to accommodate their tenants needs.  I have always felt welcome when I come into the office and the staff is always extremely kind and friendly. My building is mopped and cleaned regularly and the maintenance staff is always speedy and efficient when responding to requests. I strongly encourage you to consider Bankier for your next apartment. I have been extremely pleased with the staff and company and cannot say enough good things about this staff!

name: Bankier Apartments
review_text: This is my second year living at Bankier (202 Green St.) and I have had the BEST experience.  We loved our apartment last year, but love it even more now that it has been completely renovated.  The staff is so friendly, always very accommodating, easy to work with, and fixes any issues as soon as possible.  We would highly recommend living here!!

name: Bankier Apartments
review_text:
After living on campus for around 6 years, I've dealt with multiple apartment management companies and have found Bankier to be the easiest to work with. The staff, specifically Jackie, went above and beyond in service and accommodation in helping me to find the  apartment I wanted in a very timely manner.

I appreciate the ease of communication with the office, and have found them to be receptive and responsive to my requests.

The apartment was cleaned thoroughly prior to move in, and when I noticed the washer was broken upon my first use, it was immediately replaced. Very easy to deal with.

Overall I find Bankier to be a solid company to rent fron. I would be likely to recommend their properties to a friend.

name: Bankier Apartments
review_text: I was looking to sublet an apartment on-campus for the spring semester. I was hesitant about the entire process, but Savannah Meneley and Sydney were so kind and welcoming. They were patient with me as I visited multiple apartments. The fact that Bankier helps you connect with the people who post sublets is extremely helpful as I could not get people who had rented from other companies to respond to my emails. Actually, the person I sublet the place from did not respond initially but with their help he responded right away after they made contact, and they even made suggestions for improving my direct contact due to the other party being across the globe. Savannah has made multiple contacts with me since that day including basically walking me through the initial paperwork process. I figured out that she stayed in the office after hours to help me twice, including her and Sydney staying after hours on the day I initially searched for apartments and the “manager” staying with her on the Saturday that I picked up my keys. Furthermore, every time I had questions she made me incredibly comfortable asking them. Once I decided that I was going to look for an apartment on-campus for the ‘21-‘22 academic year, I couldn’t imagine going to anyone else but Savannah and Bankier. Savannah has gotten the right people to help me when I’ve had any sort of “issue,” such as needing a bed removed. And, I feel safe with their locks and key fab system. It was a no-brainer for me to rent from them for the upcoming academic year. Of course, I was completely satisfied with the support I got when choosing my apartment for next year which is why I decided to write this.
owner_answer: Hi Charles, thank you so much for taking the time to leave such a detailed review! Real reviews from real people like yourself is what keeps us striving to give the best customer service! We look forward to having you as a tenant for another year.

name: Bankier Apartments
review_text: I am writing this in response to a previously left negative review that i feel was undeserved. Bankier apartments got stuck in the middle of  an issue pertaining a third-party company that contacted me, likely due to an error or misinformation. Ashley at Bankier, despite it not being her issue and likely having many other things to worry about, took the time (multiple) times to reach out to me directly and personally to do the best she could to address the issue and offer assistance and information to the best of hers and privacy laws abilities. I have never rented from nor known anyone who has rented from this company, but I can at least attest to Ashley's prompt, polite and personal customer service. On this alone, I would certainly consider looking into their properties knowing I would have honest and responsive communication: if they can be this helpful and quick about issues un-related to their properties or current tenants, I can only assume they take equal or greater care or prospective and current tenants.
owner_answer:
HI C Toth, we appreciate you taking the time to write us such a thoughtful review to clarify the situation.  It would be an honor to have you as a tenant so feel free to stop by and see us anytime!

-your friends at Bankier

name: Bankier Apartments
review_text: I had an incredible experience with Bankier Apartments. The convenience of living close to campus at a very affordable price was excellent. Maintenance requests were done on time and the staff was always helpful to assist me with my housing needs. I highly recommend living with them!
owner_answer:
HI Israel,

Thank you so much for taking the time to write us such a great review! We really appreciate you sharing the experience you've had with us!

name: Bankier Apartments
review_text: I’ve lived with Bankier for over 2.5 years in 4 different properties and haven’t had a single negative experience. The leasing agents are helpful, maintenance is always timely, and the buildings and units are well kept and clean. I would highly recommend them to anyone searching for a place to live in the Champaign area, especially Illinois students.

name: Bankier Apartments
review_text: I cannot open my door on this morning.And I have phoned to Bankier Service Line . It has been solved within 10 mins.Good Service! I highly recommend you choosing to live here.A wonderful day :)
owner_answer: HI William, thank you so much for taking the time to write us such a wonderful review. We are so happy we were able to help you so quickly! Please reach out if you ever need anything else as we are always happy to help :)

name: Bankier Apartments
review_text:
I lived in CU for 6 years while completing my PhD, and I rented from Bankier the entire time. I lived at 505 S 4th for my first year and then moved to 55 E Healey for the remaining five years.

Both properties were well maintained, clean, and quiet. When maintenance was required, all of my requests were dealt with promptly and effectively, often on the same day the request was made. All of the office and maintenance staff were polite and professional.

I always recommend Bankier when I hear that people are looking for apartments in the CU area. I had an excellent experience with them and thoroughly loved the apartments. It was difficult to move away after getting a job out of state because 55 E Healey truly felt like home.

name: Bankier Apartments
review_text:
When I came to Champaign-Urbana in August 2012, one of my friends referred me to Bankier Apartments and I rented an apartment in 303 W Green. For the next year, my wife and I looked into other apartments of other real estates, and for many reasons (as some of them mentioned below) we decided to stay at the same location and with Bankier Apartments, and that is why I have renewed our lease contract for 4 subsequent years.

First and foremost, the building and its units are very clean and safe. The entrance to the building and parking lot are well secured. In addition, the furniture provided in units are awesome (especially compared to the apartments of other realities which are at the same price range).
Moreover, The office staff are very friendly and care highly about their tenants' concerns. Whenever I asked them something, they provided us at no time, or they sent their professional maintenance people quickly to resolve the problems.

So I am really satisfied with Bankier Apartments, as well as my apartment, and I highly recommend them to everyone.

name: Bankier Apartments
review_text:
Note: this is an edited review

I'm updating my review after being contacted by the general manager of Bankier. I originally had a few issues with the appliances and I felt that the rates were not very competitive for the area. The management seems to be going to lengths to fix the issues I had; the customer service is great, much better than many of the plastic reps other companies have.

name: Bankier Apartments
review_text: Currently a resident at one of their properties and our apt had no internet for over a week. Bankier was extremely unhelpful, and did absolutely nothing to fix the problem. We had to communicate with the internet servicer which bankier is supposed to responsible for.

name: Bankier Apartments
review_text:
They do maintenance requests pretty quickly, and apartments are always clean with pretty decent furniture, 202 E. Green Apartments are a little overpriced, but really spacious.

Down side, their management is incompetent. They always send three terribly written emails that do not get what they need across. This happens every time they need to communicate something, and it's unprofessional. Watching them struggle whenever their are FOB (the key you need to beep into the building) issues was sad and incompetent as well. Overall better experience because they at least give everything the old college try.

name: Bankier Apartments
review_text: If you want a good apartment in the campus area of champaign, there are two options: JSM and Bankier. I went with Bankier because of the better price options, better location, and recommendations from friends. I have not been dissapointed at all! I lived at 406 e green this year, which is located right behind the bankier office, which means that I see the staff a lot more than most residents probably do. Everyone who works there is quick to give a smile and a wave, and always remembers my name, which is a personal touch I don't think you can get anywhere else. I had some trouble this year in which my apartment was leased before I was able to renew it, which was completely my fault since I waited way too long to decide I wanted to stay in my apartment. The people at Bankier were super understanding and sympathetic, and in my opinion went above and beyond trying to work out where I will live next year. I ended up signing a lease at another apartment close by, and couldn't be happier with my service. If you're trying to decide between JSM and Bankier, I can tell you that Bankier actually seems to care about you, and will go the extra mile to make sure you're happy with your apartment.

name: Bankier Apartments
review_text: Awful company, no integrity. Had been contacting them over a period of 2 weeks about touring a house to lease. My first appointment they canceled on me last minute on Wednesday and told me to come back Friday. Went to tour the property Friday and after waiting in the cold for 30 minutes I call and they inform me that the house had already been leased. They didn’t even have the decency to tell me before I showed up at the house. Based on that experience alone I do not think I could trust this landlord or rent from them.
owner_answer:
Hi Jack,

I want to start off by sincerely apologizing for your negative experience with our Company. We had to cancel last minute on Wednesday because one of the tenants called that morning and let us know they were sick, and would prefer if we did not show their unit. Friday, at the time of your appointment someone who had previously seen the unit came in to sign for it at that moment. This does not excuse our actions but I wanted to make sure you were properly informed about what occurred. It is reviews such as yours that provides our company the ability to learn from our mistakes in hopes of creating a better customer experience in the future. Thank you for you review, and we hope you will grant us the opportunity to improve your image of us.

name: Bankier Apartments
review_text: I have lived in Bankier's apartments for the past two years and have had a great experience in specifically the 1107 S Second St. apartments (Roundbalconies). The maintenance on campus is fantastic. Any time I sent in a maintenance request, I was serviced within two business days at the latest. The apartment was fully furnished (~40 in wide screen T.V, brand new couches, beds, and kitchen table). The staff that works in the main building are all very accommodating to your needs and I have worked with them on numerous occasions. Unfortunately I am moving out but the Roundbalcony apartments are all being refurnished and are a steal. The price, location, and value for your dollar is top class here. Only setback is that electricity bill can be a bit steep in the winter (due to heating) but the price you pay for rent offsets that. As well, almost all apartments on campus have this issue regardless. Best deal on campus that not many have heard about. HIGHLY RECOMMEND.

name: Bankier Apartments
review_text:
Bankier is really the most top-notch leasing group in Champaign Urbana for us folks who can't afford to live in the brand new high rises that are springing up all over the place. When I was viewing units at the start of their leasing season, Keith showed me a unit that was in the process of being remodeled after I shot down everything else he had to offer. Even though it was half painted and didn't even have cabinets yet, I was enamored with the space. Naturally, I had a million questions for Keith, and I was surprised to find that he confidently had answers for most of them.

Things that he didn't have answers for (will it have a garbage disposal? can I get it unfurnished? do you HAVE to paint these gorgeous hardwood beams or can we leave them exposed?), he made some calls and found out. At most places this probably would have been a weeks-long ordeal to get sorted, and Keith got me the info I needed before we even left the unit.

I signed shortly after, and that was about 8 months before the lease started. During that period, Keith never batted an eye when I hit him with off the wall questions directly via email, and was even so kind as to give me some progress shots of the remodel, as well as a handful of images of the finished product. He was very responsive all the way up until move in day.

The move in process was as smooth as any on campus. There were a few items that needed attention in the unit, which was to be expected. I drafted up my maintenance requests, sent them to Keith, and he submitted them on my behalf shortly afterward. He also helped me get moved in early, which made life so much easier. I've been in the new place a few weeks now, and it's really quite nice. My requests have been taken care of, Keith is still as responsive as ever, and has even offered to drop in and help me with some things like wall mounting my TV. Overall, I'm a very happy tenant!
owner_answer: Hi Keelan, Here at Bankier, we strive to provide the best hospitality and customer service to all of our tenants so we are so happy to hear that Keith, and the rest of our team held true to this commitment. We are so glad you decided to choose us as your home away from home while attending the U of I, as we have LOVE having you as a tenant. We hope to see you in the office sometime soon!

name: Bankier Apartments
review_text: This will be my 3rd year leasing with Bankier Apartments! Bankier has always gone above and beyond the call of duty to provide excellent service. They answer any inquiries you have right away! Their staff are extremely helpful as well. If there is a need, Bankier Apartments is there to help indeed!
owner_answer: Hi Langston, Thank you for such an awesome review, and thanks for being such an awesome tenant during your time with us. We hope to see you again soon!!

name: Bankier Apartments
review_text: Bogus damages allegation leading to 200 dollar fine. They said the MATTRESS was damaged.
owner_answer: HI Victor, the $200 you were charged was not a fine, it was the final charge from turning your apartment after you moved out. Our records show you have not reached out to our office to discuss the charges you acquired. If you feel you were wrongfully charged, please send an email to info@bankierapartments.com and we will review your dispute in hopes of coming to a conclusion that works for us all.

name: Bankier Apartments
review_text: Hello everyone.    I work in maintenance.    This company deserves 5 stars .    They go above and beyond for there tenants.  Management and maintenance are awesome.   Very knowledgeable  the properties  well maintained and look great.   I'm glad I left green st realty for bankier.     If you need a apt for college i would go bankier.   They will not let you down.
owner_answer: HI Robert, thank you for taking the time to write a review! We are so happy you decided to join the Bankier team! #MaintenanceMenAreTheBestMen

name: Bankier Apartments
review_text: Just another company taking advantage of college students. $95/month for parking in a garage that is extremely dangerous - the entrances to each level are not wide enough for a car to enter in. The entrance to the garage itself is dangerous- it is very small and you cannot see who is going in and out. The “ramp” has a lot of bumps. On top of this, if you park in the lower level, good luck - there is no elevator or stairs for you to use to walk back up. $95 is extremely overpriced for parking that should be $50 max. Shame on this company and I feel bad that I wasted my money on parking here. Never lease with them - their apartment complexes are overpriced too for what you get.
owner_answer: Hi Kavya, we are sorry to learn you feel this way as our prices for parking on green street is right inline with market rates. There is an upcharge for non-tenant parking , which is what you received as a non resident of ours. However, we encourage and allow prospects to look at the parking spot prior to signing to ensure they are able to fit it in properly. If this opportunity was not granted to you please stop by our office at 406 E green St to discuss.

name: Bankier Apartments
review_text: Lived at 508 East Clark st for 3 years. Really friendly staff, no scam, they are able to resolve issues promptly. Heard bad experience from other property management, glad I choose Bankier Apartments.
owner_answer: HI Eric, Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review about your experience with us! We are also VERY happy you choose Bankier Apartments as your home away from home! Best of luck to you and all of your future endeavors.

name: Bankier Apartments
review_text:
Although I didn’t end up leasing from Bankier, I’d like to review their service. Ryan Marder helped me tour the apartments virtually and thoroughly answered any questions I had.
Bankier definitely provides a very professional service; I’d highly recommend!
owner_answer: Hi Hina, Thank you so much for taking the time to write this lovely review. We are so glad you enjoyed your tour with our Senior leasing agent Ryan and we hope to experience you as a tenant soon! Have a safe and prosperous year! -Your friends at Bankier

name: Bankier Apartments
review_text: Lived at this place a few years ago and they charged me for a couch that literally wasn't damaged. Then I called repeatedly to at least see some photos to prove that it was damaged. After several attempts to get some photos, they still never sent me photos. After years, I still remembered that they literally stole money from me and tried to blame us for a damaged couch that was literally never damaged in the first place. Also, the apartment was absolutely FILTHY when I moved in, and they did not even have the keys ready for my apartment. They claimed multiple times that it was "deep cleaned," yet I literally was on my hands and knees scrubbing upon move-in because it was so disgusting. They are not to be trusted. Also- Give me my money back or send me pictures of this "damaged couch."
owner_answer: Hi K, we apologize for any inconveniences this situation may have caused as we intend to be thorough and fair when processing security deposits. Please email us at info@bankierapartments.com with your first and last name, apartment address and unit number for the location you lived at and the dates for the lease term you signed for so that we can investigate this situation further.

name: Bankier Apartments
review_text:
I live in bankier's apt for over three years, and I would like to give a fair review for other UI students.
Pro:
Location Location Location!: most of their apts locate in the center of Champaign downtown, which is extremely convenient for students work in lab till late night and need food around.
Payment option: This company accept check/online bank transfer/ credit card to pay rent, which is convenient.
Space: Their room tend to be larger than market average.
Rooms available even if you apply late: Better apts generally runs out pretty quick, Hot apts could get out of space for next two to three years!

Con:
Obsolete building: Most of their building were really old. They do maintenance, but problems still occur frequently. For example, water heater in upper unit exploded and huge amount of water flood my belongings. You will need to take all these losses by yourself without renter's insurance. (generally cost +$100/Mo.) Heating/Cooling cost is high due to lack of Insulation.

Noise: If you live in their old building, then you will hear every single detail of what your neighbor does. Such as they fart in toilet, close the door, make Love, say something to themselves, & etc...

Overpriced: Bankier's apts generally tend to give slightly higher price compare to others. If your budget is tight, then choice other apts.

Landlord entre your room frequently: Urbana city require landlord give notice at least one day before they enter your room. However, Champaign does not have such law. Although most of the time, landlord will knock the door before they open your door. There are several times that staff open my door without any notice. Live in Urbana if you really care about privacy.

Overcharging: It is quite often that they charge you for problem that exist when you move in. They refuse to fix those problem and then charge $$$$ for that when you move out. The company also refuse renter to steam clean the carpet by themselves. (If you do so they still charge you carpet clean fee) Therefore, you will have hundreds more bill when moving out compare to other companies. MAKE SURE YOU TAKE PHOTO OF EVERYTHING WHEN YOU MOVE IN&OUT!!! PHOTOCOPY THE CONDITION LIST SHEET before you turn it in.

Dishonesty: Their mouths were full of lies toward international student, and I am not the only victim of their lie. It's quite often that they lie about condition of apts when they *talk* about the room. So you must VISIT THE EXACT ROOM YOU WILL LIVE IN BEFORE YOU SIGN THE LEASE.  Misleading information include mail/package/parking. Take your time read the lease documents! Again, you must visit the exact room!

PS: all these cons were true for old apts, if you live in their new building (e.g. Skyline Tower), then the only problem is overprice.

In summary: Live in Bankier's old build will give you an average to below average experience. (3 to 2 star) Their new building should give you a good to excellent experience. (4 to 5 star).

Others: C-U area generally tend to be very safe (compare to Chicago downtown, & etc...), and this area does not have bed bug problem too. Most of apts are roach free (or the pest control work really well). Most of downtown apts are furnished with acceptable price. TAKE THE COURSE GIVEN BY UOFI TENANT UNION BEFORE YOU MAKE DECISION!!!

name: Bankier Apartments
review_text: Avoid this place! I lived at 410 E Green for almost a year.Did an early move out on May 2016.Before moving out, I thoroughly cleaned my apartment according to the required condition.1 months later, I received a mail stating that there is $300 cleaning fee plus $30 damages.(YES, they said my apt needs 8 hours of cleaning @$25/hr, plus $100 carpet cleaning) This is just ridiculous,I've never been charged this much before. I feel like I got scammed.

name: Bankier Apartments
review_text: Bankier Apartments and their staff are the most amazing and friendly people I have met on campus! They got me into an apartment very quickly, were very accomodating, and very helpful when i had any questions! I recommend this company to anyone looking for an apartment!!

name: Bankier Apartments
review_text: I've been living in their 519 green st apartments for 3 years and couldn't have asked for anything more. The building is regularly cleaned and maintained with no issues at all. Excellent staff who are always ready to help. Highly recommended.

name: Bankier Apartments
review_text: Bankier is great at communication and is prompt with maintenance requests. Nice people. I've been living in one of their residences for over 3 years. :)
owner_answer: Hi Laura, thank you so much for sharing your experience with us!! We have thoroughly enjoyed having you as a tenant!! As always, if there is anything you need let us know and we will be sure to take care of it for you!!

name: Bankier Apartments
review_text: I am a tenent of bankier and I absolutely love my apartment and all the staff at the office. Everyone is very helpful and they are quick to get maintenance out to you if need be. I plan on staying with bankier as well as referring friends to rent from them as well. Very happy tenent!!

name: Bankier Apartments
review_text:
The property manager made it VERY clear that because she sent an email out it was okay for maintenance to enter my apartment *without knocking*. I told her that her maintenance guy “Troy” was acting very weird because he came to my apartment twice *without knocking* to notify us about them painting the door. Thats fine; However, he DIDNT Knock! And she says “Oh maybe you just didnt hear him knock” like its hard to hear a door thats 10 inches away. The second time he came *again* he didn’t announce hisself. He CASUALLY unlocked my door as if he stays here and then when I locked it back he UNLOCKED IT. So now we’re sitting here fighting with the lock because I continuously locked the door. Why would you keep unlocking my door and you clearly see I locked it back. Just weird. I asked him why did he think it was okay to not knock!! He says “Well I knocked the first time I came”

Very Unacceptable. As if it was not just a recent incident with a girl getting killed by the maintenance guy in her building. They were not at all concerned with my safety.

Be aware. Ask to get your lock off master lock. Get cameras do something ladies. Protect YOU at all costs !!
owner_answer:
HI De’ja,

We are saddened to learn that our response to this situation did not satisfy you. We felt that due to the multiple layers of complexity regarding this issue; offering you an unmastered lock change, rent credit and the option to break year lease without any legal liability or cost would help to address your concerns. We also addressed the way we enter units with our entire maintenance staff and addressed company policy to ensure every tenant has the opportunity to open the door regardless of prior communication as a result of this incident. Again, we apologize for the stress that this has caused you and wish you well in your home.

name: Bankier Apartments

review_text: This has been my second year leasing form Bankier; I have no complaints. Good service, very friendly staff, and my apartment is excellent.

review_text: Bankier Apartments has done an excellent job taking care of their tenants. Anything I needed to be fixed or replaced, they made it a priority of theirs and got it done.

name: Bankier Apartments

name: Bankier Apartments
review_text: I appreciate the owner of Bankier reaching out to apologize for my negative experience at the office albeit 3 months after the incident. I was told the employee was reprimanded for her actions. I have yet to go back to the office, but I hope it will be a pleasant encounter.

review_text: Lived with Bankier for 2.5 years while at the U of I. They were always respectful, helpful, and quick to respond. Facilities and maintenance are great.

name: Bankier Apartments
review_text: They kept my deposit for four months after moving out. I emailed them several times about it and they lied to me all the time saying it’s already been mailed to my new address. Obviously it’s not because when I came to the office four months later the deposit check is still in the office.
owner_answer:
Hi Orange, I believe there is a slight misunderstanding between us in regards to what happened with your security deposit. We tried to mail your deposit out and it was returned to us by USPS. That is why when you came to our office it was there. Regardless, it is apparent that you were slightly dissatisfied with the service you received from our office and for that we are truly sorry. I hope the clarification gives you some comfort in knowing we did not lie to you in efforts to keep your deposit. Wishing you all the best in all of your future endeavors!
-Your friends at Bankier

name: Smile Student Living
review_text:
Horrible staff, the front desk man was so rude by blaming me for my problems. I provided pictures and proof of our parking spot. There is glass and construction blocking our parking space. Also they did not inform residents of where to park in case they can't get to their parking. There are many things wrong with our "brand new" fully furnished apartment. This is a horrible company and they don't hold accountability at all.

Update
I spoke with the Manager and she was more reasonable and said sorry that we were not informed. She also took my suggestions on how to improve how residents are addressed, and to clearly tell residents where they can park.

The construction is horrible and have been going on forever. The electrician block the exit and forced me to back up all the way to the opposite direction to get out. There was plenty of space on the street for them to move and they rather shout at you then move.
owner_answer:
We apologize for the inconvenience you experienced with our staff and the construction, Evan. We appreciate your feedback and have addressed these issues with our team. We strive to improve our communication and ensure a better experience for our residents. Thank you for bringing this to our attention.

The Smile Student Living team

name: Smile Student Living
review_text: Popped in to pay for parking while in town for a business meeting. Hunter was working the front desk and was extremely professional and helpful. He gave me some good recommendations for places to eat, specifically Hickory River Smokehouse which he really sold me on. Clean lobby area as well.
owner_answer:
Thank you for your positive review, Mason! We're glad to hear that Hunter provided you with excellent service and helpful recommendations. If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to reach out to us.

The Smile Student Living team

name: Smile Student Living
review_text: Their apartments are good, and prices are reasonable. But their service is poor. Firstly, they do not provide the apartment in a clean or maintained state. They probably don't even check the place after the last people move out, but will charge you very quickly for any damages. They do not respond to maintenance requests, and eveytime you call them, they tell you the same thing and hang up - they say they will have the team call you back - and then obviously nothing happens. Our wahsroom is in a pathetic condition - unclean and broken - and they still haven't fixed anyhting despite following up everyday between classes and assignments. Extremely disappointed.
owner_answer:
We are sincerely sorry to hear that you are having an issue with your apartment, Kanchan. We strive to provide our residents with clean and well-maintained apartments. We check all apartments at move out and before move in. We take your feedback very seriously and will continue to improve our processes for move in for future residents. We will investigate the issues you have mentioned regarding maintenance and take the necessary steps to correct them. We appreciate your patience and understanding.

The Smile Student Living team

name: Smile Student Living
review_text:
Smile Student Living only leaves frowns for anyone that decides to lease with them. They have absolutely no care for their tenants and will only answer you weeks after your initial problem has started.

From the first week that my roommates and I moved into our unit, our AC was broken DURING A HEAT WAVE (over 100 degrees every day). After a week had gone by with nothing on smile's end and SEVERAL calls from us, we eventually got told that there were no fans left for us. Even after we stressed that one of our roommates has a medical condition and has FAINTED MULTIPLE times, nothing was done.

It wasn't until we all went into the office and complained that we got a portable air conditioner unit that didn't event get installed in  all of our rooms. By the middle of the second week, maintenance finally came in and fixed our AC only for it to break again because the coolant added started leaking. We had to call again for them to fix it but by the time that was fixed it was no longer hot and all of us had not slept in the apartment for a majority of the nights.

We paid for a FULLY FUNCTIONING apartment and that was promised to us the day we signed out lease but clearly that wasn't the case. We got in touch with the previous tenants who had the same issues so not only did they fail to inspect the unit before we moved in, but they caused an insurmountable amount of emotional and physical damage to us that could have been easily avoided.

I hope everyone, especially Jonathan feels ashamed for their behavior. I don't care that you feel like you "failed us". I care that the safety and well being of my roommates are being ensured instead of ignored. If you had an ounce of empathy for what we had to go through you wouldn't have left us stranded without help during a heat wave for longer than a week. SHAME ON YOU!
owner_answer:
We apologize, Julia. We regret any miscommunication and delays in resolving the problem. We appreciate your feedback and will use it to improve our services for all our residents.

The Smile Student Living team

name: Smile Student Living
review_text:
I lived at 806 S Third for a year and while the duration of my tenancy was generally uneventful, the end of my lease period left a sour taste.

Upon beginning our lease, we were informed and agreed upon a non-refundable admin fee of $1,000, which we were led to believe covered basic cleaning expenses. This was straightforward enough. However, after the lease concluded, we were blindsided by several additional charges that seemed to starkly contrast the condition in which we left the apartment.

For instance: Trash Removal Fee ($15) - We ensured the apartment was free of trash when we moved out, so this was perplexing. Oven Cleaning Fee ($50) - The oven remained untouched and unused during our entire stay. This charge is baseless. Washer/Dryer & Bathroom Charges - We were met with vague fees without any detailed breakdown. We treated all amenities with care and are confident that no significant damage was caused by us.

Any minor cleaning required should have been absorbed by the initial admin fee. Despite our numerous attempts to reach out and gain clarity on these charges, our concerns went unaddressed. Such a lack of transparency and communication is frustrating, especially when we prided ourselves on being responsible tenants and maintaining the apartment in good condition.

It's regrettable that an otherwise acceptable leasing experience was marred by this. For future tenants, please be vigilant and ensure everything is documented and clarified to avoid similar experiences.
owner_answer:
Thank you for sharing your leasing experience at 806 S Third with us. We sincerely apologize for any confusion regarding the charges at the end of your lease. We have responded to address the specific concerns you raised. We value your feedback, and by working together, we hope you had a more positive experience. 

Smile Student Living

name: Smile Student Living
review_text: This is already off to a horrible start. Don’t rent from this company! It is overpriced, the elevator doesn’t work on move in day and they have authorized people to tow your car on move in day while actively moving furniture from the parking lot and we had to pay a $75 fee.
owner_answer:
We are so sorry for the trouble you have experienced. We understand that the elevator not working on move-in day and having your car towed were both very inconvenient, and we sincerely apologize for that. We aim to make things easy and smooth for our residents. We value your feedback, and we will use it to improve our services in the future. If you have any further questions or concerns, please do not hesitate to reach out to us at hello@smilestudentliving.com.

The Smile team

name: Smile Student Living
review_text: Smile apartments does not care about the needs of their tenants. Our apartment at 615 S Wright Street had no shower bar in the bathroom when we moved in. Whenever we shower, water spills everywhere in the bathroom because we can't hang any shower curtains. I have contacted maintenance multiple times, with no response for almost 2 weeks for each request. Still, they make sure to contact us when we have a showing of our unit (not like we can refuse, and it happens three times a week with them barging in). Moreover, they charged each of my roommates and I 250 dollars ($1000 total) for cleaning of the apartment before moving in. Nothing was cleaned and the apartment was incredibly dirty. I asked them what the money was used for and they were very ambiguous and didn't answer my question. Clearly, Smile has their priorities set on gathering new tenants for the next year, but not caring for the needs of their tenants currently. I do not recommend leasing here at all. I will update once the shower bar is fixed.
owner_answer:
We are sorry for the inconvenience you have experienced at Smile Student Living. We take your concerns seriously and will work to improve our processes and communication. Please reach out to us at (217) 903-0440 so we can discuss the issues you mentioned. 

The Smile Student Living team

name: Smile Student Living
review_text: This is a sorry excuse for a leasing company. No one should ever consider leasing a property through smile. They do not care for their tenants in the slightest. Throughout the majority of my lease the elevators in my building were broken. Week after week they sold residents false promises that the elevators were being fixed. Obviously these lies never came to fruition. Following the end of my lease I was charged an unfair sum for alleged "damages" in my apartment which were nonexistent. First off they do not allow tenants to dispute these items over the phone. I wrote them an email regarding the balance and never heard back. Weeks later I was forced to pay the balance because they never responded to me and my balance was going to be sent to collections. I suspect they intentionally ignore customers claims so that they are forced to pay balances in full. They never give residents a chance for their claims to be heard. This is a predatory practice in nature. The people who work for this company are lowlife degenerate scum. If you are considering leasing from Smile I strongly encourage you to rethink your decision.
owner_answer:
We apologize for any inconvenience you experienced during your lease with Smile Student Living. We strive to provide a positive living experience for all our tenants and are disappointed to hear that we fell short in your case. We take your feedback seriously and will review our processes to ensure better communication and responsiveness in the future. We have extended the payment deadline to ensure we can review your dispute of the charges before payment. If you have any further concerns, please reach out to us at hello@smilestudentliving.com.

The Smile Student Living team

name: Smile Student Living
review_text:
Terrible place to live - consider somewhere else. Their office is open at the worst hours when we needed them so we had to take off work. They gave us a unit with a broken heater and did not fix it for so long and our units temp reached over 100 several times - we got footed a huge electric bill many times because of this and they told us to kick rocks. Good luck getting in contact with them for disputes as they do not work with you and tell you to email them, but they never respond to their email or they drag and take forever. We lost so much money living in their property and would recommend you take your choice of living somewhere else. DO NOT LIVE WITH SMILE - they won't help you and they screw you over! They gave us the wrong information about move out dates and they do not work with their fines - their fees for online payments too are just ridiculous. I would give a 0/5 if possible.

UPDATE AUG 7:

These clowns sent our deposit back to the unit we haven’t had access to in months…refuse to answer the phone to my roommate and once they did - they were very rude and hung up on him!!! If you’re considering living here - I high recommend you do not due to our extremely terrible and unprofessional and unfair experience with them. I’ll personally help you find a better company!
owner_answer:
We are sorry to hear we did not meet your expectations, Patrick. We need help locating you in our system to reach out. We want to look into this in more detail. Please get in touch with us via email at hello@smilestudentliving.com.


The Smile Student Living Team

name: Smile Student Living
review_text:
Run! Don't rent this place! I rent for a remodeled unit, but the light easily fall off the ceiling because of the jumping vibration caused by my neighbor right above my apartment. And I asked for maintenance for more than one week ago and it is remained unsolved even I have called the maintenance office twice, emailed the office, and visited office. The most upset thing is that the office is so unconcerned about the resident's safety issue. I told them the light bulb is hanging there and only connected to the ceiling by a single wire so I am so concerned that it may fall off suddenly. And he told me it is safe. How can I think it is safe if it can easily disconnected to the ceiling? At least the Wampler or University Group property are very prompt in maintenance.

Another unhappy experience, I reported the office the issue that my neighbor keeps jumping continuously in the early morning which causes annoying repeated vibration noise that disrupted my peace and sleep. It is a remodel apartment but the structure is old. I simply wanted them to have a conversation with my neighbor, encouraging her to be more considerate and mindful of the disturbance she was causing to those living below her. The management office seemed indifferent to my concerns and their response was, "you can call the police." As a resident, I believe that property should play a role in fostering a harmonious living environment for all tenants. But the Smile property seems indifferent to build a good living environment for us, therefore, an advice: to stay happy in your campus life, stay away from this property
owner_answer:
We sincerely apologize for the negative experience you had at Smile Student Living, Zoe. We take your concerns and safety seriously. Please contact us at hello@smilestudentliving.com and we can escalate this to management so we can discuss your issues in more detail and work towards a resolution. 

The Smile Student Living team

name: Smile Student Living
review_text:
Avoid Smile like the plague if you have the option. Their property management is horrible.

I have been staying at one of their apartments (606 E Stoughton St.) since August and they have continuously failed to provide adequate duty of care to their tenants.

Some examples of their failures (including civil liabilities that they are dodging responsibility for) include:

-For a two-week period, we did not have hot water in our apartment. This violates a wealth of habitability requirements, including Champaign's Rental Habitability Ordinance (Section H), and Illinois's Plumbing Code. We notified management the morning we noticed the issue, and they failed to respond in a timely manner.

-For the entirety of my stay thus far, I have had a crack in my ceiling that allows rainwater (and likely snow) to pour through. This crack also has mold. While we did not originally know that the mold-filled crack went through to the roof, management should have noticed this issue-- yet no one ever actually came to clean the mold. I had to do so myself. A few weeks after move-in (so early-mid September) is when it rained enough for water to leak through. I notified management shortly after, and to this day (October 31, a whole month and a half later) they have yet to fix this issue. This violates section A of the Rental Habitability Ordinance.

-The parking garage has been consistently decaying over the course of my stay. I witnessed a ceiling cave-in mere days after moving in (August 24), which should have alerted management to the structural issues with their garage, yet two months later, I and many other individuals have been finding these white splotches on our vehicles that do not come off.

While this is not an enforceable error, their inability to address the issue shows an excessive lack of empathy and a disdain for their tenants.

-Our unit originally had pieces of floorboard missing near the doorway leading out to our balcony. This issue existed at move-in and was reported at the earliest possible moment. Not only was this not addressed for well over a month, this issue should have been glaringly obvious to management when inspecting the unit.

Smile has consistently failed to uphold the minimum standards of care required legally, and refuses to adequately compensate their tenants, even for the issues they are legally culpable for.

Avoid Smile at all costs. In my opinion, they are morally bankrupt and a perfect example of mismanaged business that only survives due to their oligopolistic hold on college real estate. If you have any issue, to whatever capacity, they will do their utmost to avoid any sort of compassion, empathy, or responsibility for the living conditions their tenants are subject to. My advice, do not sign with this company.
owner_answer:
We apologize for the negative experience you had with Smile Student Living. We take your feedback seriously and are committed to addressing the issues you mentioned. Please contact us at (217) 903-0440 so we can discuss your concerns and work towards a resolution. Thank you.

The Smile Student Living team

name: Smile Student Living
review_text: Rented at their springfield and Lincoln location. Chose the option for a non refundable but lower fee instead of a safety deposit. My rent was accidentally over charged for a month, and they said they would send me the extra month back to me. They sent less than $100 dollars out of over $400 back despite the apt being left in great condition and having paid already over $200 for the non safety deposit option. Homeless loitered around the property, the trash was constantly overflowing into the parking lot, there were several times the cops had to be called to the complex, and the ceiling of the covered parking fell on parked cars. Would not recommend choosing this rental company.
owner_answer: Thomas, we apologize for any billing frustrations you experienced, and we understand your concerns about the property's condition and security. We take these matters seriously and actively address them to create a better living environment for our residents. Your feedback is valuable to us, and it serves as a crucial tool in our ongoing efforts to enhance our services and the overall rental experience. Please reach out to hello@smilestudentliving.com with any additional feedback you have. The Smile Student Living Team

name: Smile Student Living
review_text:
watch out for move-out fees...

horrible experience -I stayed with them in an overpriced tiny apartment for three years and took such good care of it that it was in much better condition when I left than how I received it (I had received dirty toilet, glass stains on kitchen counter etc... all those were in my move-in report). I left it sparkling clean, even though I had paid a $250 non-refundable fee to be used for 'carpet and light cleaning.' Still, not good enough for Smile. They charged me an additional amount, supposedly for cleaning cabinets, oven, replacing dripping pans, and throwing away trash (a couple of items that a respectful airbnb visitor would forget behind)... I repeat, the apartment was cleaned to professional level, in better condition than I had received it, and it was so small that I can't imagine $250 would not be enough to clean it, even if it wasn't. They never really said what they did with the $250 except the abstract 'light and carpet cleaning.' On top of that, they threatened with sending this to collections if the fee was not paid.

In addition, I had requested to turn in my keys three months earlier because I wanted to leave the country and did not know if I would be back by the end of lease. I was planning to maintain utilities and keep paying rent until end of lease. But it was not good enough for Smile. While it was never written in my contract, they demanded I paid the remaining amoung (3 months of rent in advance) on the day I turned in the keys AND end my contract. That meant, they would have the right to rent out the apartment I had already paid for way earlier than the end of my lease.

Finally, I will say that the apartments are not efficient. For example, this was -- again -- a tiny apartment, a not-too-old construction, but received excessive energy bills, especially during the winter (I had not spent summers there actually for A/C).

Smile play communications, social media, have these supposedly fun events, but do not be mistaken, all these are paid for with cuts in maintenance, as well as extravagant and unfair fee practices at the expense of a revolving clientele in a campus town. Both them and Fairlawn (parent) are companies I now intend to avoid, although I am still in town.
owner_answer:
We apologize for any inconvenience you experienced during your stay with us, Dora. We strive to provide a clean and comfortable living environment for all our residents. We understand your concerns regarding move-out fees and will review our processes to ensure transparency in the future. If you have any further questions or concerns, please feel free to contact us at (217) 903-0440. Thank you for your feedback.

The Smile Student Living team

name: Smile Student Living
review_text:
It's been more than a week since I moved in and there's several issues about the apartment that has been brought to Smile Student living and it's maintenance team, but has never been resolved (or say, there is no effort in trying to resolve). Here are the three main issues that the apartment currently still have (unfortunately)

1. The washer is broken.
2. There is no internet.
3. There is no hot water.

It is totally understandable that not all apartments are perfect and kudos to the Smile team in managing a huge portion of student housing on campus. I do understand a lot of maintenance request are on the queue. These problems, however, are effecting my day to day lives in the apartment. I've rented from JSM and University Group and in my humble opinion they are much more responsive. I would not recommend Smile to anyone.
owner_answer:
Caroline, we genuinely apologize for the inconvenience you faced during your move-in. Our team strives to ensure apartments are prepared promptly, and while we've addressed your concerns, we understand it may not have been as swift as you'd hoped. Your feedback is valuable, and we empathize with any frustrations you may have experienced. Again, thank you for the feedback.

Smile Student Living

name: Smile Student Living
review_text: Come back from break and there is all this construction and maintenance being done that is literally blocking my apartment door and it leaves white Styrofoam particles all over which brings it into our apartment. It is like an obstacle course to get to my apartment. The elevator breaks every week. Paper thin walls. Frown has scammed my roommate from his security deposit from a previous unit. Avoid leasing with this company at all cost.
owner_answer:
We apologize for the inconvenience you experienced with the construction and maintenance at our property. We strive to provide a comfortable living environment for all our residents and will address this issue promptly. Regarding the elevator, we are actively working on resolving its recurring issues. We take your concerns seriously and appreciate your feedback. Please contact us at (217) 903-0440 so we can discuss the matter further and find a solution.

The Smile Student Living team

name: Smile Student Living
review_text: Think twice before signing with Smile. At the beginning of my lease, I chose the admin fee option($250), which I was told covered the application cost and cleaning. However, when I left the apartment I was slapped with multiple cleaning charges which did not make sense. I was then told that the $250 covered only "wiping of counters and light dusting." They basically lied at the beginning so that they could extract more money. Very disappointing and I had also spent a lot of time cleaning prior to leaving the place. I hope Smile is more transparent and open with their policies for future tenants.
owner_answer:
We are really sorry about the confusion with our admin fee and cleaning charges. We try to be as transparent as possible with our policies, and we will take your feedback into account for future tenants. If you still have any concerns about the charges, please don't hesitate to contact us at hello@smilestudentliving.com.

The Smile Student Living team

name: Smile Student Living
review_text: Looking for another mediocre leasing company? Smile Student living is the one for you! I stayed at 615 S Wright which is their newest building, but it still had several maintenance issues throughout the year that they were slow to respond for. The elevator was constantly breaking and didn't work during move in/out, so be prepared to carry your belongings up 7 flights of stairs! Smile's building was so welcoming & safe that we had a homeless person sleeping in the entryway for several days! Additionally, locked/chained bicycles are constantly being stolen from under the building. The dumpsters at all of their buildings are constantly overflowing filling the streets of CU with trash. Also, don't expect to get your security deposit back unless you are willing to hire a lawyer. (That is typical of all college apartments, but Smile's was more expensive & they don't respond to emails or phone calls). I stayed at Smile and JSM and highly recommend JSM leasing instead.
owner_answer:
Sorry about any trouble you had during your stay at Smile Student Living. We appreciate you letting us know about your experience and will take your concerns into consideration as we try to improve our services. If you have any other questions or want to discuss your security deposit, please don't hesitate to reach out to us.

The Smile Student Living team

name: Smile Student Living
review_text: We moved in a week ago and the AC has not been working since. We have been calling for maintenance and they have not been responding. We asked for portable ACs but they only gave one. That too in a 4 bedroom apartment. The chimney is also not working. Why are we even paying rent.
owner_answer:
Our maintenance team is following up with our vendor to resolve your AC issue. We appreciate your patience and understand that moving into a renovated apartment without AC is frustrating. Please know we don't want our residents to face these issues, and our entire team is working hard to provide you with quick solutions. 

Smile Student Living

name: Smile Student Living
review_text:
Will take your SMILES away! Telling the reality of  Smile Students Living, they are only waiting to take your money away, with no proper services. When my roommates and I moved into our apartment a year ago, they made us wait 15 days for the move-in, yet charged us for the whole month. Despite a non-refundable deposit, the place was dirty and infested with cockroaches, indicating that they didn't bother to clean it properly after the previous tenants. And I am sure they might have charged the previous tenants with cleaning charges but even after that it was not provided in a clean state to us, the new tenants. Throughout our stay there were several issues, like dirty couches, heating issues, no water which were fixed in days, but guess what even if we delay the rent by a day they charge us a late fee. HOW PROFESSIONAL RIGHT? Then when its about the time to leave, they'll charge you again for some stupid cleaning charges, even though you paid non refundable caution money and for those 15 days you didn't even stay in the apartment (God knows where that money went).They escalated the rent of their apartments to such a great amount that students were forced to move to other places because who can full fill rent with as basic as $13.5 hourly wages in UIUC. Guess what, where is the money going, yes, you guessed it right in their new BMW's and decor of office.

If Smile Student Living truly aspires to live up to their name, they should focus on providing services that genuinely bring smiles to students' faces, rather than taking away their joy.
owner_answer:
Sankalp, thank you for sharing your feedback about your experience with Smile Student Living. We're sorry for any trouble you had during your stay. We want you to know that we take your concerns seriously.

We are sorry to hear about your move-in, cleanliness, and maintenance issues. Our team is trying to provide a clean and comfortable living environment for all our residents, and we are sorry that we fell short of your expectations. We'll look into what you raised to avoid these situations for future residents. As for the cleaning charges, we have a standard procedure to ensure that our apartments are clean for new tenants. We are sorry this wasn't followed when you moved in. We will review our processes to provide a more efficient transition for future residents.

We appreciate your feedback and will consider it as we continue to improve our services. If you have any further concerns, please contact us at hello@smilestudentliving.com. Once again, we apologize for any inconvenience caused and thank you for bringing these matters to our attention.

The Smile Student Living Team

name: Smile Student Living
review_text: Smile is the most unorganized, unprofessional, and crooked company on campus. DO NOT SIGN. We’ve had water leaks faulty fire alarms, holes sawed into our drywall, unannounced maintenance visits, and randomly scheduled last minute showings of YOUR OWN APARTMENT. AVOID AT ALL COSTS
owner_answer: Luke, we're sorry to hear about your concerns and experiences. We strive to maintain professionalism and organization in our operations. We also understand the concern about the water leak above the kitchen sink, and we took the necessary steps to address and repair it in October. Your feedback is important to us, and please reach out to hello@smilestudentliving.com for additional questions or concerns you may have. The Smile Student Living Team

name: Smile Student Living
review_text:
DO NOT LEASE FROM THEM.
They are without a doubt the worst realtors in town. I moved-in early (16 days before the usual move-in) in a new apartment. There were so many issues. They don’t provide extremely basic stuff like a curtain rod, food disposal etc. and they charge a rent of $575/month/person (after $50 off per month) for such a 2 BR/2BA. We had a dishwasher that was not working. I filed the maintenance right away and kept checking on them every other day to send someone but their maintenance department would not anyone helpful responses. After multiple daily calls, and some threats of reporting to tenant’s Union and invoking the right to repair act, they eventually repaired it a full month after the request. We also had a broken mailbox. It took them 2 WEEKS to repair them and another 2 WEEKS to provide the keys (which I had to procure by visiting the office).
DON’T lease from them unless all the realtors are full and you don’t prefer far off-campus living (I would genuinely prefer that than to live in a Smile apartment).
There are also regular incidents of stolen items from the mail room(specifically where the mailboxes are outside of the building) and they take zero responsibility of rectifying the situation. MOST IMPORTANTLY, the older buildings have exorbitantly high electricity bills (~3x higher)
owner_answer:

name: Smile Student Living
review_text:
NEVER rent from Smile. I lived in two units at the 408 E. Healey property and have never had more problems with my apartments than I did here. The unit was disgusting when we moved in (pics for reference). The carpets had not been cleaned, as promised, and it reeked of cigarette smoke. Our AC broke twice  during the hot beginning days of the school year because the system was so filthy that it stopped working (pic of our air filter clogged with black gunk included). Our fridge also broke and we lost all our food admiring this time. They switched out the fridge with another units fridge but we didn’t get reimbursed for the food we had to replace.

During the time in these two units the following things broke: our dishwasher (had to be replaced), our AC twice, our heat (had to use space heaters and pay an extremely high electric bill - over $200 for the month), our windows weren’t sealed well during winter and our electric was very high and it was freezing in my room, our dryer stopped working numerous times because it was so old and we got a new one eventually, our freezer was continuously leaking water into the fridge and never got fixed even though someone came out at least three times to address it.

Now when I went down this past weekend before my lease ends to clean the apt out the AC was broken again.

Lastly, I was accidentally charged an additional month of rent and instead of refunding me $1219 that I was mistakenly charged they are refusing to return it until they decide to give back my security deposit. This is MY money and they have no right to hold on to it.

I would recommend literally any other company before smile
owner_answer:
Thank you for your review, Ashley. We are sorry you experienced these issues during your time at 408 Healey. Several of the problems mentioned were before we managed the property, and we cannot speak about these. We have a remodel plan for this building to help resolve some of the issues mentioned for future residents. We have issued you a refund for the additional payment. Don't hesitate to contact us if you have not received this. Thank you for your feedback. This will help us improve for future residents.

The Smile Student Living Team

name: Smile Student Living
review_text: Beware, this seems like affordable student living that is nice, safe, and secure but it's not. The key fab access was down more times than I can count in the time I lived there and when this happened they just left the doors open. Maintenance and staff were wholly unresponsive the entire time I Iived there, if I needed something too bad because I wasn't going to get help. If you forget your keys or fab (when the fab system is actually working) that is also too bad because they have literally no process for lock outs. In addition to all of this I took incredible care of my apartment and even spent an entire day deep cleaning my apartment before I turned my keys in but they still charged me upwards of $350 for damaged property. The kicker of it is in the after move out inspection images they sent me that showed what I had allegedly broken in my unit they had the completely wrong name attached to it. I reviewed the photos and they charged me a massive amount of money for damage done to another unit by another person. They charged me for deep cleaning of two bathrooms (I had one bathroom), a broken coffee table (I think I would've noticed if the glass top of my coffee table shattered), over $20 for changing my fire detector's battery (nowhere in my lease does it say I needed to replace this and there is no way it cost $20), and countless other charges that in no way applied to my unit. In those images it was clear it was not my apartment and different photos of the same spot didn't even look like the same unit, for instance in one image the bathroom was completely clean and in another there was black mold in the toilet and the shower. I would highly suggest paying a little extra for another property.
owner_answer:
Rosie, we are sorry to hear this! Thank you for your feedback on the fob system for the exterior doors. We have a lockout process if you do not have the fob for the exterior door or the key for your interior door. We are looking into the move-out charges in more detail. A manager will reach out to you with a resolution to the move-out charges.

name: Smile Student Living
review_text: I have lived in one of Smile’s properties for one year. My roommate and I cleaned everything for moving out and recently we got notified that we are charged $750 for cleaning fees and painting fees. name: Smile Student Living
review_text: The apartment that I currently live in is a great apartment. Newly remodeled and equipped with all the furniture at an affordable rate. Also, the location of the apartment is great with a bus stop right below where you can get buses that goes all around the campus.

The Smile Student Living Team

name: Smile Student Living
review_text:
Lived at 606 E Stoughton for almost all of my undergrad, switched from CPM to Smile in the last year.
Location:
Probs best for engineers, but also next to a bus stop that has lines going all the way to the ARC and to downtown champaign. A block or two from County Market/Green St. as well for food.
Safety:
Open-building style complex, so got a handful of those door-to-door scammers. Packages get stolen if you leave it there for like 5 days. Sometimes there is a homeless dude in the stairwell but he has never done anything harmful for 3 years, so. Nothing particularly dangerous in this area imo.
Apartment itself:
The walls themselves are pretty thick between units/floors, so didn't need to hear my neighbors unless they were outside. There used to be a lot more parties but it's gotten quieter?
Not the newest condition (paint peeling after there were some leaks and stuff one summer) but it was good for the price we had imo.
Utilities: I think ~$80/month max
Management:
It's okay. Smile replaced our vinyl carpeting and mattresses but I wish they gave us more notice/more specific times bc we had to clear out of the apt w/ all the furniture being moved around.
Most maintenance requests were done within the week.
Don't lose your keys though it takes like $100+ to change locks.
Our total deposit of $400 was taken even though it was pretty clean :\
owner_answer:
Iris, thank you for taking the time to leave this review and sharing this feedback with us. We appreciate all your input regarding the building, the apartment, our office staff, and the maintenance team. Have a great day!

The Smile Student Living Team

name: Smile Student Living
review_text:
If you are a unaware student about to sign at a smile property. DON’T!

They are extremely unresponsive and will not fix any of your building requests! We have had our elevator broken for months and when we try to ask for compensation they simply threaten to take us to collections.

They will raise your rent without knowing too, DO NOT LIVE HERE IF YOU VALUE YOUR LIFE!
owner_answer:
Samyak, we are sorry and understand not having a working elevator is very frustrating! The part is on order, and the vendor could not expedite its arrival. We have contacted you via phone and email with an update on the repair. We will keep you updated as we know more information. Please get in touch with us at hello@smilestudentliving.com regarding collections and rent prices. We have not discussed collections or raised rent at this location. We want to clarify this and improve future residents' notifications when onboarding new properties.

The Smile Student Living Team

name: Smile Student Living
review_text: If my professional experience with employee Margaret Paul is any indication of how the company operates than any C-U community member should be eager to lease with Smile Student Living. She was upstanding, knowledgeable, and willing to work around estranged hours to fulfill our leasing needs. A dedicated employee who represents her company in the highest regard.
owner_answer:
Todd, we are incredibly grateful that you took the time to leave us a review! We are happy to hear you had a great, professional experience working with Margaret! We will share all of your kind words about her service with her. We are lucky to have her on our team! Have a great day!

name: Smile Student Living
review_text:
Hello,The maintenance team visited today and I had to request them to atleast put a tape on the gaps. They said that the doors will have to be replaced. So, unless that happens - for our entire lease, we will NOT be able to close completely or open the balcony doors for ANY of the rooms and will have to live with these gaps and wood around the house! You have wasted way too much of our time going back and forth, adding to the bad experience of already living in a damaged apartment. For continuous 2 months till now, we have had to be behind your team to fix so many issues in this house. Our basic rent is more than other tenants who have much less amount even with rent and electricity cap.

1) The gaps in these of nonfunctional doors that we will have to live with gaps until end of the lease, amounting to high electricity bills and being in a completely locked house. The lease terms warrant a functional unit and not a unit with damaged parts.
2) The smell of this house and the number of issues we faced since the last 2 months, from leaking sink to leaking bathroom, damaged refrigerator and broken parts in the house.
3) The entire 2 months of time we have had to spend going back-n-forth here in these email chains with you.

These issues have hampered our living here for 2 WHOLE MONTHS!!! and we will have to live in this for 10 MONTHS!! We have visited Smile office 5 times till now with no outcome. This is unacceptable!

Your feedback will help us solve any issues and improve our service for you and other residents. Please get in touch with us directly at hello@smilestudentliving.com.
