name: Smile Student Living
review_text:
One of the most rigid leasing company ever which has no regard for students whatsoever.

We are paying same amount for admin fee which would be the same as a security deposit but because of some rules of their they won't change it.

We have paid for a whole month for August even though the apartment is available just for 16 days and when we asked for just a day for early move in, they denied us.

But that's not even the worst part. When I called the management, I was extremely unsatisfied with the response and asked for a number to complain about his response, and they said that they don't even have a platform for that. He said that that someone from management will call me, but it's been almost 2 weeks and I have received no response. So even if you have a complaint, you don't even have a means to reach out to management.

They promise to be student oriented but they have been the least accommodating reality.

name: Smile Student Living
review_text: If I could rate this company 0 stars I would. They bought out CPM a few months ago and are scammers. They put outrageous, made up charges on our account after we moved out, and now are threatening us via email to send it to a collection agency! These are classic scare tactics used by greedy people. I will be contacting the Better Business Bureau because this leasing agency is unethical and it’s important that more people know about this. They’re horrible, they never answer their phone, and don’t care about their tenants. Stay away from this leasing agency at all costs.
owner_answer:
Julia, we are sorry to hear this! We can look into the move-out charges in detail. Please get in touch with us via email at hello@smilestudentliving.com. Any information regarding the apartment's condition at move-in will be helpful when we address this issue.

The Smile Student Living Team

name: Smile Student Living
review_text:
My worst move-in experience in 4 years.

Firstly, we were promised a clean and fully done-up apartment at the time of move-in; however, we experienced several issues instead: it was dirty at the time of move-in, appliances were not working properly, the bathtubs and bathroom sinks were dysfunctional for a full week, doors were not opening/closing properly, ethernet ports and AC vents were broken, etc... After a whole month of submitting maintenance requests and regular in-person complaints at the office, they finally managed to conduct most repairs.

Not only that, but the AC has been dysfunctional for 6 weeks now with a broken portable unit and ventilation systems - we had it "fixed" 3 times, but each time, the fix only lasted for a single day. This is the fourth time we have requested a repair, and despite promising to get it fully working last week, not only is it still broken but also no-one has come to conduct the repairs. I think there is the issue of accountability since Smile outsources their repairs to third-party vendors who shift the blame back onto the landlord if something is not fixable, and Smile shifts the blame back onto the maintenance team and/or third-party vendors. This recurring pattern
is ongoing even now.

Lastly, each roomate was promised a $100 Amazon gift card at the time of move-in, which we still haven't received. Eventhough I can understand minor delays due to purcahsing a large number of gift cards, 6 weeks and still nothing is definitely pushing it.

I hope someone from Fairlawn/Smile reads this and takes action to resolve our issues as soon as possible.
owner_answer:
Rahul,

Yes- we read this and are taking action to fix your situation. Based on the submitted work orders, the requested screen repairs were completed, along with the door handle on the balcony coming off. It looks like the AC work orders were opened and closed, but we are still working on a permanent solution for the latest AC issue you are having. I reached out to the maintenance supervisor to take a look, and you should get an update soon. I reached out to the leasing manager to evaluate the execution of leasing specials to ensure your distribution. You should also have an update on that soon.

We are sorry you feel like you are getting the run-around! We are working on bridging the communication gap. Thank you for your feedback, and please reach out to hello@smilestudentliving with additional concerns you may have.

The Smile Team

name: Smile Student Living
review_text: Good leasing agency with quick follow up time. Lots of activities and giveaways available. Affordable housing with good amenities and many perks

name: Smile Student Living
review_text:
Edit (09/26/2022):
One month after I moved out  (09/01/2022), they charged us with a cleaning fee, and threaten to send unpaid fee to a debt collector at the end of the month (10/1/2022 ) and therefore harming our credit score.
Also they explicitly mentioned that they are handling security deposit disputes ONLINE and not allowing phone or in person conversations.
So I tried emailing them to dispute some of the charges as those charges seems unreasonable on 09/02/2022. Try guessing how long it takes for them to reply me? 1 days? 2 days? Or maybe 1 week? No, it takes them 19 days (09/20/2022) to reply me.

Since I am a subleasing the apartment, some of the damages were there when I moved, so once again I email them to ask about that, since the original tenant is not responding to my email. Of course, I received conflicting information from them and I'm still waiting for their reply.

End edit (09/26/2022)

Subleasing an apartment with them, sent an email inquiring about payment method for weeks and got no reply. Went into the office and was told to send an email to them regarding this issue.

In the contract it mentioned that there is a parking spot available, but nope, you have to pay extra for it and it's not mentioned anywhere in the contract.

Additionally internet is down for a few days now, called their maintenance team on the day it started and provided no help so far. I have to call the ISP myself to fix it.

This is only my second week with them, I can't imagine what will happened if I were to sign a whole year lease with them.
owner_answer:
We are sorry that we did not meet your expectations. Our team will investigate these matters and reach out to you with an update.

Update: We are sorry to hear this! We would like to address all of these issues you mentioned. We do not have anyone with this name in our system. Can you please email us at hello@smilestudentliving.com?

name: Smile Student Living
review_text:
this company is the absolute worst. my daughter and her roommates are in an apartment with a mess of a parking garage (holes in the ceiling, debris all over the ground) even though shes being charged full rent for a space that doesnt even come close to expectations for a safe, clean parking area. her roomate got money taken out of her account (she has automatic payments set up and they took money out in the middle of the month which caused her to be overdrawn and then had to work way too hard to get the money returned) and cant tell you how many times theres been misinformation and lack of any type of customer service. yeah rent is cheap but its not worth the headache. save yourself the stress and rent somewhere else.

**edit since i cant reply directly to the response**
i have already called, emailed and my daughter has gone in person for the last month. theres been nothing but unhelpful and contradictory information. no solutions and no consistent responses, depending on who you talk to, you hear different info. garage looks like a dump, resident cars parked on the street level [we were told every.single.time those spots are only for commercial vehicles]and the fact that youre charging full rent for this kind of parking...

name: Smile Student Living
review_text: Trying to find an apartment remotely is a challenge to say the least. Fortunately Eric was extremely helpful, open, and transparent throughout the whole process. He was always available to answer our questions and constantly kept us apprised on new available units. Really great to work it.
owner_answer: Kate, thank you for the kind words about Eric! We know how difficult it can be to rent an apartment remotely. We are glad our virtual process worked out for you! Have a wonderful day! - The Smile Team

name: Smile Student Living
review_text:
Smile(formerly Fairlawn) seems to be one of the better places to rent from on campus and I enjoyed my year with them. The apartments on Clark all are quite nice; the leasing agents and showing staff are super friendly and will be honest with you when needed. I did not find there to be any mold, rodent, or bug problems where I stayed, which you cannot say in a lot of places at UIUC.

The only things I did not enjoy was generally a lack of communication - when I submitted maintenance requests they would generally just randomly come in while I was gone a few weeks after I submitted it, do the repair, and not tell me or respond to the request; so it was always a surprise. I also rented a parking spot and 5 or 6 times in the year I would come home to one of their vehicles parked in it, and while they were friendly and quick in fixing it or giving me an alternate spot for the day, it became frustrating, especially because a few times they claimed it was not their vehicle and told me to tow only to find out it was maintenance they had hired. In the spring, they showed my apartment 10+ times in the span of two weeks and while they were apologetic about it, I believe I live in a complex full of studios so it became frustrating being basically the model apartment. Comparatively though, these issues are minor for an apartment on UIUC's campus.

I never had any major issues here, and the price I pay on the lease is very fair for a studio. If you're looking for a solid choice to rent from, this is one of two or three agencies I would actually recommend.
owner_answer:
We are grateful that you took the time to leave us a review, Allie. One of our core values is Always Improve, and your feedback will help us improve service for everyone! Thank you. Have a wonderful day!

The Smile Student Living Team

name: Smile Student Living
review_text: One of the better places to rent from on campus! I’ve been happy with my apartment for the amount I’m paying. They are a little slow on maintenance requests though
owner_answer:

Our maintenance team will be out to address the issues as soon as they are able. Currently, we do not have a work order for your windows. We can send the team to remove the wood so they can open. Don't hesitate to email us at hello@smilestudentliving. We will enter the work order on your behalf. Thank you for your feedback.

The Smile Student Living Team

name: Smile Student Living
review_text:
Moved into one of their apartments, and basically, everything is broken. The A/C unit is non-existent. The water boiler is not functioning. Additionally, when I was away for no more than three days, the landlord or maintenance team came into the apartment and installed annoying and useless portable air conditioners. As a matter of fact, they installed them with DUCT TAPE. They installed them improperly and without permission, not even a 24 hour notice. From my understanding, this offense is legitimately lease breaking as it's against the law. This is not in the lease agreement, specifically when it comes to the a/c. It is unlivable here. - Yehya Chehab (pictures attached, wish I had one before removing the portable a/cs)

EDIT: I didn't explain the portable a/c situation well enough. They were not secured properly, so they were blowing hot air and cold air at the same time. The duct tape was not necessarily the problem but the poor installation.
owner_answer:
Yehya, we are sorry these items were not working at move-in. Our team was unable to complete the work on the AC. We needed to have a vendor complete this request. In the meantime, we did not want to leave you with no AC in the apartment and installed the portable units. We will do our best to communicate when our team is out. If you want to be notified before we enter, please reach us at hello@smilestudentliving.com. We will add this note to your account for future maintenance requests.

The Smile Student Living Team

name: Smile Student Living
review_text:
Great spot, great neighbors, decent price
There really isn’t much that I can complain about. Sure maintenance may take a tiny bit, but nothing crazy to where you need to wait a long time. Nice staff and gym!!
owner_answer:
Jose,

Thank you for your kind words about our community. I know our leasing and maintenance team appreciate the feedback. We are so excited about our gym and we are glad the location works out for you!

Smile Student Living

name: Smile Student Living
review_text:
I am not sure how to comment on this company. There are literally holes on the walls during the winter in my apartment, and I/my roommates requested maintenance and it took forever for them to respond. The water shut off twice without prior notice when I was showering and it was freezing cold. They also charge a lot of money if you want to add people into the contract or to sublease it and they held absolutely zero responsibilities but to initiate the contract... I am not sure how it works but it is absolutely the worst, worse than CPM.
i also think it is important to note that as i moved out they charge me and my roommates over 600 dollars for cleaning but everything was clean. I even have a video of proof. And unffortunately i am living with smile again this year and nothing was cleaned at all when I moved in. The attic and the basement of the house are full of trash. So here is the thing, take pictures of anything that is broken and not clean and make sure save them in a secure place because SMILE will definitely charge you for those fees that has nothing to do with you. Also force them to fix things for you, because you did not break them, so they have no rights to charge you at the end of the semester.
owner_answer:
We are sorry that we did not meet your expectations. Our team will investigate these matters and reach out to you with an update.

Update: We are sorry to hear this! We would like to address all of these issues you mentioned. We do not have anyone with this name in our system. Can you please email us at hello@smilestudentliving.com?

Smile Student Living Team

name: Smile Student Living
review_text: Worst realty ever. They increased price on apartments taking advantage of students. A fire detector in my apartment started beeping heavily  they declined to send someone over immediately. I had to spend night in hotel. Its better to be homeless then live in smile apartments
owner_answer:
We are sorry that we did not meet your expectations, Nimisha. We do not see a work order for the fire detector in our system. We want to look into the issue to see what happened and prevent something like this. Please get in touch with our team at hello@smilestudentliving.com.

The Smile Student Living Team

name: Smile Student Living
review_text: It was a good experience living with smile. I'm renewing my lease with smile for this semester too. The maintenance requests were completed on time with minimal follow-ups. Overall, I would recommend smile to people.
owner_answer:
Preksha,

First, thank you for renewing with Smile Student Living! We love building relationships with our tenants year after year. We are also glad that our maintenance team provided excellent customer service! We appreciate the recommendation from you.

The Smile Student Living Team

name: Smile Student Living
review_text:
I am currently subleasing my unit from someone else. Everything in throughout that process went really smooth and the staff have been really nice about everything (from the subleasing process, to maintenance requests, to transferring to another unit for next semester).
They were also super flexible with the leasing for next semester, I only needed it for 4 months and they were willing to only charge me the 4 installments which is rare around here. Their units are affordable for the attention and amenities they provide. Would 100% recommend living here!
owner_answer:
Hi, Jocelyn. Thank you for leaving us a review. Your feedback means a lot to us. We're delighted we were able to work with you to find the perfect option for you! Have a great day.

Best,
Smile Student Living

name: Smile Student Living
review_text: I really appreciate that Smile Student Living helped me out and let me move in so quickly. Their team are always professional, helpful, and highly efficient. Matthew gave us a very nice in-person tour and a lot of useful information. Yael, Jennifer, and Matthew answered all my questions and addressed all my concerns and requests.  The apartment is in a good, neat and clean condition.  I love living in it. The maintenance staff (Jeff) is also very nice and professional. The issue was fixed timely and satisfactorily.   I would highly recommend Smile Student Living.
owner_answer:
Hi, David. Thank you for taking the time to leave a review. We appreciate your feedback. We're thrilled you had such great experiences with our team! We have made Jeff aware of your kind words, too. Have an amazing day.

Keep smiling,
Smile Student Living

name: Smile Student Living
review_text: Smile Student Living provided excellent customer service. They were always very quick with responses and provided detailed answers to my questions. The residential portal they used was intuitive and efficient when compared with some competing leasing agencies choices of software. They offer many fantastic, and in my opinion, underrated living options. This is especially so for living near the engineering quads. I lived at 510 East Stoughton for the 19/20 year. This was a great quiet location only a five-eight minute walk or so from Grainger and the MEL. I had many 3am walks back from Grainger happy to know I only had to go a couple of blocks before I'd be home.
owner_answer:
Hi, Steven. Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review. We're glad you liked our resident portal for online payment and maintenance and the location of your apartments! Thanks for being a Smile resident! Good luck on all your future endeavors Steven!

Keep smiling,
Smile Student Living

name: Smile Student Living
review_text: Our Tour agent Eric Kwok was very nice guy, knew every single detail about the apartment, and did the tour in the best way possible. Told us about every single thing that we could ask before even asking! Thank you!!

The Smile Student Living Team

review_text: Megan was very helpful and understanding of our maintenance issues!

We're delighted to hear about your positive experience with Megan. Providing excellent service to our residents is our top priority. We are glad you are here! 

- The Smile Student Living Team

name: Smile Student Living
review_text: Maintenance has been very quick to respond to every issue we have had, though it is difficult to get in contact with the leasing office and the apartment hadn't been cleaned when we arrived for our early move in. Overall, the company has taken care of any issues in a timely manner.

name: Smile Student Living
review_text: Location is good and the house is nice. Haven’t had any problems so far, but I’ve heard service can be slow or non-responsive, so be weary. If you don’t have any issues, though, Smile is great.

name: Smile Student Living
review_text:
I have been leasing for Student Smile Living for about a month now and I have received outstanding service since I started the application process. The application process was easy and fast! Any discrepancies that I have had, has been handled in a timely manner and with care.

Maintenance is always fast and they get the job done, the right way!

I always contact Jennifer Rooney if I have any concerns or questions and she always gets right back with me. She is always diligent in solving a problem and treats me with the upmost respect and kindness. This kind of customer service is deserving of recognition, especially in the real estate field.

Thanks Jennifer and the entire smile leasing team, you guys Rock!
owner_answer: Hi, Dante. Thank you so much for this amazing feedback. We appreciate you taking the time to leave this review! We're so glad you enjoyed the leasing process and Jennifer's great customer service! We will be sure to let Jennifer about this great feedback. Have an amazing day!

name: Smile Student Living
review_text: Though we didn't eventually sign with this leasing company, they were VERY helpful when we were asking for MANY tours. I would like to especially thank Neal who was really honest with any building and gave great advice towards which buildings he thought fit our needs. The con I see with signing is that their buildings are inherited from CPM (One of the worst leasing agencies out there) that show mold and cracks everywhere. I don't blame Smile for this though since this is their 2nd year with these buildings but in my opinion, you should wait for the renovations to be complete before signing.
owner_answer:
Thanks so much for giving us your take on how we are doing. We're glad that customers like you are having a great showing experience with Neal! We're excited for all of our renovations to be complete! Please keep us in mind for the future. Have a great day!

The Smile Student Living Team

name: Smile Student Living
review_text:
I moved in with smile about 2.5 weeks ago. Had a great experience during the entire leasing process with Jen and Sam. They were very patient when I wanted to check out multiple available units in the building and also very responsive to my emails and texts - balanced mix of professionalism and friendliness. They even let me move in a day earlier than the rental duration at no extra cost.
Smile also left me a goodie bag at move-in which I haven't seen elsewhere. Its makes one feel welcomed I believe and comes quite handy the first few days after moving in. I haven't had a lot of maintenance issues so far. But the ones I had were dealt well and promptly. Only thing is the internet isn't the best (Except for video streaming and calls not going very smooth, its fine for doing most browsing work ) but otherwise have been very happy, overall.
owner_answer:
Hi, Chandana. Thank you for leaving us a review. We're glad we were able to find you the perfect apartment to call home. We're so thrilled your move in went smoothly! Thank you for the note on the welcome bag. Each one was filled with joy by our team! Thank you again. Have an amazing day!

Keep smiling,
Smile Student Living

name: Smile Student Living
review_text: 8/22 No air conditioning, washer has been broken since move-in a week and a half ago. Put in multiple maintenance requests and they have done nothing. Do not rent with Smile Student Living.

We will be by to remove the portable AC unit we installed. Don't hesitate to contact us at hello@smilestudentliving.com if you need anything.

name: Smile Student Living
review_text: Originally my roommates and I signed a lease with jsm that was later transferred over to smile student living. Our experience with them so far has been great. They are simply one text away and are very responsive and nice people. We’ve already signed a lease for the following school year, and they were more than willing to listen to and work with us. Overall, my roommates and I are quite happy and definitely recommend checking them out.

Thanks for taking the time to leave a review. We're looking forward to having you stay with us for this next school year! Thanks again and have an amazing day!

Best,
The Smile Student Living Team

name: Smile Student Living
review_text:
I looked at four buildings before picking a unit (my second choice because someone signed my first choice 15 minutes before I was going to, but that’s understandable).

That being said, when I toured the unit in which I ended up signing I was assured the unit would be cleaned up before I moved in. Yet it was not. The couch was in disarray and adhesives still on walls from previous tenets. When I removed the adhesives, the paint came off with it.

I was also comforted by the representative telling me they could get early move-in fees waived, which didn’t happen. So, I paid all my fees and rent before moving in, then checked the online portal a few days later. It stated that I haven’t paid rent and was accumulating fees daily. I immediately reached out to the team to reconcile the situation. I got a prompt response saying they’d take care of it. Then about a week later I got a message from them asking if I forgot to pay for rent and to pay them immediately!

A few weeks after moving in I blew a tire in the parking lot, which was very costly. After inspection, the parking area was covered in broken glass. Again, I immediately contacted the team letting them know of the issue. It took them two days to send someone out to clean it.

The unreliable internet doesn’t help.

It’s been a bumpy first month with Smile Student Living so far, but the team is very respectful. And Jen is very prompt and tries to mitigate problems, but I think there might be a lack of communication within the company right now with everything going on. Yet I do look forward to working with Sam, Jen, and the rest of the team moving forward.
owner_answer:
Dear Jordan, thank you so much for the feedback!  We’re so sorry for the miscommunications, thank you so much for your patience. We’re sorry you’re having problems with your internet, we will follow up with Pavlov immediately. Thank you for living with Smile, we look forward to making the rest of your year perfect!

Keep smiling.
Smile Student Living

name: Smile Student Living
review_text: I had an amazing experience touring and signing a property with the help of Lori and Sam from Smile Student Living. While Smile is a relatively less known property management company on UIUC campus, all processes and staff were very systematic and professional. Additionally, they were willing to be flexible and work together with my roommate and I to find a lease that accommodates to both of our needs. Lastly, both Lori and Sam kindly, promptly, and proactively addressed my numerous questions and concerns throughout the process. I'm glad and excited to be living with Smile this upcoming semester.
owner_answer:
Sarah,
Thank you for your kind review! Lori and Sam are amazing team members that strive to provide the best customer service. Our portfolio is growing across campus, and it is our priority to make the leasing process seamless and a wonderful experience. Thank you again for taking the time out of your busy scheduled to leave us a review!
The Smile Student Living Team

name: Smile Student Living
review_text:
Living here in 108 e healey almost 13 years i never had any issues but right now I've some problems they are doing renovation and i know they will not continue leasing in same building after 1 years so i wanna took my family out from there and I've 4 months left over leasing i wanna terminate and take my family out from there so i went to office and ask to manager he directly say no no you can't there's no possibility to terminate lease oh comon man am not trying to run ok just being honest and try to take my family out from there because of there renovation next year.
.but they want to pay our all (lease fees 4months) we live there 13 years and paying rent in time as well and i just wanna terminate just  4 month lease. they were like this is business and we don't care and also i ask them to paint the room because it's so fade color and feels really upset when you enter ,,again i talked to manager they were like oh ok but we don't paint the room comon man i pay rent for that and i need all services that you provide but they ignore anyway i will tell all people don't do lease sign on this company such a poor service with poor management team so sad !!!
owner_answer:

name: Smile Student Living
review_text:

One bad thing is the lack of garbage control. There’s no real cans or dumpsters for tenants to use and the parking lot is loaded with garbage.

name: Smile Student Living
review_text: This company is unprofessional. They are not all on the same page within the leasing office. First they told me that I wants able to get parking on my unit because of construction. However, when I got here there was no construction going on and there were plenty of available parking spots in my unit. Then prior to me moving in I had to set up the water in my name. However, two months in, the company sends me a water bill, even though I have been paying my water bill directly. They are not willing to work with you at all. I would not suggest anyone moving into this leasing company.

The construction in the area was our brand new building next door. We wanted to make sure that allowed space between cars and the construction. We believe we have worked out the issues with your utility payments, however, do not hesitate to reach out to us at hello@smilestudentliving.com if you need anything.

Best,

review_text: I was helped by Jen, and she was extremely helpful in answering my questions right away and clearly.  She even gave me a virtual tour of my apartment and made me feel very welcome. However, if you do like haunted houses this is a great place, the lights will flicker when you open the fridge or flush the toliet, and the internet will run at a tenth of the advertise 100Mbs/s. Maybe just a one off experience, but expected better from a brand new mangement company on campus (octave did fantastic last year)

If I were you I’d stick to Roland Realty; great service and they don’t fleece students!!!

We at Smile wish you the very best, and we hope we have the opportunity to serve you again one day.

name: Smile Student Living

name: Smile Student Living
review_text:
Avoid Smile like the plague if you have the option. Their property management is horrible.

I have been staying at one of their apartments (606 E Stoughton St.) since August and they have continuously failed to provide adequate duty of care to their tenants.

Some examples of their failures (including civil liabilities that they are dodging responsibility for) include:

-For a two-week period, we did not have hot water in our apartment. This violates a wealth of habitability requirements, including Champaign's Rental Habitability Ordinance (Section H), and Illinois's Plumbing Code. We notified management the morning we noticed the issue, and they failed to respond in a timely manner.

-For the entirety of my stay thus far, I have had a crack in my ceiling that allows rainwater (and likely snow) to pour through. This crack also has mold. While we did not originally know that the mold-filled crack went through to the roof, management should have noticed this issue-- yet no one ever actually came to clean the mold. I had to do so myself. A few weeks after move-in (so early-mid September) is when it rained enough for water to leak through. I notified management shortly after, and to this day (October 31, a whole month and a half later) they have yet to fix this issue. This violates section A of the Rental Habitability Ordinance.

-The parking garage has been consistently decaying over the course of my stay. I witnessed a ceiling cave-in mere days after moving in (August 24), which should have alerted management to the structural issues with their garage, yet two months later, I and many other individuals have been finding these white splotches on our vehicles that do not come off.

While this is not an enforceable error, their inability to address the issue shows an excessive lack of empathy and a disdain for their tenants.

-Our unit originally had pieces of floorboard missing near the doorway leading out to our balcony. This issue existed at move-in and was reported at the earliest possible moment. Not only was this not addressed for well over a month, this issue should have been glaringly obvious to management when inspecting the unit.

Smile has consistently failed to uphold the minimum standards of care required legally, and refuses to adequately compensate their tenants, even for the issues they are legally culpable for.

Avoid Smile at all costs. In my opinion, they are morally bankrupt and a perfect example of mismanaged business that only survives due to their oligopolistic hold on college real estate. If you have any issue, to whatever capacity, they will do their utmost to avoid any sort of compassion, empathy, or responsibility for the living conditions their tenants are subject to.

Do not sign with this company.
owner_answer:
We apologize for the negative experience you have had with Smile Student Living. We take your concerns seriously and understand the importance of providing a comfortable living environment for our residents. We are currently investigating the issues you have mentioned and working towards resolving them as quickly as possible. We appreciate your feedback and will use it to improve our services. If you have any further concerns, please contact us at (217) 903-0440.

The Smile Student Living team

review_text: I think Smile is working on improving the community and that takes time. I love the staff and all the improvements they have made; I can't wait to see the future for them!

review_text: Absurd charges, reasons for keeping security deposit money, terrible internet, and 3rd world electricity. The 1 gigabit/s internet was more like 0.5 megabit/s in the rooms. And the lights flickered as the normal state like we were living in a 3rd country. If you opened the fridge, the apartment would go dark until you closed it. Beware if you have epilepsy, this apartment is not for you. Smile bought our apartment from JSM mid-year without any notice and we got the short-end of the stick.
owner_answer: Hi, Noah. I'm terribly sorry you were not satisfied with your apartment.  We were unaware of the flickering lights, and are taking action now to investigate this and correct it for future residents.  I am also sorry you were dissatisfied with the lockout charge and cleaning charge.  We will review our policies, as we always strive to improve our processes and our apartments.  We at Smile wish you the very best, and we hope we have the opportunity to serve you again one day.

name: Seven07
review_text: This place is a gem in the UIUC community. It is one of the top apartments for amenities and location. The thing that sets it apart is the staff; they take great pride in their relationships with students. They work hard to ensure it is a beautiful, clean and caring place.
owner_answer: Thank you SO much, Katie! We love hearing that you're enjoying your time here, and we are excited to have your son call us home!

name: Seven07
review_text: Seven07 is in a prime location for attending school here. The price is well worth everything that comes with it. The amenities are astounding, rooms and bathroom are in great shape, and most of all the employees bring amazing energy everyday. Air conditioning always works, never had a problem with washer or dryer, and storage for food is plenty for however many roommates you have. Coming here from out of state I didn’t know what to expect, but Seven07 made me feel welcomed and have a home away from home. Also indoor car parking for when it gets super cold.
owner_answer: Thank you for the kind words, Cooper! We are SO excited to hear that your experience has been 5-stars.

name: Seven07
review_text: I’ve been living at Seven07 for some time now, and I can’t say enough good things about it. From the moment I moved in, I was impressed with the modern amenities, spacious layout, and the overall quality of the apartment. The location is fantastic, with easy access to shops, restaurants, and public transportation. The management team has been incredibly responsive to any requests or concerns, making me feel well taken care of. The community here is friendly, and I’ve enjoyed the well-maintained common areas and the stunning views. Seven07 truly feels like home, and I couldn’t be happier with my choice to live here.
owner_answer: Hi Syed, we are thrilled to hear about your positive experience as a valued resident within our community! Thank you for the kind words.

name: Seven07
review_text: My fourth year here at UIUC, and Seven07 takes the cake on the best place to live around campus. Wish I found this place earlier. Fully furnished, great gym and sauna, study rooms, and so much more. Employees and peers are amazing. No need for a car living here, but if you do decide to have one, they have a covered 3 story garage for when winter comes.  Walking distance to all parts of campus and food spots.
owner_answer: Thank you so much for your wonderful review. We're thrilled to hear how much you enjoy living at Seven07. We hope to continue to exceed your expectations throughout the remainder of your time here.

name: Seven07
review_text: I’ve enjoyed my experience at Seven07 so far! It’s a little expensive but I like how close it is to Green St with Target and Walgreens being so close as well as a lot of dinner options. Several main bus stops are very close (only a few blocks away) as well which is a nice benefit. The gym is a great place to work out and I like how it’s just downstairs in the building. I like how quick with maintenance requests the staff is and I rarely have to wait more than a day or two to have the issue addressed which is important as some apartment companies on campus can take a while. I love the office staff as they are all so friendly and willing to work with me with whatever issues or questions I have.
owner_answer: We truly appreciate your positive feedback, Serena! We are glad to hear you're enjoying calling us home. We are always here to help, so please feel free to reach out with any questions or issues. Thank you for choosing Seven07!

name: Seven07
review_text: So far I have enjoyed every minute of living here. I searched several different apartments before settling on Seven07, by far the most pet friendly despite being located on Green Street. The busy streets nearby also don't produce any extra noise within the apartment. It is also very nice having many restaurant options as well as a few store options within walking distance. Very happy with my new home so far!
owner_answer: We're thrilled to hear you're loving your home at Seven07! We love seeing all the pets in the lobby. Thanks for sharing your experience, Colby!

name: Seven07
review_text: This place is truly HOME !!! I looooooove it here, the gym and sauna being open 24/7 has completely changed my entire life! All the amenities make the price worth it, and the location is the best. My view is beautiful , and the people at the front desk are so so helpful and always willing to take care of any problems. The study rooms have genuinely improved my GPA , and the events they throw make me feel so welcomed and at home. This place is a must for student living on campus, I would 1000% recommend seven07 if you’re looking for a great community with awesome amenities and beautiful rooms.
owner_answer: Thank you for your enthusiastic review! We're thrilled to hear our amenities and services, especially the 24/7 gym and sauna, have made such a positive impact. Our team strives to create an inviting community, so it's wonderful that you feel at home at Seven07. Your recommendation is greatly appreciated!

name: Seven07
review_text: Excellent amenities! Our 4x4 unit is incredibly spacious and clean. The staff is extremely friendly (shout out Niko). Overall 10/10, would highly recommend to anyone looking for comfortable, amazing housing!
owner_answer: We're overjoyed to hear your positive feedback! It's fantastic that you enjoyed our amenities and spacious apartments. Nikko and the rest of the team will be thrilled with your praise. Thank you for recommending us, we greatly appreciate it.

name: Seven07
review_text:
Freshman (class of 2027) at UIUC here. Seven07 was the very first apartment my roommate and I toured when we got here in August (we were looking for sophomore year places). Having never visited campus before, I was so impressed that apartments like this existed. The high-end feel of this place immediately got me so excited to live here. The location is near Green Street too so it was convenient. Even though we had lots of other apartment options lined up for us at the time, we decided to make seven07 our home in September. We chose 2x2 Type 4.

My roommate signed the lease before me for $1290. I was waiting for my dad (my guarantor) to sign his part of the lease. There was a delay on his end since he had spent the day in the hospital back home in California with my grandma, who was undergoing a breast cancer biopsy. He signed 2 hours after my roommate, but by that time I was told the prices had risen to $1310. Given these circumstances that were out of my control, I was upset that I had to pay more than my roommate for the same unit, and it stressed me out a lot. I had my hands full with academics and settling into college life as a freshman, so I let it go and accepted it.

Fast forward to November, seven07 emailed us a contract addendum stating that we were being charged the $25 premium price because they placed us on the 8th floor since they ran out of units on the lower floors. But my roommate and I never opted in for the premium preference in our original contract. It seemed unreasonable to me that we were being charged for the premium because seven07 didn't have enough space to accommodate us on the floor level that we signed for. During a phone call with the manager Nick, I explained to him my family context and why I had been feeling unsatisfied. He was very polite and listened patiently to what I had to say, reassuring me that my input mattered and showing me seven07 values their customers' feedback for improvement. He was able to give us a spot on the lower floor, so the premium charge was cancelled. He even generously made an exception for me to go back to $1290/month. I am very pleased with the way Nick went out of his way to make sure my issues were addressed. I am aware that seven07 is in very high-demand among the students, and it is highly acclaimed. They do care about what their residents say, and I hope they continue to do so in an effort to make seven07 better than it already is. I am excited to move-in sophomore year (fall 2024), and I am proud to call seven07 my home.
owner_answer: We appreciate your detailed feedback and are thrilled to hear about your positive experience with our manager, Nick. It's important to us that all of our residents feel heard and taken care of. We’re excited to welcome you home in the fall of 2024!

name: Seven07
review_text: I recently attended welcome week and it was amazing – the events were all so wonderful and was well-done!! The staff was beyond amazing and the amenities are phenomenal. This definitely made my day when all the residents were so welcoming and helpful. Very informative.
owner_answer: Our team strives to create an inclusive environment with quality events and amenities. The warm, welcoming attitudes of our residents are the icing on the cake! Thank you for your review.

name: Seven07
review_text: My daughter has lived here for the last year, and our experience has been perfect, from maintenance & cleanliness to the front desk staff & on-site security. Happy she is staying here another year - brings a peace of mind knowing she’s safe and having a good time. Thank you to all the staff for making me feel safe and her being happy.
owner_answer: Hi Stacy, we are so happy to hear that your daughter has had a great experience so far! Thank you for sharing your experience and being a part of the Seven07 fam.

name: Seven07
review_text: In comparison to other locations I’ve been to in Champaign, Seven07 is by far the most advanced living situation. Not only are the amenities top notch, but the community and workers are just as quality. I would recommend this location to anyone looking to maximize their experience at UIUC. The only problem you’ll find at  Seven07 is they don’t have enough space to fill all the people wanting to live here… sign a lease before it’s too late!
owner_answer: We greatly appreciate the feedback, Reed! Thank you for calling us home.

name: Seven07
review_text: I had a great experience with  welcoming week!  The staff has been nothing but a great help! It has been such fun, and the residents were knowledgeable and motivating, and also includes such awesome luxuries!
owner_answer: We're so pleased to hear about your positive experience during welcoming week! Thank you for sharing, Paige. We look forward to seeing you at our future events!

name: Seven07
review_text: Every member of the staff has gone above and beyond to provide a great living experience. Maintenance always responded to requests in a timely manner, management and front desk staff were kind in all my interactions with them, and I was accommodated throughout the entire year. The amenities were always well maintained and available. I really enjoyed the pool, the study rooms, the gym, and the fun activities they held in the lobby and activity centers (girl scout cookies in the lobby, valentines day treats, free food in the lobby, etc.). I also really appreciated the fast elevators. I didn't realize how fast they were until I visited other apartments and saw how long I had to wait. On move out day, the staff was extra accommodating by helping me carry items. They truly are the kindest people and it is clear they put in a lot of effort to give everyone a positive experience.
owner_answer: Thank you for sharing your experience, Ieva. We have enjoyed having you call us home this past year! Wishing you the best in your future endeavors.

name: Seven07
review_text: The Seven07 apartments are some of the most beautiful and functional in Champaign. The amenities for study activities, recreation and social interaction are excellent.  They offer a wide variety of floor plans at a competitive price.  It is in a terrific location near the UICU campus and downtown attractions. The  Seven07 is staffed with very knowledgeable personnel like Nick Moon.  Nick and his team are consistently professional, communicate well and are always eager to assist current residents, as well as introduce new applicants to the Seven07. This is truly a great place!
owner_answer: Thank you for sharing your experience, Steven! We are always here to help.

name: Seven07
review_text:
Seven07 is a 10/10 living space. From the staff, to amenities, and especially the rooms, the apartment complex is nothing short of excellent.

Highly recommend living here if you’re planning on getting an apartment on campus!
owner_answer: Thank you so much for sharing , Aaron! We appreciate having you call us home.

name: Seven07
review_text: The staff are the kindest and most reasonable people ever. Whenever I had a problem, they always did everything they could to resolve it. When my AC was broken (I had set it too low and it froze over), the manager herself came up and fixed it immediately. They let me and my sister use a cart even after we had moved out and one even helped us carry stuff. I looked forward to talking to them when I would pass through the lobby. Everyone is so fun and hardworking, I'll miss the atmosphere!
owner_answer: Hi, Kotryna. Thank you for the kind words! We will miss seeing you and your sister around the community.

name: Seven07
review_text: Gym equipment likely has never been maintained. The basketball court is essentially a sauna for half of the year since the A/C is turned off and locked off. The elevators buttons don’t work half the time, and there is nothing stopping non-residents from entering “secure” areas.
owner_answer:
Hi David, I appreciate you taking the time to speak with the team and bringing your concerns to our attention. 

Our gym equipment is tended to a minimum of once a week. If there are any issues regarding specific equipment, please reach out to me directly at nick.moon@liveseven07.com, as no one has brought any issues to my attention. 

The indoor basketball court has actively working AC.  The box is locked to prevent anyone tampering with it, but we would be happy to adjust it for anyone - just swing by the office and ask.

The elevators are secured fob access, allowing only residents to get up and down the building. Make sure you are using your common access fob to activate the buttons. We may reprogram your key in the office if you are having continued issues with your fob.

While we can not guarantee 100% safety, as unforeseen things can happen,  we have preventative measures put in place all across the community. You must have a fob to enter the building from any entrance, use the elevators, and access any apartment. Additionally, we have on-site security every night to monitor the main entrance and amenity spaces.

If there is anything I can do to help make your experience 5-stars, please  don't hesitate to reach out to me. We greatly appreciate you calling us home.

name: Seven07
review_text: The experience at Seven07 has been amazing.  We initially toured the complex and were impressed with the numerous amenities.  The pool and surrounding area along with the basketball court were the favorites.  The apartments themselves were clean and laid out nicely with all the space needed.  The manager Abby was incredibly helpful!
owner_answer: Hi Wendy! It's lovely to hear that you enjoyed your experience at Seven07! Thanks so much for supporting us with a 5-star review! We'll also pass this message on to Abby :)

name: Seven07
review_text: Looking for płace last minute one day was able to get into a room for a solid price. Building is beautiful and amenities are amazing to have. Shout out to Nick Moon.
owner_answer: Thank you for the review. We are happy to hear you're loving the community and to have you call us home!

name: Seven07
review_text: I can not recommend this apartment enough! The staff is super friendly and definitely make this place feel like a home. The amenities are top tier and you can not beat the location to campus! Highly recommend to anyone looking for housing!
owner_answer: Hi Maria! Thank you for the kind words and sharing your experience. It is our priority to provide the best environment for students to excel - both mentally and academically.

name: Seven07
review_text: They said they fixed the hot water problem but it is not fixed in 2023 STILL. In the morning there’s no hot water. I think they are just turning off hot water in the morning. And sometimes they just don’t have it for the whole evening. FIX IT.
owner_answer:
Thank you for reaching out. We truly appreciate you bringing this to our attention. We have taken immediate action and this issue has been resolved. This had nothing to do with the boiler and infrastructure, which we have previously repaired and have preventative measures in place to prevent any ongoing issues, but an issue outside the building. 

I would love to connect with you regarding your experience and how we can improve to ensure you have a 5-star experience. Please send me an email at your earliest convenience at nick.moon@liveseven07.com. 

You may reach out directly to me and the on-site team if you have any issues going forward and we will give the proper attention to any matter to find a prompt resolution.

name: Seven07
review_text: NO HOT water again. Staff says they SUPPLY LESS hot water during the holiday breaks because there are less people and told me to turn on the water for about a HOUR then there will be hot water. Is this a joke? Do some work seriously.
owner_answer:
We're truly sorry to hear about your experience. While during breaks, when less people are in the building, the hot water may take a little longer to circulate and reach certain apartments. 

However, we do not 'supply less' hot water during holiday breaks, or at any time, and have never instructed residents to wait about an hour for it. I can assure our team has never said either of these things, as they are not true.

I would love to speak with you to learn more details regarding this issue. Please reach out to me directly at nick.moon@liveseven07.com

name: Seven07
review_text:
Nice apartment! The bedroom is spacious and the building is very well located, I love the fitness center and the study lounge. Consider living here next year as well!

Also, the office staff are very helpful. I subleased the room from a friend and the whole process was very efficient.
owner_answer: Iris - We are glad you love living at Seven07, we are glad you are here!  We would love to have you another year with us, let's make that happen!

name: Seven07
review_text: So good so far. The move in process went smoothly, our room is really clean. The apartment, the view and amenities are great.

name: Seven07
review_text:
Last week me and my roommate visited seven and had the best customer service we’ve received. The tour guide was very thorough with the showing and stoped every so often to ask if we had any questions. When it came to explaining the lease and prices she was also very through and upfront. Everything was set and clear, I knew exactly what I was signing up for.
Lastly, the building was very clean and neat. I loved all the amenities that are provided specially the study rooms. No need to leave home to study in the winter. Seven is really a home away from home.
owner_answer: Thank you, Jessica! We love hearing that you had a great tour experience thanks for stopping by!

name: Seven07
review_text: I had a great experience with Nick at the Seven07. He went above and beyond by helping me make my decision and sign my first lease. Highly recommend!

review_text: An amazing place to live if you’re into great amenities, and great staff. 10/10 reccomend!

review_text: Living here as a student was great. Was overwhelmed at first but the building, Nick and other staff were welcoming enough to turn it into home.

name: Seven07
review_text: I have enjoyed my time here as a student. The amenities and everything about this apartment has been a great experience and it has helped me not only be better as an adult but as a student. I recommend moving into seven07 by all means.

name: Seven07
review_text: Great amenities, staff, and the apartment came clean with nothing broken. Good maintenance as well, and convenient location.
owner_answer: We are happy to hear that our team is providing 5-star service for you! Thank you for sharing your experience.

name: Seven07
review_text: Loved living here so far! Staff was always friendly and helpful with any issues / questions I’ve had. The amenities are a HUGE plus. The pool is definitely my favorite spot. Looking forward to another fun summer at Seven07.

We’ve passed your kind words on to our team. If there is anything else we can do, please let us know. We hope to see you again at our next event!

name: Seven07
review_text: From the moment I walked in, before my tour, I was greeted with a warm environment! I was immediately entranced with the beauty of the place. It was the clean space for me! It was the music for me! It was the staff for me! Everyone was extremely helpful and insightful with all of my questions. I want to specifically highlight the professionalism of the Assistant Property Manager, Kyle. Not only was he hands-on with my tour experience, it seems to me he’s a favorite around the place- for the residents greeted him fondly. I say all of this to say Seven07 is by far the best property I have toured. Also, it seems to me properties in the surrounding area need to take notes on their creative and innovative productivity. My sister lives here, and she has no problems with hot water AT ALL! She also renewed her lease because of her experience!
owner_answer: Cameron, thank you for leaving this detailed feedback about your experience with Seven07. Thank you very much for sharing these comments. We look forward to having your sister live with us for another year!

name: Seven07
review_text: Just had a tour of seven07 and the place was amazing. Very clean lots of amenities. The office staff were very friendly and helpful . My son is looking forward to his freshman year there.
owner_answer: Brian, thanks so much for the 5-star review.  We are looking forward to seeing you and your son this Fall for move-in.  If there is anything we can do to serve you further, let us know.

name: Seven07
review_text: This place was really nice! The people at the front desk were also extremely nice. Can’t wait to come back:)
owner_answer: Thank you for sharing your experience, Sophia! It is always a pleasure seeing you in the office & we cannot wait to have you another year.

name: Seven07
review_text: Absolutely blown away with the experience as a whole. My significant other and I took a tour with Brian and absolutely fell in love with the apartment. Since moving in we’ve seen the hard work and diligence of the staff who have been nothing short of welcoming with food and kind words. They definitely make this place feel like a home. As far as we’ve seem the hot water issue has been completely resolved. As for amenities the gym, tanning, and sauna are on point and the pool/common areas are so comfy and welcoming.  We look forward to the continued understanding and hard work they’ve shown for the remainder of our time here!!!

name: Seven07
review_text: Friendly staff, clean complex, top-notch amenities. Perfect for students looking to walk to campus and enjoy downtown living.
owner_answer: Hi Nick, Thank you for the fantastic feedback about the community! We are ecstatic to hear we have made your experience even better!

name: Seven07
review_text: very nice luxury apartments with great location. gym is very clean and the staff is very friendly and helpful. also has a pool and my personal favorite, a basketball court
owner_answer: Keyon, thank you for the glowing review! We are grateful for your kind words and are pleased to know that Seven07 has exceeded your expectations. Thank you for choosing to live at Seven07!

name: Seven07
review_text: Clean, spacious and modern apartments with all the latest amenities! Close to campus and secure building.
owner_answer: Hi, Aaron! We are happy to hear that you love our community as much as we do.

name: Seven07
review_text:
I'm sad to write this review since on a surface level, this apartment is great. I like my room layout, the furnishings, and the amenities. I wish the kitchen was bigger but the reason why this place gets a 1 star is due to the copious water issues throughout the past year, and the infrequent hot water that residents get. Whoever designed this building and the management responsible for maintaining it have failed to account for the needs of residents when it comes to water.

There have been instances where management have been aloof or straight up missing when there was no hot water in the building, with ice cold water coming from the tap, shower, and faucets. Getting hot water requires you leaving on the shower for more than 15 minutes, making it extremely inconvenient when you want a fast shower. In some cases, I have left my water on for 45 minutes with no hot water reaching my shower. It's always a gamble for hot water, sometimes you can get lucky and can get hot water in 5 minutes, other times you are waiting an hour. It's a waste of water and extremely disruptive to my daily schedule.

Management has promised a permanent solution is incoming but until that is apparent, this review will stay up. I have still not forgiven them for not putting an emergency number up when they closed the office down once for training and hot water for the entire building was not available for 8 hours.  I hope this gets resolved soon in the form of management reducing rent payments or compensating us in another manner because this has been ridiculous.

Update: it’s been a year but i never received any compensation for my issues. Because of this, I have left the review on here
owner_answer:
Rushil, Thank you for your updated feedback. 
Because we offered all residents two different accommodations for showering, there was no compensation offered.  We worked closely with our off-site vendor to get the hot water restored as quickly as we possibly could.  The issue has been resolved for over a year now with no additional issues or concerns.  If you would like to discuss your concerns in person, feel free to stop by the office and speak with any of the managers.

name: Seven07
review_text: Due to unforeseen circumstances, I was left in a position where I had to find a new apartment with very little notice. During this time, the community manager, Abby, was super helpful in answering any and all questions I had in a timely manner. The management team at 707 went above and beyond to accommodate my roommate and I. While I cannot speak to living here long term just yet, upon first moving in the apartment looks nice and feels safe. I'm excited to live here!
owner_answer:
Hi Anne, thanks for your feedback. We're glad we could accommodate your needs! We'll pass this on to Abby.
We look forward to a fantastic year to come!

name: Seven07
review_text: Although I am not a current resident, I was able to speak to the management hear and everyone is incredibly kind and helpful with any of the questions I had! They have great management and the common areas and apartments are very nice as well!
owner_answer: Emily, Thank you so much for this 5-star review. We really appreciate you taking the time to share the word about Seven07.  We’re here for you anytime you have questions.

name: Seven07
review_text: The staff, here are very nice! Abby and Kyle are very helpful , in the move in process, there are carts to help with the move in, I found the TV remote was missing but within very few mins of sending in a request on the app, someone came in and gave the remote.  Place was clean and sanitized.  Overall my first impression of the move in has been very positive.  I look forward to living here. Highly recommend for anyone looking for a place to live.
owner_answer: Hi Amit, Here at Seven07, we strive to provide excellent service to our residents. Please don't hesitate to let us know if you need anything else!

name: Seven07
review_text:
Live somewhere else if you want to feel safe and respected (and pay considerably less in rent). In the two years I lived there, the building had 40+ false fire alarms, one real fire on the roof, it flooded twice, we lost all hot water for close to 2 weeks, and the building was consistently broken into by people experiencing homeless who verbally harassed residents. Residents were not financially compensated for any of these troubles, were never provided honest and complete explanations for their causes, and problems were never completely solved. Management's favorite 'solutions' included blaming residents, and skirting responsibility.

Having the gym was nice, and the location was convenient, but you are paying for an apartment that is essentially held together by popsicle sticks and glue.

name: Seven07
review_text: Seven07 is a great place to live it’s been a great experience this past year. Staff is super nice and always have little events going on down stairs in the lobby! i’ve never felt more at home.
owner_answer: Madie, You've left a smile on the faces of our whole Team with your kind words.  Thank you so much for sharing this with us.  We're grateful to have you living at Seven07!

name: Seven07
review_text: Nick was so helpful when I called and asked about leasing and truly went above and beyond with the tour setting everything up and making sure I was satisfied at step
owner_answer: Thank you for the review and sharing your experience, Austin. It was great meeting you during your tour & we cannot wait for you to move in!

name: Seven07
review_text: My daughter lives here and all I've heard is great things. I visited for moms weekend this past weekend and it was a great experience! the staff is so friendly and the building is always super clean!

We do all we can to provide our Residents with the best service and experience, and it makes our day when Residents appreciate it.  Thanks again, and we hope to make your next visit just as positive.

name: Seven07
review_text: Spoke to Michael regarding my daughter’s lease recently. He was very helpful & patient the entire time. My daughter & her puppy have been enjoying their stay at seven07!
owner_answer: Parijat - Thank you for the kind words about our team, we’re passionate about what we do and it’s great to see that it translates into results for our Residents. We’re glad to hear that your daughter and pup love living at Seven07!

name: Seven07
review_text: I love the basketball court  all of the windows bring light into the court. Always clean and everyone is friendly.
owner_answer: We love our indoor basketball court too! Thanks for the review, Nikko.

name: Seven07
review_text:
The only good thing about this building is it's construction. The apartments are well made. But, the management is absolutely horrible. I have had issues with hot water from the beginning and the building as a whole wastes so much water to wait for hot water to come on is horrible.

The management is unresponsive and the owners are not taking responsibility for it. The residents were told that there would be compensation or reimbursement but there was nothing.

Not to mention the lack of security this building has. There is no one in the building after hours and anyone is allowed to enter at any given point. I have seen homeless men sleep on the couch of the lounge and threaten residents. The management knows this but takes no action for this. Packages are lost on the daily and the management seems to have 0 organisational skill at this point.

Overall, I expected a great experience but had nothing close to it. Would definitely not live here again. Hope that people living here next year at least get something as basic as hot water.
owner_answer: Aman, Thank you for your feedback. We strive for the best customer service and apologize we did not meet the expectation. We’d love to make this up to you and discuss your concerns in person to assure they are taken care of correctly. Please contact us at 217-294-6260 or stop by the leasing office.

name: Seven07
review_text: Seven07 has proven time and time again to be one of the best apartments in Champaign. Signing a lease at Seven07 was contingent on the fact that I'd be able to find a reletter for second semester. Not only did Seven07 find someone for me, but they also found someone to relet my friends room in a 4B/4BA apartment. Seven07 is also very communicative with their tenants letting them know anything they need. They also give specific deadlines and follow-up calls with every current resident about resigning for the next school year. Shoutout to Michael for making living at Seven07 a nice and seamless process. I would recommend this place to anyone looking to live in Champaign!

We strive to provide excellent customer service, so we’re glad that we were able to exceed your expectations. We hope to see you again at Seven07!

name: Seven07
review_text: I am in the process of looking at student housing for my daughter. My experience at Seven07 was exceptional. The leasing staff went above and beyond answering all our questions and explaining the process with great care and a warm and welcoming spirit. The apartments and amenities are stunning. I love the location and its convenience. Looking forward to move in day!

name: Seven07
review_text: Seems like a nice cool apartment building to live in would love to see pics of it
owner_answer: Thank you for your review, Christy! We would love to show you around our community in an in-person or virtual tour, so you can see all we have to offer firsthand. Give us a call and we can get you scheduled. If there is anything we can do to make your experience 5-stars, please let me know at nick.moon@liveseven07.com.

name: Seven07
review_text: I have been living at Seven07 for about 6 months now and I would not recommend it to anyone. Don't get me wrong, the place is beautiful but it lacks basic expectations for a standard apartment. For example, the wifi connection in your unit will be terrible, there have been multiple consecutive days residents have not had warm water, all amenities close after 10 pm, and the personnel is not friendly. Please be careful when looking into Seven07.
owner_answer: Caden, thank you for your feedback. We want to assure we are working diligently to get the hot water and internet connections resolved as soon as possible. All our amenities are open 24 hrs with the exception of the basketball court and pool deck.  These doo close at 10pm through the week and 12 midnight on the weekends.  This is simply due to noise and residents who live above the basketball court and those residents who have windows facing the outdoor pool deck.  Our office team would be happy to discuss this further with you. Please don’t hesitate to reach out at 217.294.6260.

name: Seven07
review_text: Seven07 was the perfect apartment for my senior year! I really enjoy using the amenities like the pool table, the grills, and the pool itself. The staff is also great and very receptive to any issues that do come up. The location is awesome, right off of Green Street and right by everything a college kid could need. I would highly recommend living here to all my friends.
